} } } Length:: 0:13 MinsI researched for a couple months after a package was stolen from my front porch. Twice. (Yes - same package). After reading and article in a newspaper forwarded to me by a friend, I decided to wait to wait for this one. I didn't like the quality and reliability (or lack thereof) of the wireless systems I'd seen. And I didn't like all the wires and proximity requirements of the wired ones. This, I believed, was the best of both worlds and I was not disappointed. I could not BELIEVE the ease of use, cleanliness of installation, and total quality of video from this camera. I have this, the 750e, as well as the 700i, and they are nothing short of magical. In the absence of flying cars, *this* is the future I had otherwise dreamed of. It's now been a year and half and I've had to reset the card on my outdoor one twice now and my indoor one only once. That's it. The process is simple and quick. I'm amazed with Logitech's ability to push software updates to the devices through their "Powerline" technology. I find their forums to full of articulate users and their updates to be well thought out and based on feedback. I am nothing short of impressed. I even enjoy their monthly news letter.I had the *opportunity* to submit my videos to the local police department when over a year later, another package was stolen. Although the perp has never been caught it is not because of the awesome surveillance system that I have created with my cameras. In fact, the police were very impressed with the quality and in recognized the kid two blocks away because of the video. However, when they came by to have me confirm his identity, I was too slow and the perp had left the bus stop where he had been noticed by police. I still see the perp walk by from time to time. It kills me inside to know they haven't caught him, but I know it will happen, and when the day comes, I will press charges. Besides, it's not like he'd outrun the police (see attached video). The video above shows the young man leaving our property with a wedding present from my grandparents (I never told them about the previous theft, or that I had gotten a P.O. Box as a result of the theft) as well as our custom wedding "thank you" notes.I digress. I must, however, add one more round of applause. I love love love being able to see the app from my cameras on my iphone, my husband's iphone, and our ipads. It makes going out of town much more of a comfort and it's pretty cool to show your friends and family the cat's view while we're away.*Note: I will try to link my i700 review here after I post it as well, as the video contains a much better view of the actual crime.

Reviews.Title: Security helped by system
Reviews.Author: Prof. Dr. Lorin L Cranford
Reviews.Content: The security cameras are working fine. I especially like the flexibility of the adjustments, particularly the motion detection feature. I set the cameras so that every little breeze blowing bushes would not trigger the camera, as well as the street traffic just outside the outer fence next to the street.

Reviews.Title: Easy hook up, good updated Mobile Apps (Android/Apple), but no network storage
Reviews.Author: Disciple of Hugeness "Keep it HUGE"
Reviews.Content: Extremely easy to hook up, and very pleased with that.  In addition, software worked well with Windows Vista and 7 Professional. I originally gave it three stars owing to horrible mobile apps, but these have since been updated, and are working great.We wanted the camera to tell us who is outside of the front gate. The concept was as follows: doorbell goes off, and then check the app on the phone to see if we need to get up or just let the postman drop the package off. Works great for that since the app updates.CONS:1) Lack of ability to store on a network drive - Why not?  We have an Apple time capsule, and the only way to get it on there is if I were to sync the otherwise retired Vista laptop that currently downloads the files to the TC. Lame.2) The website does not allow logging into the website with a mobile browser. So if you are thinking of just skipping the app and using a mobile browser (as you would have to with the Kindle Fire for which there is no app), you are out of luck!

Reviews.Title: Does what it says on the box, simple, works well, very nice features
Reviews.Author: C0d3r.N3T
Reviews.Content: For an IP camera it works very well, image quality is ok, very nice features (Infra Red night vision, Sound recording, email alerts) especially the remote viewing from my mobile phone.I am using 3 of them with a PoE switch which means you only need one cable to power and transfer data from the camera. Faced no issues with installation or running so far.There is also a good user forum provided by Logitech, which answered a lot of my technical questions before I decided to buy.The commander software is good, it allows easy reviewing of recorded video and management of the cameras.An improvement that could be added is faster FPS (Currently it is 15 frames per second - at least 30 fps would offer better viewing or motion). Hopefully this could be something that could be changed in the camera firmware, as when you install the camera the commander software checks the firmware and updates it if required.

Reviews.Title: Owned for 6 months now
Reviews.Author: Steven R. Hatfield
Reviews.Content: Logitech is doing an ok job with this product, but it could be better. In the past 6 months that I've owned the system, I have added a camera and had only minor problems connecting to the cameras from my iPhone.  Logitech has released a real iPad app that even has audio streaming, which is a great benefit.  The image quality of the camera is better than I would have expected at this price point, but not as good as advertised. The software is Windows only (.NET), so forget about running it on your Macs or Linux boxes without firing up VMware or VirtualBox. The external camera has been a real trooper... but...Here is where Logitech really shines though -> Customer Service!I had one of the external power supplies go bad on one of my 700e cameras (which is why I'm writing it on this item) and Logitech is sending me out a new power supply for free. I don't even have to send back the old one! It's a great day for customer service when they just say "where do we send a new one?" and take my word for it that mine died (which it did, unfortunately).

Reviews.Title: Good system, if a little fussy
Reviews.Author: Personne
Reviews.Content: Logitech has put together an interesting system for those who wish to do home security on a budget.  The user can start out with a single camera and grow the system by adding additional cameras as needed.  I've been testing a system with two cameras--one for exterior placement and one for indoors. Logitech's literature claims that the system can be set up in minutes.  While it's true that the software can be easily installed and started, it requires a lot more thought to get the system performing as needed.The key to the system is a chunky wall-wart.  It plugs into the wall with a cable that is connected to your home network.  This wall-wart acts as a  network controller for the cameras (which connect through house wiring) and as a web server.  Each camera has a wall-wart of its own, serving as both power supply and network access point.  Each camera comes with hardware that allows it to be mounted in any of several ways. The cameras provide both video and audio, and contain a memory card to store data.  This card may be replaced with a larger card for longer duration.  The exterior camera also provides infrared illumination, giving it reasonable night vision.The control software then allows you to set up the cameras.  Set-up includes naming the camera and setting motion zones in the camera's field of view.  The camera will only record when it detects motion in one of its zones.  There are several criteria for setting sensitivity, and they can be fussy. Once your cameras are set up, things really get interesting.  You can easily view live images from the cameras.  When the software is running, video is automatically downloaded to your computer from the cameras' video cards. From there it can easily be reviewed (it uses the H.264 encoder, the best combination for quality and storage efficiency).  Logitech has an $80 yearly subscription that will allow you full control of the system from any place in the world with a network connection. But they also provide a less-expensive (free) capability.  Whenever the cameras detect motion, you can have a snapshot emailed to you.  This is done by the system wall-wart and requires no PC intervention.  I must say that I find this pretty nifty.  Even those who choose not to purchase the subscription can still view live video over the web, by logging on to Logitech's website and entering a password.The part of the system that needs work is the software.  For one thing it is Windows-only.  There's really no excuse for that: both Mac and Linux systems need to be supported.  I spent a couple of weeks trying--and failing--to get it to work on my Mac using a Parallels virtual machine.  A real Windows machine is needed (I ended up installing Bootcamp--not for the faint of heart).  In addition, both the control software and web access require Adobe Flash. That works for now, but Flash is an old and unloved technology.  I do hope that Logitech will move to HTML5.  I also found that there are a few points in setup that unplugging, replugging and resetting may be necessary.  It can be fiddly.If the reader has stayed with me up till now, it's worth pointing out some important considerations.  These cameras are always on and are always available on the web.  A strong password and some secrecy are required, or there can be uninvited viewers watching both the exterior and interior of your home.  These views are available to Logitech, so one must put some faith in security measures taken by that company.  A professional thief will know how to disable the system (a baseball bat will destroy both camera and memory card), so unobtrusive placement of cameras is important.Late winter weather forced me to do initial set-up and testing indoors.  That turns out to have been a good thing. A permanent installation can take some time, especially when drilling holes and placing cables. It's nice to know how the system works before taking that step.  All in all this is a nice way to have some peace-of-mind on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: Poor frame rate and blurry video make this a poor choice
Reviews.Author: David Oliver
Reviews.Content: I purchased this system to monitor traffic down a private lane. The install went ok; I had to move the powerline ethernet receiver around the house to find a reliable location that could maintain connection to the camera.The big problem is the quality of the video. Even in bright sunlight, anything in motion is blurry. Forget trying to read a license plate or recognize a face (even walking speed is too fast). At night the problem is even worse, making even identifcation of the type of car that just drove by difficult.They should have spent more money on improving the camera and less on fancy software. A security system with poor image quality is a poor system no matter how many cool features the software has.I sent Logitech a support question asking how to fix blurry video. Their reply (below) was not helpful..."There is currently no way to adjust the frame rate of our cameras. It is set at 15fps.Thank you for choosing Logitech"

Reviews.Title: Better video than most pro security systems
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Israel
Reviews.Content: It recently received my Logitech 750E along with the indoor camera.  Overall, I am very impressed and only have a few minor qualms.I will start with the video quality which is REALLY impressive.  My son noted that convenience stores should use this system as the video is far clearer then what you see on television when some thug stages a hold up.  I was not expecting much in night vision mode but even that works very well.Setup is is mostly quick and easy.  A software update was needed but that took place automatically.  The PC side of the software is very intuitive.  As someone else noted, the biggest deficiency seems to be the limited ability to schedule when alerts are sent (or more importantly, not sent).  One important note about installation is that while the systems is billed as wireless, you still need to run power to the cameras.  This means you need to have an outlet nearby.  This proved a problem for me given where I wanted to mount the outdoor camera.  I will eventually relocate it but it means I will have to run some cable (and also purchase additional cable beyond what is provided).  Not a huge deal, but something buyers should be aware of.One of the ultra cool features of this system is the available Android app.  This lets you view live or recorded video and it too works really well.I certainly wish I had this system a few years ago when some Landscape Rustlers made off with some newly planted bushes from right in front of my house.  The video evidence this would have provided, would have let me bring those varmints before a hanging judge!Bottom line is that this is a high quality product that is easy to install and exceeds expectations.  A few shortcomings with the software which will hopefully be addressed in future updates.

Reviews.Title: How much?
Reviews.Author: Ron Branine
Reviews.Content: Shop around. I bought mine 2 years ago for $250.00. These are not worth more than $300.00 period. Amazon should choose better suppliers!!! The product itself is great.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Wang
Reviews.Content: I bought this but it broke after 3 month. The warranty is a pain in the neck. I answered a million of questions through email with their customer service. At the last step, after I submitted all the invoice and pictures etc, they stopped responding to my email. OK, I started another claim. They apologized and asked me to ship my camera to them. Today, I got my camera back, ONLY my camera, but I shipped the whole package to them! No power supplies, no network adapters, no SD cards, only the camera. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nice basic security camera that works with Mac's!
Reviews.Author: R. Surber
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, along with a second Add-On Logitech Alert for our house. The camera has worked fairly well during the six months I have had it. What I like most about the camera was its extremely easy installation. I plugged the wire into my ethernet and plugged the cord into the wall and installed it on the side of the house with the provided hardware.The camera works very well with my Macs and my iPad and iPhone after downloading the free app from the iTunes store.I use it predominantly on an old 2007 Mac Pro running 10.6.8. There are differences between the capability of the Alert Commander software for 10.6.8 and 10.7 and up. Most problematic is that you can't direct the movie files the Alert takes to a specific folder or drive under 10.6.8. It sends all those to your main drive in your "Users/Movies" folder. That is quite frustrating, as I would prefer to be able to dedicate an entire hard drive (secondary) to the movies and pictures. However, under later iterations of OS X you do have this capability.I like the fact that the camera does not appear to slow down my internet connection because it works over the electrical lines in the house rather than wifi alone. The pictures and movies it records are of medium quality... better than some security camera's I've seen. You can pan the area that you want to watch with the camera and set it to send alerts to  you if there is movement.I installed a 32 gb sd card into the camera as the standard 2 gb clearly would not be sufficient for long hours of recording. I leave the system on all the time and it sends me an email with a picture when there is movement. It seems to be very responsive to movement and will turn itself on to record the activity when there such. You can set the camera to the sensitivity that you want it to be triggered at for recording.It also has night vision, but I experienced a problem where once the night vision came on, it would not reliably revert back to regular vision during the day. So i have that feature turned off as we have enough lighting in the area where it is to get a good view of triggering events to recordings at night.The best feature is that if you have your computer turned off, the camera will still send you alerts. When you turn the computer on, the camera will then download the movies and pictures to the hard drive. I would like if the camera software automatically opened on its own without any input from the user. While you can set the Alert Commander software to open when the computer is started, you still have to click an "OK" button to actually open the viewing of the camera. This is problematic if you are, say on vacation and the computer restarts and there is no one there to push the button.Also, I have experienced some problems where the software will say that the SD card is not recognized and it has to be reformatted. This has happened several times... too many for comfort. What would happen if there were actual important recordings and the camera induced a SD card failure? This concern along with some limitations with the software, and unreliable night vision make me give the camera three stars, along with the fact that the recordings could be a little clearer. While the camera does have sound, it doesn't record sounds very audibly.

Reviews.Title: WARNING - you may have to throw this expensive camera away!!!
Reviews.Author: Lewis W. Miller
Reviews.Content: Warning!!!I've had this system for about two years.  While the software is clunky and sometimes slow, it usually does the job and the quality of the video is very good.  BUT...be warned that the clear cover over the glass lens is a coated plastic and the coating on one of my cameras has failed.  I called Logitech to get a replacement plastic and was told that Logitech does not sell parts.  So, if your camera is beyond the one year warranty be prepared to buy a replacement camera.  I personally opened the camera and removed the failed coated plastic cover and will try to fashion a replacement.  I had heard that Logitech was not a very consumer friendly company.  This is now confirmed.

Reviews.Title: 16 Cameras Now Supported !!!
Reviews.Author: Meiko "cat lover"
Reviews.Content: I had been running the previous maximum of 6 cameras since January 2011 while waiting for a promised upgrade that one of the tech support folks told me about. They have now upgraded the software (Nov 2013) to support a total of 16 cameras. I tried it by adding one that I already had and the installation was flawless. I have now ordered 3 more with night vision (2 external and 1 internal) and have plans for more. I also like that they now have internal cameras which are slightly less expensive than the external ones that now have night vision. When I started, night vision was not available on the internal cameras so I installed 2 outdoors and 4 indoors using all "external" camera models.This review does not show this as an Amazon Verified Purchase because I started out with an Internal Master System.  You can see my identical review posted there.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert
Reviews.Author: E. Pena
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get a nice security camera system for our beach house covering inside and out. After a bit of research, I settled on these babies. Very easy to setup and the features are top notch. I love that I can see live video from any place in the world with my computer or phone and the SMS and email alerts are great for knowing when something is happening. My only complaint is i with the video was true HD, 1080, not 720, but otherwise, the quality if really great. Night vision is brilliant. This is a pricey option but I think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert
Reviews.Author: E. Pena
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get a nice security camera system for our beach house covering inside and out. After a bit of research, I settled on these babies. Very easy to setup and the features are top notch. I love that I can see live video from any place in the world with my computer or phone and the SMS and email alerts are great for knowing when something is happening. My only complaint is i with the video was true HD, 1080, not 720, but otherwise, the quality if really great. Night vision is brilliant. This is a pricey option but I think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: NOT a Security Camera
Reviews.Author: JAC "jac"
Reviews.Content: Does NOT record Date AND Time on the video or file name, which makes it useless for legal use.Zoom feature is NOT true zoom.NOT recommended as a security camera!

Reviews.Title: Camera #2 of 3 camera system - Really impressive!
Reviews.Author: R. English "Rob English"
Reviews.Content: Logitech has really outdone themselves with this setup.  First of all, it uses your house electrical wiring to transmit the video to your PC or MAC with a clever converter.  When you install the operating software, it is extremely well thought out and gives multiple options for how the information is managed; you can get an instant jpg of what the camera is looking at sent to your phone(s) and/or email(s) (multiples in both cases if desired).  This camera's night vision is impressive and low light capture is astonishing.  Its very good quality.  What I think really makes this system great is the way in which the software application displays activity by camera.  You have a simple bar graph with darker colored areas where the camera(s) picked up and recorded movement of something in its field of view and lighter colored where nothing was recorded, so you don't have to fast forward through hours of static view video to see something.  You just grab the slider bar and go directly to where the camera recorded and watch.  Traveling or home, this system will instantly notify you of anything warm that approaches from out to 100' or more in the form of a jpg snapshot to your smartphone of what it is recording.  This camera system (3 cameras) are installed in the home of a family member who is a State Trooper that works night shift.  He has comfort knowing his family is safe and he can tap in and see what's going on or not going on from his smartphone instantly from anywhere on the planet.  That's a pretty impressive capability and peace of mind for someone that travels and worries about the security of his family in his absence.  Again, Logitech really thought this application through seems to cover all the bases.  Easy to setup, make sure you don't install any cameras prior to testing them.  We had a bad camera that would not power up and had we jumped the step where Logitech's installation guide says to test before installation, we would have been chasing ghosts troubleshooting for hours.  We called the 24 hour help line and they walked us through a few additional steps and testing to confirm the camera was bad, and then had Amazon send a replacement (overnight) at no charge.  That's service from both Amazon and Logitech!Severely impressed is not sufficient to express how great this system is for us.  Short money with big benefits.

Reviews.Title: Extra Eyes
Reviews.Author: LJ Vargas "Duncanboy"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Clear. Easy to add to the Commander list. The 1st 700n add on camera sent did not work. Amazon.com put me in touch with Logitech Customer Service. Spoke with Fernando C. Who was extremely helpful and walked me thru steps to try to get the camera to operate. Nothing worked. He sent me the proper UPS return paperwork to return the non-working camera. I received the replacement camera within 1 week. New camera installed within minutes with no problems. Love the capability of viewing the 2 camera's on my Ipad while away from home.  Don't hesitate to purchased.

Reviews.Title: this was a great camera while it worked.
Reviews.Author: A. loggains
Reviews.Content: bought this camera in Feb 2013 - it worked for 6 months. The power supply just quit working one day for no apparent reason.the camera still works when using a different power supply. Very disappointed it only lasted 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for the price!
Reviews.Author: A. Kouba "SoulVeil"
Reviews.Content: I am not going to go into all the features in detail, other reviewers have done this.  I am going to say that I absolutely love this camera.  We bought two, the master and one of the add-ons.  I can access it via an app on my phone, I can access it through my browser on my computer, I can access the live feed from my ipad.  We have it set up to save the footage on my computer which I can view at a later time.It is, simply, AWESOME.  The quality is fantastic considering the price, size, and set up.  If kids are in my yard I can easily tell who is who.  If people are moving fast however, you don't get real solid tracking but anything I've wanted to capture (kids goofing around) was clear.We've had this set up for about a month now and I am completely pleased with it.  We caught video of two of the neighbor kids throwing things at the garage.  I had video of the older kids being bullies to my youngest child when I had stepped in the house for a few minutes.  We were able to see the two people that ding-dong-ditched the house at 11pm.  The night vision is decent but you probably won't identify anyone that way, especially if they are moving quickly.  However I love being able to find out 'what was that' because when I'm not looking, it is.I seriously get an absolute kick out of reviewing the footage to pin point certain events.  When did the garbage can get moved?  When did someone throw something on the driveway?  How often are people speeding down my street?  We're down the street from a middle school and we have not only massive street traffic from that, but absolutely tons of foot traffic I want to be able to see.  It's done everything I wanted a security camera for.

Reviews.Title: Want it to WORK!
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: I had it up and running for a couple hours, knowing it was working I mounted the brackets outside, and installed. Poof it went blank and lost signal!!! I attempted all day to get it to work, removed tried different areas with the power outlets etc.  I am not a professional, but wondering why this is not WIFI/Bluetooth whatever you call it!  This electrical crap is very picky.  My outlets outside, I guess are grounded, and do not work with inside wires, so either I get an electrician in and put a new standard non grounded outlet or run wire to inside (Which can be done, but not neat).Day two is tomorrow, waiting for replacement Camera from Amazon, Logitech is not going to help me with this, its really a NO Brainer, just the electrical wifi through house is difficult.  But we will see if new Head makes a difference.  When It was working Great Picture, Wide angle Which NO ONE HAS FOR THIS PRICE...Two days later its up and running, works perfect, excellent video, WIDE LENS VIEW a PLUS! Vs everyone else's.  Its a Keeper and re-rated to 5 stars.  Plus a Bonus all the notifications via email and text for FREE!!!  It looks like Logitech finally has it right!!!

Reviews.Title: Clarity & Nightvision is exceptional
Reviews.Author: tom janiec
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my brother who's not too good w/ electronics and computer, and after setting up, I have to say i'm impressed with the clarity of the HD 720p lens.  Zooming in doesn't blur the image much, and getting alerts on smartphone is a nice touch.  Just replaced the 2gb micro SD card w/ a 32 gb chip, as the surveillance area has large tree branches that project moving shadows during windy periods, and thus took up more space on small chip faster than I anticipated.  We should be fine now, as I'm only downloading video every 2 weeks.  I'd buy another high-end model from Logitech again.

Reviews.Title: Th best indoor camera
Reviews.Author: Terry L Pitman
Reviews.Content: These Logitech cameras are really nice in that you just plug it in and you are done. They record to a memory card and though you can record on your computer as well, you don't have to.

Reviews.Title: Past Success Doesn't Guarantee Future Success
Reviews.Author: D. Long
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for new cameras to act as monitors for my two children.  I had extensive time with Logitech's Harmony remotes which I liked and I looked at Logitech first because of that experience.So, I tried the 750N Master System with two cameras - utter failure.  I am not technically tarded but the Logitech was a PITA.  It took me two hours to get one of the two cameras to work; most of that was troubleshooting one of the cameras that didn't work.  Once I did get the camera set up, it didn't matter because the lag time on mobile devices was between 20-30 seconds even though I was in my own home and tied to my wifi.  I researched this lag issue further and it seems like it is common and the fix was to buy third-party software (Blue Iris).  That's just Sad.Secondly, the cameras needing to be tied into the network via your home electrical system is an extra pain due to the limitation of not plugging into power strips or UPSs.  Having an old home with fewer electrical outlets, this was an extreme inconvenience.Ultimately, I would have dealt with these issues had there not been terrible lag on mobile devices. I mean, seriously, 20-30 seconds of lag?  I might as well be on a 56k connection.I quickly returned this setup and purchased two Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera.  The Dropcams rock.  Setup was five minutes and lag is 2-3 seconds no matter where I'm at and regardless of whether I'm tied into Wifi or not.I no longer have high regard for Logitech's products which is sad.

Reviews.Title: This camera exceeds all of my expectations
Reviews.Author: Gene C. Marshall
Reviews.Content: I bought (3) of these cameras (2) inside and (1) outside as the master camera. I purchased these cameras in part because of the excellent reviews by other buyers at Amazon.com. The cameras are very well made, and the outside unit is very solid and you can tell it's high quality.Set up of these cameras is a breeze. Loading the included firmware takes about ~10 minutes and then you just plug the cameras in a AC supply and you're up and running; it's that simple.Using the firmware you can adjust many aspects of the camera which I found incredibly easy to use and helpful in customizing the camera's function based on where it is located. .(inside/outside/specific needs, challenges of the area being monitored)Each camera comes with a 2GB micro SD card, which I would recommend upgrading to a 32GB for about $20.00ea. to allow plenty of extra space to record locally to the camera until you turn on your PC to sync to the home computer.In summary, this system is flexible, dependable, and very well designed for the money.  There is an app for the iPhone that allows you to monitor your home or business from any location. A GREAT home security system

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Scott Lemoine
Reviews.Content: I have several of these in and outside of my home and they are great. Great video and pictures in HD.

Reviews.Title: Not a good SECURITY camera
Reviews.Author: F. Lee "MKMR"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, wild angle view. easy to setup when using POE. give a 2 for following reasons.1. expensive. and network over power line adapters that come with this camera are totally junk and are not working, I had to buy a POE switch (another ($60) to make it work.2. web and mobile commander (1 year subscription) Logitech wants to charge you USD $79, what a joke. the software is very limited in terms of configuring your camera, and Logitech is trying to make more $ from their crap software. and if you use their free web viewer, they make you click a button every 5 or 10 minutes to continue viewing. Logitech, fire your marketing people, they are getting too greedy

Reviews.Title: High quality system and easy to install
Reviews.Author: H. Garcia
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with this security cam system. I love the easy installation, but what makes this system the best in the market is its wireless capability. Forget about wires and drywall repairs.

Reviews.Title: Various problems persisted
Reviews.Author: Dianne S. Elwell "Little Professor"
Reviews.Content: Purchased outdoor master camera (and additional outdoor support camera). Mounted Master high on front porch. Camera worked for about a week and had to exchange for new one. Second camera had to be reset numerous times which meant I had to pull out 20 ft latter each time. Finally camera stopped working an Logitech said they would send third one out. I returned it to store. Cameras are good when they work but after a couple of months they start to have problems. Phone support is very basic and after they exhaust their items to check, they suggest sending out a refurbished camera. They need better quality control of cameras. Now I have the second support camera which Logitech has disconnected until I purchase a new Master camera. Logitech has full control over the cameras including seeing what is filmed by them.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend to friends and family
Reviews.Author: R Pratt "Debbie"
Reviews.Content: Easy installationClear vivid pictures and video even at nightGood technical supportPatio cam needed returning but had no problem doing

Reviews.Title: Security 101
Reviews.Author: JacobHarder
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Logitech master system and this was our add on camera. We are very happy with the camera quality and picture. The sound pick up through the camera is amazing. Can hear neighbors talking 2 houses away. I guess I'll know when they are talking about us LOL. We intend to have a total of 4 cameras to our system so we will be purchasing more from Logitech. We did purchase a camera distributed through amazon and it was defective, but amazon took great care of us and refunded our money. I then purchased directly through amazon feeling more confident in their customer care. I will also buy our next camera through amazon.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up & remote monitoring with smartphone, not so great security.
Reviews.Author: Neal Ramlakhan "PMP NoiZ"
Reviews.Content: Have had the system in place for a year. I have two outdoor cameras which are aimed at the front of house and rear/driveway.Initial Setup: very easy, not much technical knowledge required just mount the cameras and plug into the wall. The software walks you through everything step by step. Everything from the motion detection, recording destination, and updates are fairly easy to setup.TIP: the best way to get the wire into the house is through the molding of the windows. If you can route the wire under the vinyl siding you can drill a 1/2 inch hole through the plastic window frame (this will not affect the windows performance and function). This also allows the camera to be plugged indoors rather than outdoors where its is not susceptible to being unplugged.Picture Quality is very good, much better than most IP security cameras out there. But the best feature is the wide angle lens. It allows you to strategically place your cameras and capture a wider range whereas you would require extra cameras with most other cameras on the market.The app is great for viewing, I have had it installed on a few andriod devices. There are times when the app will freeze or is unable to retrieve the video but those hiccups are expected from any product which is transmitting data through the internet. FYI, the iOS app allows you to listen to sound, but the andriod app seems to not have this.Beware: The mounts that are supplied are no the best. The extension arm and ball joint are very lose thereby causing the camera to rotate out of position. The best way to mount the camera to avoid it rotating out of position is with the treading on the top of the camera and have it hanging rather then sitting on the mount. I will contact Logitech to inquire if there is a new and better mount.Security Recording: It is sometime very frustrating trying to locate the recording from the camera. There are times when I waited close to an hour just for the software to DL the recorded video from the cameras. This can be improved and I hope the recent software update will address this issue.Planning to purchasing 2 other cameras to round out the system.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy set up, reliable operation
Reviews.Author: DayTexas
Reviews.Content: I have been operating the outside and inside Logitech cameras for about 6 months; they are great.Installation was very simple (they successfully use house wiring for interconnection).  I access with the Mac software which was very easy to install.  The system provides email notifications each time a camera zone is active (the size and sensitivity of the zones are adjustable).  I can access the cameras directly via my iPhone for live shots as well as archived footage triggered by zone activity.I use the audio feature on one of the outdoor cameras and it works very well.Over the winter I experienced a few minor power outages and the Logitech units came back up everytime when power was restored.  I have not had to tounch them for any reason.The cameras themselves are very well built and render quality images.  Resoultion is very good; colors are vibrabt and true.  The infrared mode is very sensitive and provides nice video in the dark.All in all this is a very good security camera solution.

Reviews.Title: Getting more from your System -You can use these with a POE injector and BlueIris
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like the cameras and the system. I have 6 cameras and at first my powerline connections were weak and camera connections would sometime drop or freeze. My house has crazy old wiring and I have a shop that is on different power. So for some of my cameras I skip the powerline connection and go straight to a POE router, like the netgear gs110TP, or in some remote locations I use a POE injector, like the trendnet TPE-103, which allows me a great Ethernet connection to the cameras. That seemed to free up bandwidth with the few cameras left on the powerline network. There are bandwidth test in the settings / diagnostics.Being a windows guy , I still prefer the Mac version of Logitech commander, it seems more stable and the UI is very good.I also use BlueIris to capture stills from the logitech cameras to use on a weather site. Running commander and BlueIris does not impact each other. BlueIris uses Logitech's RTSP protocol and it extend the value of the logitech system by allowing other uses besides security.I cursed my Motorola Homesight systems I had before this one, I am very pleased with this product and updates.Also using POE and UPS can also mean that cameras will work when the power goes down.

Reviews.Title: Easy install, good pictures
Reviews.Author: Jaxn Hill "Ragamuffin"
Reviews.Content: My husband installed this and installed the software on his PC and iPad -- now he receives alerts when anything moves in the driveway ... the picture is clear, even at night, the sensors seem sensitive. Seems like a good value and not that much trouble to install and get working.

Reviews.Title: Great to use to watch over kids during day!
Reviews.Author: working mom
Reviews.Content: After several months of use, I am completely thrilled with Logitechs product.  I tried several other "nanny cams" before settling on this system and this is BY FAR the best.  The first system I tried was Lorex, and it worked through Skype, which was nice, but then you could only view 1 camera, you couldn't toggle between multiple cameras, your computer had to be on ALL THE TIME, and there were no recording cababilities.  The second system I tried was WiFi Baby, and it never worked right despite multiple contacts with their customer service, and hours spent trying to set it up and work out the issues.LOGITECH is PERFECT - it does everything I wanted - records, you can toggle between cameras remotely (we have 3, and I definately recommend getting the night vision ones), you can hear sound great, it captures a very wide space), your computer doesn't have to be running for it to work or record (only your wireless router), and set up was A PIECE OF CAKE!  My only wish would be for the cameras to look more like Baby Monitors since I am using them to keep an eye on my little ones during the day, and it would be more discreet like that.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!!  Thank you Logitech.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert 750n
Reviews.Author: Dave Wahlquist
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a security camera system for several years.  I have purchased several cameras but for various reasons have not been successful in getting them to work with my Airport Extreme network and my Mac. The 750n system was up and running in a matter of minutes.  I have now had the system in operation for 2 months and overall it is working great.  Like all systems that have some complexity, it takes a little time and effert to get everything adjusted as you want it to work.  We have cats and a dog and now have the motion range adjusted so that they do not set the system off.Although the system is expensive, I do believe you get what you pay for.  Not only do you get the cameras but also the network devices.  The picture quality is excellent and considering the frame rate the motion blur is acceptable.  I have upgraded the camera memory to 16 GB cards and can store about a month's worth of data on each of my 3 cameras.I would give the 750n 5 stars if the system could be turned off and on remotely.  Alerts can ce turned off and on but not the overall system.I think some of those giving negative reviews don't fully appreciate the complexities of a system of this type.  Considering everything involved Logitech has produced a thoughtful, easy to set up and reliable product.

Reviews.Title: Software not reliable
Reviews.Author: forestman462
Reviews.Content: The camera works fantastic, however I have been having issues with the software / automatic upload.  The camera should get 5 starts, but the software provided brings it down considerably.  I have had the camera for less than a week now, and twice I have had "black out" periods where the camera has not uploaded video, up to 8 hours at a time.  My camera faces a busy street, so I know that it was not that there wasn't any motion.  Most of the time the video uploads just fine, weather or not my computer is on and running, or turned off.  But for some reason, sometimes it randomly just wont upload.  I have yet to figure out what the problem is with the software, I will be contacting Logitech soon, and I will update the review.

Reviews.Title: Works surprisingly well on a quirky old electrical system (and customer service is great)
Reviews.Author: A. Dirkse
Reviews.Content: I purchased this system almost a year ago now, and wasn't sure it would even work at my old farmhouse (which has a quirky electrical system, for example 3 different breaker boxes.) Surprisingly, it's worked quite well. I ended up purchasing 3 add-on cameras (for a total of 4), and have had very good luck with the 3 that are mounted on the doors of my house. The 4th is mounted on a chicken coop about an acre away, and that camera tends to have some issues due to low signal strength (but gets a great picture when it's up.)Initial setup was pretty easy, not much more than a couple screws and mollies, though your mileage may vary depending on the location -- I had some issues connecting to my camera that's farther from the house. I really love the fact that the cameras don't require a wireless or wired ethernet connection (just a wall outlet.) While they've had a few glitches and required the occasional SD card format, these cameras generally work great and give me a lot of piece of mind when I'm away from home (or there alone.)I contacted Customer Support for the first time today, almost a year later, because one of my cameras on the house was stuck on a firmware update and wouldn't reset. I was shocked when an intelligent human being immediately picked up the phone (NO automated menu or time on hold) and helped me through my issue -- he clearly knew the product well and wasn't just reading from a manual. Now, the camera is back up and running as usual (and just alerted me to a delivery guy.)No system is perfect, but I've had extremely good luck with this one and find it to be worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Just started using this, but am going to buy more!
Reviews.Author: Rangers68
Reviews.Content: Wow! This camera system is amazing! It's only been up for a few days, but I am loving it. The quality is SUPERB! Day or night, you are able to clearly see the image. You can adjust the sensitivity of the camera so that you don't get "fake" alerts for a tree or car moving down the street.The camera captures all motion for the areas you set and you can then review the files later on to see the images. The files also contain audio and it does a great job at picking up the sounds. Depending on how you position this camera, you can get a full wide angle view. Easy to install too!I use the Logitech app on my android phone and it is so cool (no audio though, only video). There is only about a 5 second delay in the feed and I love being able to keep an eye on my house when I am away from home. Yes, it is expensive, but it is worth it. It's a great quality camera and you would be paying much more to a separate home monitoring company. I will be purchasing several more cameras to put in different areas of my home. Again, I have only used it for a few days, but I don't foresee any issues with this camera. Very pleased and so glad I finally bought it after months of researching different options.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: T.Doherty
Reviews.Content: The cameras were easy to set up. I tried using the house wiring but the cameras kept dropping out. The house is a little old and they were long runs. I had better luck running the Cat 6 ethernet cables and using a PoE switch to connect the cameras to the computer. The soft ware is easy to use and install.  The picture quality is good for a still picture but if someone is walking or moving at any type of speed it is blur. The night vision also works well so long as there is no movement but try and capture a image of someone moving or a car, forget it, It looks like the Flash going bye. The camera works OK for what I use it for. I did not want to spend a lot of money on cameras so I guess I get what i paid for, but if your expecting to capture motion or see a license plate look for another camera, but you'll be spending more money

Reviews.Title: Giving up on Logitech Alert and WiLife
Reviews.Author: A. P. Parsons
Reviews.Content: I have been the best customer that Logitech could have.  I purchased 6 WiLife cameras and when the Alert cameras were released, I purchased 6 of them.  At this moment, 1 of the original WiLife cameras is working.  Four (1 interior and 3 exterior) of the Alert cameras are still functional.  This represents a lot of money and more frustration.  I like the Logitech interface and IPhone app, but there is no excuse for this many cameras to croak.For what it is worth, I am now trying the Foscam F19821W cameras.  So far the 3 that I have purchased work well, but I have only 6 mos of operating experience.  I now use Blue Iris for all cameras.  It is not the slick interface of the Alert Commander, but it handles the full menagerie of cameras that I am left with.BUT SEE, follow up comment below.

Reviews.Title: Nearly flawless surveillance system
Reviews.Author: Randy R. Henke
Reviews.Content: Logitech has a clear winner here for home and business owners who are looking for a reliable and effective surveillance solution that is easy to set up and manage. And from a reputable and trusted company as well.I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to voice my satisfaction with this system. I have never had a computer network related product work as flawlessly as this one. From the moment I opened the box, I had the first camera up and running within ten minutes. That includes perusing the quick-start guide and installing the software.I was immediately impressed with the quality of the video I was seeing. The frame rate is a bit low but more than adequate for surveillance purposes.The mounting hardware for the outdoor cameras gives you several options, including an extender arm, that should work in just about every installation. Once up, the cameras hold their positions securely.The software gives you plenty of flexibility when setting up motion-activated alerts. You can target specific areas in each camera's view as motion zones, thereby preventing waving tree limbs or pets from triggering alerts.Being cursed with no options for hard-wired broadband at our location, we are forced to use satellite broadband which usually wreaks havoc with any attempts to remotely access our computer. I was elated to find that all of our surveillance cameras were readily accessible from both our smart phones as well as any remote computer that we logged into our Logitech account from. The fact that our computer didn't even need to be turned on to remotely access the system was incredible.I did quickly realize why Logitech implemented the six camera limit that is inherent to these systems. There is a definite bandwidth limit, based on the quality and lengths of run of the electrical wiring being utilized. When you exceed that limit you will start seeing cameras drop out of the network sporadically along with slower frame rates. Our system worked flawlessly until the sixth camera was added. Subsequently, our furthest camera mounted in the garage would vanish from the network every few days. A simple reset of the camera would bring it back online. All in all, a relatively small glitch.We've had our cameras operating for a week now and I couldn't be happier. I avoided the hassle of running dedicated cables to each camera or having to deal with the reception issues so common with wireless cameras and have a first-rate surveillance system with exceptional video quality and remote access. Thanks for a great system, Logitech!

Reviews.Title: Bought system and two additional cameras
Reviews.Author: Mike Farkas
Reviews.Content: Buought this setup and install was very easy. Quality is very good and the system seems to work very well. I also loaded the iPhone app and it works well to. The first day my online view went offline but my local view were still working. I called the support line and they answered right away. No wait.  I have called the support three times now with questions and all three times they were available right away! That is a plus. Good system and good support....win in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Bought system and two additional cameras
Reviews.Author: Mike Farkas
Reviews.Content: Buought this setup and install was very easy. Quality is very good and the system seems to work very well. I also loaded the iPhone app and it works well to. The first day my online view went offline but my local view were still working. I called the support line and they answered right away. No wait.  I have called the support three times now with questions and all three times they were available right away! That is a plus. Good system and good support....win in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Wow, really works well
Reviews.Author: Howard H. Tessler
Reviews.Content: The instructions were easy to follow and everything worked right away.  I plugged it into a outdoor plug and so far there have been no problems.  Rain doesn't seem to cause a problem.  I will see what happens when we get a big snowfall but the plugs and instruments seem well-insulated.  It worked well enough that I bought 3 other cameras to cover the outside around our house.  Occasionally one or more cameras will stop sending images. Usually it recovers spontaneously in several minutes to an hour.  Logitech has a good community discussion group and have pros that answer questions-I think the stopping of images has to do with powerline problems.  It would probably be better to transmit over ethernet cables but that would take a lot of work in a house and the power line works well at least 90% of the time.  It is also nice to be able to see the images on my Iphone or any computer when I am away from home.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: frank f
Reviews.Content: Love the camera works great 99% of the time, it went off line this morning at 8:o1 am for no reason had to unplug all and reinstall power to all, why???  The customer service is very poor and the people that answer the phone like Alfonso T need to go back to school he did not know what my questions were and kept responding with soom off the wall answers. I finally got my answers for a computer programmer friend.  Why can I not access my camera live feed from another computer??? I don't care about the allert system as much as having a live feed (say at work or staying at kids home for a week or over the holidays) an wanting to see that the system is up and running and all is well.  Why can we not have FTP output to another computer, cust. service said you need web cam for that not a secutity camera, well I have 2 Foscam cameras and they are live on my web site to I can watch them anywhere in the world that has internet access.  So Logitech need to get with the program and fix this.  An hire cust service people that can do more than answer the phone and give people a bunch of crap and then want us to write a good review on them (good luck on that).If you are going to sit home and watch feed or spend all that money on an Iphone with the high monthly bill for service for motion view that does not show much and get alerts of bugs or bats, etc. flying in front of camera I would not buy another. Would buy if Logitech got in line with other secutiry camera co'c. and have software to view live feed on any web site I want not just logitech's.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, solid features
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased 2 dropcams for use in a home security/monitoring system. They were difficult to set up and connect to my network, and the video quality was just ok (when it worked). The Logitech Alert system by comparison, is great - easy set up, connected to my network quickly, the video quality is great, and I love the mobile options (you can view video from the web, any computer, iphone, ipad, android phone, etc). It isn't a perfect system but for the price it is very good. I have 4 cameras (2 indoor and 2 outdoor) and they all work great.Pros- easy set up (keep in mind it uses power lines as a network connection, so you need to install the camera near an outlet - this theoretically presents a security risk as somebody could just unplug the camera)- great video quality (including automatic night vision mode which works well albeit not as clear as daytime video)- fantastic mobile options (you can view video from any phone, tablet or laptop including mac, PC, android, IOS, etc - but it's worth it to pay for the annual subscription so you also have access to recorded video)- automatically archives the video from the SD cards in the cameras onto your PC (when the computer is on), but the cameras also auto record over old videos on the SD cards so they will never run out of space- email alerts are pretty customizable and notify you anytime the cameras detect motion (you can specify what hours to notify you and adjust the sensitivity)Concerns- They are pricier than some other networked cameras (including more than the dropcam)- The mobile viewing options aren't that useful without the annual subscription (which costs $80 and allows you to watch recorded video, not just live streams as in the free version)- the email alerts are customizable but fine tuning can be tough, so you may end up with dozens of useless emails, or if you turn the sensitivity down too much you might miss something useful- the infra-red LEDs that are used for night vision seem to attract bugs (even though it's not visible to human eyes), which can cause lots of emails where the camera detects motion from the bugsSome reviewers complained about the lac of a MAC application, and you DO need access to a PC for setup. However, you can do most (not all) of the same things from the mobile application (if you pay for the annual subscription). So I am a mac user and haven't had any issues. I only use my PC for setup and to archive video a couple of times a week.Overall this is a great camera and works well alone or as a system.UPDATE NOVEMBER 2012Logitech just released a Mac version of their commander software, which is much appreciated! As far as I can tell, it works similar to the PC version. Good job Logitech! This was my one major gripe before - that Mac users were left out in the cold when it came to setup and administration of their Alert cameras. The web-based software (with premium $99/year service) has many but not ALL of the features of the computer-based software. Mac users, enjoy!

I only use my PC for setup and to archive video a couple of times a week.Overall this is a great camera and works well alone or as a system.

Reviews.Title: Great, especially when using PoE switch instead of included powerline adapter
Reviews.Author: Matthew Baldwin
Reviews.Content: I had one camera for about a year and recently added 3 more. I would recommend, if you have the capacity to hardwire the cameras using cat 5, to purchase a PoE switch and just plug the cameras straight into it. No more powerline troubles or bulky bricks. Also, if power isn't readily available where you want to install the camera, it will often be much easier to run a single cat 5 cable instead of adding a wall outlet.This is the switch I use and have no trouble with the system whatsoever (I'm sure cheaper options are available that also work)...http://www.amazon.com/8PORT-200-08P-SLM2008PT-NA-Gigabit-Switch/dp/B004OA6VUA/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1343944897&sr;=1-1&keywords;=Sg+200-08PFYI the aforementioned switch will only be able to run 4 cameras since only half the ports are PoE. With any switch you purchase, you will want to ensure the number of PoE ports included will be enough to run all your cameras. Usually not all the ports have PoE.

Reviews.Title: Powerline Network Adapter Returned
Reviews.Author: RodEnd
Reviews.Content: The Powerline Network Adapter was defective. I am waiting for a replacement. The software installed ok as far as I can tell for now. I like the outdoor camera, looks like it is well built. I hope that everything else works when I receive the Powerline Network Adapter.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Terrible Subscription Service
Reviews.Author: Jean R.
Reviews.Content: This camera works pretty well, but the $79 per year subscription for Logitech remote monitoring is a waste -- INSTEAD, provided that you have a PC at your remote location, install Google Chrome Remote Desktop and do all your camera control from a distance as if you were sitting at the PC at your remote location.  For example, I have these cameras installed at my second home one hour away.  I also have a nice inexpensive PC there that I bought refurbished on eBay for $125.00.  I installed Google Chrome Remote Desktop (it's FREE!) on the PC at both houses.  Now I merely use my internet connection (you have to have internet at both places, naturally) to connect to my PC at my second house, and the EXACT SCREEN that's currently displayed on my PC at the second house is instantly shown within my Google Chrome window at my first house.  Every command I enter at house 1 is actually executed AS IF I were sitting at the PC at house 2.  It's like magic, and it allows you to control your Logitech cameras at house 2 as if you were there -- NO SUBCRIPTION REQUIRED.  Personally, I always dislike vendor subscriptions because I'm at their mercy as far as how much they charge and what functions they choose to implement.  With the Google Chrome Remote Desktop free stuff, YOU have complete control, not Logitech.  This approach also works well if you don't like the idea of all your video images going to the Logitech Corporation's website -- this approach bypasses them completely.Bottom line:  fairly nice camera, but the Logitech subscription is a waste of money and a needless sacrifice of features that you can get FOR FREE with Google Chrome Remote Desktop.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For Use As Nanny Cams
Reviews.Author: BookAddict
Reviews.Content: This is a fun, easy to use system. I think it's perfect for parents who want to keep an eye on what's going on while they're away from home. I don't recommend it as highly for use as a security system in watching outside of your home.The pros:1. Easy to install and set up.2. Great picture quality.3. Captures motion instantly. You can set it up to alert you of motion on your computer and/or phone.4. If you don't want instant alerts, the camera will capture all motion in a snippet of video, which you can view at a later time.5. Great viewable range with the camera.6. You can zoom in and out remotely at any time with any of the cameras.The cons:1. Extremely sensitive to motion, which makes it difficult to use the alert function on the outdoor camera. If you have trees in the yard, the breeze blowing the leaves will set it off.2. The 'outdoor' camera is set up on the inside of a window. If you don't have a window pointing directly where you want to see, it's off no use.3. The night vision is dim, more shadowy figures than a clear picture.

Reviews.Title: No brainer installation!
Reviews.Author: C. Broughton
Reviews.Content: I don't consider myself to be very technically savy, so easy for me is easy for most. This couldn't have been easier to install. Simply place included cd in cd drive of home computer where you want to view image. It will load itself and walk you through the very few steps to get up and running. Just plug one device into power and router with included ethernet cable. Plug camera into power outlet and mount and aim camera. I tested it out of the box (without first actually mounting the camera to be sure it would work) and had it working in about 5 to 10 minutes. Amazingly simple. I also downloaded an app to my smart phone (android) and was able to see the camera view from my phone as well. Very cool!

Reviews.Title: Amazing little security, but could be better
Reviews.Author: D. Kan "phayde1@excite.com"
Reviews.Content: This system is used as a backup for a dedicated 4 camera DVR setup that was a pain to transfer video onto a disk to give to the police.  This setup took about 30 min total including software setup, and iphone app.PRO:-easy to setup, if camera is not recognized by computer try moving transmitter unit closer to router receiver (camera should start with pink blinking light then turn green under camera near mic).  Yellow and blue flashing or solid yellow indicate error.-iphone app is limited but neat feature.-easy to burn movies onto CD or DVD for police use-internal microSD card can upgrade to a 32G card several weeks worth of video with no sound with computer off.CON:-easily noticeable at night has 2 infrared lights to each side of lens and under is a bright red blinking motion detector light can can not be blacked out.-microphone sucks and is useless past 10 feet away on any setting, would have liked a plug in for an external higher quality microphone, even cheaper units have this feature.-noticeable fisheye distortion on mid to wide angle settings.-would like a more secure camera... technically if my neighbor bought the same camera system, if my camera was within ~25 ft of his computer he could link and view my camera.  should be like garage door openers where you do the first setup close within 1-2 feet.  Then it will initialize and make it unique to only my computer setup and not others.-really should include better CAT5 cables with more insulation, some video interference if you use a vacuum or hair dryer in same outlet as your video transmitter.-compared to a $300 panasonic PTZ with night vision cam on dedicated DVR system, the video quality of the logitech is noticeably lower.  not sure if this is post processing software issue or H.264 vs MP4 format issue.-needs a additional PTZ dome cam option, the tilt of the PTZ 750e camera is very limited, the pan and zoom are all digital, not really a zoom lens.I am pretty happy for the price and ease of setup I would want to invest in a hidden clock or indoor cam for the front door.

Reviews.Title: Gram Cam
Reviews.Author: GrammyB
Reviews.Content: After months of searching online for just the right product, I received an email from Amazon with suggested security systems that may meet our need to be able to keep an eye on my 90 year old mother who suffers from dementia. We had prepared a mother-in-law apartment attached to our home for mother but still felt I needed to be able to monitor her without constantly running to the apartment to check on her. I also wanted to be able to view her activities from my Iphone when I was away from the house for short periods of time to run errands.  After reading the posted reviews for this product, I decided it would meet my needs and was surprised at a reasonable cost.  It came within a few days and my husband had it set up in no time!I am now able to go about my daily activities with a greater level of peace knowing that I can check on mother from my laptop without leaving my chair or even check on her from my phone in the middle of the night since I decided to purchase the model with night vision.  With a person with dementia who's sleeping habits change I felt this an important feature.Our children have now dubbed it the "Gram Cam"!  I'm now able to attend church, family birthday parties and a quick dinner out with my husband without worrying if Grammy is OK.  I'm never more than a few minutes from her, but I'm able to go about my life.

Reviews.Title: Great as a Granny Cam for Overseas Traveller
Reviews.Author: Aj Battle
Reviews.Content: I live in South Africa and initially bought this camera while I was traveling to US after I had a break-in in my house in South Africa. Was a bit leery about using the electrical system as a video conduit, given my house in South Africa is old and I thought might be wired differently than US systems. But the system worked perfectly without any problems! I have a view of my front gate and can see who comes and goes on my street.The next time I was in the US I decided to get one and install in the house of my 80 year old mother so I can keep tabs on her movements. So now have a second camera that looks at her driveway and I can tell when she comes and goes (I told her it was for security...but really its a granny cam :-).I paid the $80.00 and bought the remote commander software, so now I can see what is happening at my house in South Africa AND my Mom's house in North Carolina by just switching between "sites" in the software from any web browser. Fantastic! I've setup the alerts so I get emailed on a regular basis when there is movement. I now know my Mom's schedule and will have a good idea if something happens and she deviates from it. My siblings and I all get email alerts when she exits and enters the house, so we always know when she is at home or not.I highly recommend this system for its ease of use and remote viewing capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Works Great - guards my business
Reviews.Author: Brandon B. "Brandon"
Reviews.Content: I Installed this system about 6 months ago.  Works great... new Android update for smart phone works flawlessly... I dont normally take the time to write reviews, but I think others are slamming this product unfairly.  Good Product that has been updated nicely, good customer support, awesome HD quality video, reasonable price, expandable,....5-stars!

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Jesse111
Reviews.Content: These things perform wonderfully. If you want longer range HD then you'll have to spend a lot more. I've caught 5 thieves with this unit. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Katnohat1966
Reviews.Content: Very Good product. I have confidence in the product after ordering the basic set up so I ordered the add on camera and will expand even more.

Reviews.Title: Glitchy and drops one of the cameras
Reviews.Author: R. Snyder "whatsthedeal"
Reviews.Content: Have had this system installed for a week or two.  It worked fine for a week and then started dropping one of the cameras off and on.  Have contacted Logitech support and have yet to get a reply.At this time, I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Like to see what's going on?
Reviews.Author: Robert A Henningsen
Reviews.Content: I like the 750e for the following reasons:  1) I can move it throughout my house; anywhere there is an AC outlet. I am not tied down to an Ethernet connection or wireless. 2) The camera is much better quality than the Swann 4 camera Costco system.  BUT there is only one camera vs. 4.  3) Setting the zones for recording desired areas vs.  eliminating certain areas is more precise.  I have the sensitivity set to maximum and can eliminate false alarms from trees blowing.  The camera will detect motion of a person 3oo ft. away.  It is very sensitive.  5) As far as remote monitoring,  I have an older laptop that I leave on  with Team Viewer software running.  I can log in and take control of the laptop to check the status and alarms.  Team Viewer is free for non-commercial use.  I avoid any fees.  And the laptop will survive a power outage and connect to the camera automatically.  6) The picture is very clear.  It does not zoom but allows the user to determine the field of view.  The wide angle lens works well for full field capture.  I would recommend it and buy another.

Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Soledancer
Reviews.Content: I am not sure there is a perfect outdoor wireless camera solution out there yet. I have had a Panasonic system which functions reliably except everytime there is an electrical outage or the network is disconnected or changed, you will have to go into the camera to check its IP and update the forwarding port on the router. I also tried Sharx. Now, I got attracted by the logitech with the fairly good reviews and the supposed convenience of set up and no maintenance. This was my experience:Pro's:* Very rugged / solid construction.* Straightforward instructions.* Excellent Logitech customer service when I called that I couldnt connect with the camera after setup. They picked up almost immediately over a weekend and tried to be helpful, not even a press "1" press "2" - I was shocked and delighted.Con's:* The first camera that came via Amazon could not connect due to equipment failure (told to me by Logitech customer service, when we went over the install steps).  Amazon was amazing to very quickly ship me a replacment.* Set up is not totally straightforward as implied:  note that the the camera does not necessarily connect easily (depends on your home I guess).  They dont recommend plugging into a surge protector, but wont connect even over an extension cord, and literally needed to be plugged directly into a wall receptacle.  It took multiple attempts for the software to "retry" and "retry" to connect first time and "see" the camera (don't give up).* Now, after a day, sometimes when I log in online, the camera needs to be reconnected (!) since the logitech page says it cannot find the camera. And I'd have to go back to the Logitech software in my PC to get it to ID the camera etc etc. I hope this is not going to be recurrent issue!* It will not work with a Mac.* It works with XP on PC, but only with SP3 installed.* The free web access is very simple, i.e. just a picture of what the camera sees.  No controls (pan, tilt, zoom, control of motion sensor etc) unless you paid for a subscription.  In that way, the free Panasonic web interface allows you to do more.I haven't had a chance to test out the units motion sensors yet, but at least I do not think the install is entirely piece of cake, so just be aware.

Reviews.Title: great product , wonderfully designed & assembled.
Reviews.Author: J. M. Elario
Reviews.Content: i now have four of these installed at our home , a no brainer - must have . I am not a paranoid person & we do live in a safe protected neighborhood - but I am a gadget freak, partly my reason for owning .To be able to see how things are at home , regardless of where I am via my iPhone is truly amazing.buy  this  product  . . now.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Todd Haehn
Reviews.Content: I installed this using PoE instad of the powerline option and after about six weeks it has been working fine.  I purchased the Cisco 8-port switch Cisco SD208P 8-port 10/100 Switch - PoE/QoS which has 4 PoE ports able to run 4 cameras with no problem (less than 80% load on switch).  I was able to run standard cat5e (which I already had; cat6 should work fine, too) and put a wall-plate at each location that I wanted a camera (see uploaded image).  The outdoor cameras seem to be high quality, while the indoor are a little less and don't have night vision. The outdoor work fine for indoor use as well if you want the night vision. The night vision is awesone.  You can see everything like it is daylight only in black and white.  My router had a bad port, but Amazon replaced it for me free (I thought it was the camera at first, but switching the wires around on the switch caused a different camera to not work).  I'm still tweaking the notifications.  I get way to many of them when I a home.  I also get a lot on my garage camera thanks to a spider who lives near the camera.  I get to watch her at work in complete darkness in the garage.  I have used the free web and Android camera viewers and they work fine. My biggest complaint is the with the notifications.  It would be nice to have them set up on a schedule. Logitech is committed to updating the software based upon feedback from the users, so I suspect this feature will eventually be available.

Reviews.Title: Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Ralph "Idaho"
Reviews.Content: Logitech 400e outdoor security video takes HD images at 15fps. My cameras have taken many clips of bugs. Fast bugs yield the most interesting ones. Can't figure out some of the night bug clips. The first shipment yielded a camera with issues about the color green, but Amazon replaced it quickly. I suggest camera testing before installation. I can certify the outdoor model as wasp resistant.  These security cameras have worked without problem for several weeks. Image quality and software features make the cameras a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: J. Nazzaro
Reviews.Content: Very, very easy to set up.  I have been using for about 2 weeks.  No problems, even upgraded to $80 per year program (a bargain).  I don't know what the other reviewers were talking about when they slammed this product.  It's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Very nice...
Reviews.Author: Drake Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to purchase an IP camera system for a white but the price has held me back.  The Logitech outdoor camera system is great but there are a few issues I have with the software.The Logitech software will not run on a server OS, as if Logitech programmers are afraid by running it on a server I am going to get more out of it then I should?The Logitech software will not run over remote desktop.  So, if your away and want to remote to your security system, forget seeing the video.The security software (or camera not sure which) seems to lose communication.  When this happens I often have to restart the software.  I have a web server at home running full time with this software, I don't want to have to keep restarting the software to make it record and send video's off site.

Reviews.Title: Hardware is super, software lacks.
Reviews.Author: Matthew E. Decker
Reviews.Content: Setup was a breeze.  The cameras are crystal clear and the sound is excellent as well.  Night vision is sufficient without extra IR illuminators.  I'm very happy with the cameras.  The software is resource intensive, and viewing cameras on-line from my phone takes too long.  It may be a bottleneck in my particular PC, but I'd like to be able to see what's going on within seconds, not minutes of receiving an alert.

Reviews.Title: The best surveillance system I have ever seen.
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I have worked with cameras my entire life and would not recommend anything else. The quality and ease of use is unmatched. My wife uses the system daily from her cell phone. TRUST me, if she can do it, ANYONE can! I sometimes have to travel. I thoroughly enjoy being able to watch my son leave for school or see my wife blow kisses at the camera when she leaves for work. It makes me feel like I am right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Outdoor Camera - Recommended!
Reviews.Author: C. Hill "CFH"
Reviews.Content: The Logitech "Alert 700e Outdoor Camera" is a good add-on for the Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master Security System with Night Vision (see my video review on that product) or Logitech Alert 750i Indoor Master - HD-quality Security System(961-000329) for providing video monitoring security over your existing AC wiring. This is a very feature rich camera that provides a lot of options for both home and business use. Here are my observations:Pros -+ Easy Setup; we had this added to our existing system and fully operational within 15 minutes of opening the box+ Excellent Image Quality; both day and night vision are very clear, even in total darkness (see my pictures in "Customer Images")+ Supports Sound; very clear audio, but warns you to check local laws before enabling+ Records; both to the camera and to the PC (optional)Cons -- Even at the lowest sensitivity settings it detects rain as motion and will generate "alert" emails, if configured- Camera goes into "Night Vision" mode even if only slightly overcastMisc -* HomePlug powerline network adapters are compatible with Brite-View 200 Mbps Digital Home Powerline Ethernet Adapters included 1-port Bridge & 4-port Switch, so it did not interfere with my existing network* Logitech Tech Support (based out of Canada) was very helpful in diagnosing and replacing a defective add-on cameraThis is a very good system and was so impressed that I bought extra cameras for my home and installed an additional master system in my wife's small business as well.Recommended!CFH

Reviews.Title: Good but still tweeking it
Reviews.Author: Ray Gano - Prophezine
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift from a good friend and set it up.It was really easy to set up, load onto the computer, etc.the camera is really great and I am very pleased with it's abilty.The IR is not very bright though and I am looking at another IR source that is a lot brighter. I have a gate that needs to be secured about 100 ft away and the IR on this camera will not see it.Otherwise I am very pleased and looking to add on more cameras to the system.

Reviews.Title: Feeling of protection
Reviews.Author: A. Peeples
Reviews.Content: My friend installs Surveilance systems & I asked him once I bought the Logitech, to install it. He laughed & told me his exspensive systems are what I need.
