Once he came to he house & saw how simple it was to install he thought something was wrong (to good to be true effect). Then as he went along he acted like a kid on Christmas realizing how Awesome this system was for my needs. I love this system and watch my cameras anywhere I am whenever I want. My friend wants the system now in his house he's so impressed. That made me feel good knowing I had his overwhelming approval. Thanks Logitech!

Reviews.Title: Indoor night vision camera system can't be used facing outdoors
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: My review is for the INDOOR Master System with an INDOOR Night Vision Camera.  It appears Amazon has combined different ALERT systems all into one which is a little confusing.*************************************************************************I live in a condo.  It's not the typical "apartment" condo; mine is a detached one story ranch that looks like a single-family home.  We have HOA rules where we can't attach security cameras to the structure outside.  I hoped I could have outdoor security with this system by attaching the camera with the included suction cup to the inside of the window, facing outward.  But you can't. More on that later.NOTE:  You *can* use the NON-night vision indoor cameras attached to the windows facing outdoors, they work fine for daytime/dawn/dusk, but aren't good enough for complete darkness.Setting the system up is easy. You plug the camera into an outlet and either put the camera in its base, attach to the permanent hanger, or by suction-cup attachment to a window. The plug (a huge brick) leaves enough room so you can plug something else into the other receptacle opening.  There were a couple firmware upgrades that updated, and the software located my camera.Back to the indoor camera with night vision.  If you try to use this as an outdoor camera by attaching the suction cup so the camera faces outdoors, you will be sorely disappointed.  After dark you will see nothing but the reflection of the glass, it's almost mirror-like. An opossum walked across the yard, which also triggered my motion sensor porch light to come on, it was enough light where I could barely see what kind of animal it was, but I still had the reflection of the window. If it was a burglar, I doubt you could see much.But used INDOORS as this system SHOULD be used, these indoor night vision cameras excel.  The wide angle was enough where I could see the entire room (a 17' x 17' living room) in one view. A 7 watt nightlight was enough light to illuminate the room where you could see enough detail to identify a person. The HD was crisp. During the day, the views are in color, when the night vision kicks in, they are black and white.To use this system to its full capabilities, you'd have to subscribe to Logitech's Web and Mobile Commander which costs $80 a year. This is cheaper than what an alarm company would charge, but it all depends on what you want to use this camera system for to justify the extra expense.  To help deter vandalism or theft, the $80 could be money well spent. Using this as a nanny-cam, pet watcher, or to monitor an elderly person if you can't be there, you can probably get by with the free remote monitoring that's included with the system.I realize this is inexpensive compared to an alarm company wiring your home for a security alarm, but sometimes you get what you pay for - as this Logitech system can't be set up to inform the police department if you have a break-in.So my rating is:As a nanny-cam, pet/people watcher:  5 starsAs a home security system:  3 starsAverage:  4 stars

Reviews.Title: It's almost what I wanted; a bit expensive
Reviews.Author: Ricky Lam
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good:  It's very easy to set up; I thought it was going to really hard as I have setup security camera before and it can get tricky.  The video quality is great but you can get ghost images when something move really fast in front of it.  The night version is awesome even in complete darkness I can see very clear images.  The quality of the camera is excellent as it has a metal shell protecting it and it's weather proof is a plus.  The alert is great and viewing it through my phone or desktop through their website is pretty cool.Now, it's the bad:  After paying about $350 for just 1 camera, Logitech stick it to you with another $80 yearly subscription fees for "premium service" which, I think, suppose to be included already with the software.  The software is very limited as you probably want to use a different software to view it.  I was recommended to Blue Iris but I haven't tried it yet.  Since the memory is in the camera and all the recorded video are recorded on there, if someone takes the camera, you have no evidences.  The $80 yearly subscription is just for you be able to view your recorded video but I wish it would able to save it onto Logitech server so in case the camera get stolen.  Sometimes Logitech server goes down and you wouldn't be able to view what's going on and have to rely on the recorded videos and you can view them when you get home or purchase the $80 subscription.I am debating either to keep the camera or not since it's going to get really expensive and I don't think their "premium service" is worth the $80; $30 I can see but sticking it to their customer at $80 is a bit much.  I would recommend purchase this camera so you can try it out yourself but make sure the store you purchase have a good return policy.

Reviews.Title: Now have 3 of these, perfect for home use
Reviews.Author: Hopefully Helpful
Reviews.Content: I use these for monitoring a remote property over the web.  Work well although could do with more flexibility in tuning the timing of alerts (I believe this was in their older camera system).  If they add time of day & day of week on alerts (like Archerfish), I will add a star. :)

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is most likely the best bang you're going to get for a consumer DIY outdoor video system. Most systems with this kind of quality are going to run into the thousands.Overall, I'm happy with the system--- installed it over the weekend outside under an overhang, and it performed very well in one of the worst blizzards in the NE.If you don't want to use the powerline adapter (which works surprisingly well), it works with standard POE equipment. The camera comes with a really crappy 10 foot ethernet cable-- the flat ribbon kind. I ditched that for cat 6 standard cable. It fits very snugly in the camera (there is a weatherproof clam shell that clamps around the cable), but it fits. Also, the mounting instructions for the camera are just silly. They recommend mounting the camera under an overhang,and droping the powerline adapter down to a ground level adapter and plugging it in-- perfect reach for anyone to unplug it. I mounted my camera about 10 feet up, over the garage, drilled a small hole in the wall and ran the ethernet cable through, and plugged POE port inside.  If you can't drill a hole, I recommend mounting this above a flood or another outside fixture, and having an electrician install an outlet-- just make it high enough so someone can't unplug it.Other thoughts:Pros:*good video-- although the framrate could be a little higher (and there are no options to increase framrate)*Software is very easy to set up and intuitive. instantly found the camera*night vision is good, although you lose detail. Don't expect to read license plates in total darknessCons:*As previously mentioned, mount is CRAP. It did survive a really nasty blizzard this weekend, but I plan on getting something a lot more robust in the future. Shame, becuase the camera is really good build quality. makes the camera look cheap.*powerline adapters-- if you're going to use these, they are massive, and take up at least two spots on a standard power strip. Not a bit deal for me since I went with POE.*pan and tilt-- there is none. Description is misleading. The software just allows you to focus in on different aspects of the field of view. Just easier to max it out.Overall, I recommend.  Even if you get three cameras, you're still under $1,000.

Reviews.Title: Excellent home system
Reviews.Author: SciGuy
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellent for a home systems. Setup was really easy, with detailed and pictured instructions.The beauty of this system is the software. I was able to install a 2nd hard drive for computer storage, and everything worked flawlessly. I was really surprised how well this system works, even though the network communication is through the house electric lines, the technology is perfected.The nightvision (IR) is pretty impressive, although the software does not allow for manually turning on Night Vision, the automatic control is fairly useful - you are able to manually turn off the night vision.I was really amazed of how easy the installation was. They included plenty of cable. All you need is a wired router with an extra port which goes to the master receiver, which converts the signal and sends it over your powerlines to the camera receiver. I planned for a full day of trouble shooting and playing around with the network - the whole thing took about 20 minutes, followed by placement and installation of the camera itself. I was even able to set up an account and watch my house on their Alert website, which setup was also a breeze (No messing around with DNS servers and complicated port forwarding).Video quality itself is pretty good. Its not 1080p, but it gets the job done. The audio is actually VERY impressive - you can hear conversations from at least 30 feet away. You can also turn the mic sensitivity down so that you don't pick up on neighbors or wind.I don't think this would be good for businesses as you can only have 6 cameras on the system. The other big reason is that the recording needs to go to a computer on the same network. While you can view the camera on their secure website, you can only store the recordings on a local computer, which could be damaged with an event which security viewing is needed.

Reviews.Title: Nice cameras, but I am going for a more robust system ...
Reviews.Author: microeconomics
Reviews.Content: Overall, the cameras are good, the software is excellent and the ease of setup is pretty good. The weakness of this system is in the limitations that it imposes on installation and the powerline over Ethernet setup.I understand the niche that Logitech is trying to serve, but unfortunately, it falls short for me.I need a good reliable, fully mounted, outdoor video system. The Logitech install doesn't allow for attic installation and an extension cord is not an option to mount the unit on the corner of my house.The main problem is that any security system is usually going to need to be mounted on the corner of a house or the corner of a building where an outlet (to connect the power) is no where to be found and is usually directly installed via the attic, or a high ceiling.These limitations make the camera more of a spot surveillance system instead of a dedicated serious unit.I would recommend a little more robust system for the money spent, if you are looking to simply spy on your teenage daughter and need a night vision camera that points in one direction, then this camera could fit the bill.The ability to record without the PC being on and the ability to stream to your iPhone make it a good teenager or simple spy camera to catch the neighbors dogs pooping in your lawn at night. In that regard, the software is really easy to use, the camera video quality is excellent, although night vision can be a little grainy ... I think this is due to a slightly underpowered IR light on the camera ....Other wise it is a solid build with easy hook up and directions. Logitech customer service has always been good (I did not need them for this product - but I have called them before for other things).If the camera had a more flexible install range - it would be a 4 star .... maybe 5 review.

Reviews.Title: Logitech will not warranty when sold through Amazon
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience! I purchased the Logitech Alert 750n security camera (Master System) from http://Amazon.com. The camera didn't work properly so I contacted technical support. The representative said that the issue was a "know firmware problem" within the camera and gave me instructions of how to get a replacement. Over a week later and now (1/8/14) I was told that they will not cover the camera because it was purchased through Amazon. The camera was never registered before and was brand new, sealed in the original boxes. I was able to return it to Amazon for a full refund, but I was shocked that Logitech avoided (at all costs) covering their own defective products. I canceled the current orders I had placed for additional cameras, purchased through Logitech direct and will simply NEVER purchase any Logitech brand products again! A company as large as Logitech should stand by its products!!!Going to Samsung Security cameras!!!

Reviews.Title: 3 out of 4 cameras worked, suspect quality issues
Reviews.Author: slow cooker
Reviews.Content: I bought 1 750e and 3 700e cameras.  setup was straight forward for the master and 2 of the 700e cameras.  I did a hard reset on the 3rd camera several times but the LED light on the bottom nor the motion sensor LED would not light up.  The LED next to the connector were lit and flashing and the 2 LEDs in the front were on.  The Mac OSX alert commander  could not find the camera either.  The other 3 cameras are working ok.  There is a 6 second delay from the camera to alert commander and longer delay to my ipad.  wish I would have know about the delay and the reason why. 2 stars removed for poor outgoing quality inspection and 1 star removed for not fully disclosing the facts on how the cameras work and lousy documentation.Update on 8/5/13:  Called Logitech Tech Support on 8/3/13.  Explained to the tech what I did to troubleshoot the failed camera.  He then said to return to Amazon.  They have been seeing a high DOA failure rate for 2013 models.  The failure rate on the cameras I purchased is 25%.  I asked if Logitech management was doing anything to contain the failures or improve the outgoing quality and he wasn't aware of any quality improvement program.  They could solve this problem if they tested the units before they were boxed up and shipped.  I got the notification my replacement camera will be here in 4 weeks.  not sure if I want to wait that long to find out it may be DOA.  another star lost due to the 4 week replacement period and no quality improvement plan.

Reviews.Title: Worst system ever
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this and was excited to see what it can do... and apparently it's nothing at all. The camera displays the white light on the bottom which means it's upgrading the firmware. How long can this last? Well after a day I called Logitech support. They had me run through trying to reset the camera to no avail. Logitech support had me copy and paste my invoice email from Amazon. 4 days later they said that wasn't enough and I had to send in more proof that I purchased the unit. I sent it back to Amazon for a replacement which they did. The second camera does nothing at all. No lights... nothing. I even went through the same resetting process. This one is also going back and I'm going to look for another system.

Reviews.Title: Nightvision and windows
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Overall, I have been impressed with the picture quality provided by the camera, but there are a few aspects that left me disappointed.Here are a few pain points.Nightvision:I specifically purchased this camera to affix to a window and capture activity outside.  Due to the camera's location, it was the easiest option without spending hours fishing cable through walls in order to mount the outdoor version.  Everything I read said this was possible, and it does work, except if you want to use the nightvision feature.  It wasn't until I opened the box that I found a little diagram stating that if you were going to set it up this way, nightvision needed to be disabled.  That was the first, and only, time I ever heard about this limitation.  Needless to say I was disappointed and almost returned the camera at that point.  A motion light was able to sidestep this limitation.Commander software:There is no other way to put this, but the software used to control the camera is terrible.  It is very limiting and 'clunky' to work in.  There is also no support for remote desktop connections, should you need to remote into your home computer and adjust settings.I've found the easiest way to review stored video is to avoid the software altogether, and go directly into the storage directory since the clips are stored in .MP4 format.  They can then be deleted or moved to another director for long term storage.**TIP:  If you have a google account, you have access to their Drive feature (cloud storage; 5GB free).  If you setup to have your storage directory sync'ed with the Drive account, you can access recorded video anywhere (and on most mobile devices).  This should safe you the $80/year Logitech charges if you want to be able to access stored video remotely.Alert Software:This is the software that allows you to view real-time video from mobile devices.  It works, but again is very limiting.Overall, I have been impressed with the video quality, but am left disappointed with several features.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth The Money!
Reviews.Author: D. Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I been burnt before purchasing Logitech equipment, but I took a chance again anyway. And disappointed, yet again! I purchased this system a little over a month ago and the surveillance camera that came with the system has stopped storing files on my PC. I'm afraid to call technical support again after the last couple of times. Please don't tell me again that I will need to climb my ladder to pull this joker off the side of my house and loosen screws to remove the SD card or reset the camera!I called Logitech support the first time because both cameras had just decided to stop working all together. The truth is their technology is just not ready for primetime! Oh, and the Logitech support wasn't helpful either (I would have to write another couple of paragraphs to describe those painful troubleshooting exercises I went through). By the way... thanks a billion Taylor at Logitech!But I still wasn't getting it... I then purchased an Add-on Camera from Logitech and the attachment broke before I could even install the darn thing on the side of my house. Really the entire make of the camera isn't for outdoor use. The paint scratches easily, the arm that attaches to the house is very different from the picture that advertised.  It's just flimsy for the money their asking. The system is not constructed well and the software is basic. My advice to you my friend is find yourself another outdoor surveillance camera!

Reviews.Title: Amazing when it works, but a Little unreliable
Reviews.Author: D. Bermudez
Reviews.Content: I have had my system for about two weeks and I have had some very bad issues! It kept going offline so kept unplugging it and resting it until that didn't work anymore so I have had to do a factory reset on the camera and a manual SD card format from my PC. It seems to be working great now but it has been a horrible two weeks. I hope this will be it for my troubles. When it works it is AMAZING!!!!

Reviews.Title: Has the Potential to be Fantastic -- but Flaws Bring it up Short
Reviews.Author: Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, you can tell that this video security system is built to last.  The outdoor camera equipped with night vision has real heft with its metal housing, wide-angle lens with red LED light, power pack, and router adapter to use your home's existing wiring instead of requiring you to run cables throughout your house.  It also comes with a set-up CD (Windows only, but more on Macs later), a 2 GB microSD card inside the camera, a micro-to-standard-SD adapter for reading the card, and the hardware needed to mount the camera.  Set-up couldn't be easier.  All you have to do is plug in the router power pack into an outlet and your router (via ethernet cable), and then plug your camera into a wall outlet near where you want to install it.  Install the software.  The set up wizard guides you through the necessary steps, including finding the cameras, and you're ready to go -- if you're lucky.  The first outlet I tried didn't work; the system couldn't find the camera.  (It is NOT a switched outlet, just a regular one.)  In fact, the camera couldn't work plugged into any of the outlets in that room.  Fortunately, the next choices all worked.  Note:  this is not a true wireless system since the cameras are not battery-operated.  Each must be plugged into an outlet.The software is powerful in what you can do with the cameras.  Without repositioning the cameras themselves, you can "nudge" the viewing field right or left; expand or contract it by zooming in or out; select custom areas for motion detection (more on that later); customize alerts; turn sound on or off; adjust motion sensitivity (again, more); and playback short recorded clips activated by motion.  The color daytime video is excellent; you'll be able to identify anyone approaching the camera, unlike some of those grainy images you see on news reports.  The night vision is disappointing because it doesn't have a good range, although a semi-lit area will give enough definition to see an intruder.So what are the issues?  Well, first you have to pay a subscription fee of $79 per year to use all of the features.  Unless you have this, you will receive email alerts that motion has been detected without any way to see what your cameras have caught.  (With a subscription, you can get a snapshot, although sometimes even that is not revealing.)  The subscription also lets you manage your cameras remotely, either via an app downloaded on your smart phone or on a computer outside your home network.  The iPhone app is excellent -- I can view the camera live or I can playback the clip triggered by the motion, and I can turn the alerts on and off.  That means that when I'm away from the house, I can turn on alerts so I know when someone has approached the house.  Although the cameras are always recording on the microSD or, if your computer is on, on your computer, you can see whether you should call the police or not.  Purchase of the master set comes with a free 7 day trial of the Web/Mobile Commander.  Alerts are sent by email only, not text messages.  These cameras are almost useless without the subscription, so plan on getting it or finding a different security system.  Logitech would generate a lot of good will if it included a one-year subscription.  After all, most people will want to continue after having gone through the trouble of installing the cameras.Next, the motion detection software is wonky.  I have one camera trained in part on my driveway.  It doesn't always catch me pulling in and out of the driveway.  In fact, more often than not, it only picks up only one of the two, and it's not predictable which one.  And it did not pick up my walking up the driveway, although it did catch a car outside of the field and much farther away. But the motion detector DOES pick up shrub branches blown by the wind.  This means that something big like a car entering my property is not picked up but that shrubs can generate alerts every minute.  Boy, was that annoying to see on my cell phone email account.  As another test, I passed my hand in front of the camera three times, with a speed and distance as constant as I could, several minutes apart.  The detector picked only one of the three passes, yet a few minutes later, it picked up a tiny bird flying in.  I've tried to adjust the motion sensitivity, and I just can't seem to find the right balance.  If Logitech can improve the motion detection, this system will warrant four stars.Another issue:  sometimes I get an alert, but the commander can't play it back.Mac Users: Logitech often makes life difficult for Mac users by not providing compatible software for many of their products.  Here, the good news is that, while the Logitech Alert system requires a Windows-based PC for initializing and finding cameras, you can then switch to a Mac to adjust all the settings.  The Windows PC does not need to be on to access live feed from the cameras.  Still, I find Logitech's refusal to acknowledge the growing Mac population offensive.  Although I didn't remove any points for this (after all, the description clearly states that a Windows PC is needed for set up), it makes me feel better having voiced it.You can add on up to six (pricey) cameras, either indoor (no night vision) or outdoor.  The fish-eye type lens of these cameras can shoot a wide angle if you set it up that way, but most homeowners will want to purchase several to sufficiently cover entrances and vulnerability points.  Small business owners with one, open main area can probably get away with one camera, although in that case I recommend the outdoor camera that comes with this set since it has both night vision and a wider viewing field.  The night vision does not work well when the camera is near low-level lighting; the lights "blind" the camera, even if they aren't bright.Last, there is an inherent flaw in a security camera that must be plugged into a wall outlet to work.  What's to stop a thief from yanking out the power pack?  Although the camera will record up until that moment, you won't be able to access it.  And if the power goes out or is cut, you won't have any video, either.  At the very least, these cameras should have a battery backup with a remote low battery warning.  So, while you may not need an electrician to install the system, you may want to hire one to install outlets high enough off the ground -- and then pray that the wiring connects to the router.  In the meantime, I strongly recommend that you train your camera on an area that includes all approaches to the outlet.  A back-up battery system or true wireless would nudge this in the five star range.If you are considering purchasing this security system, you should price it with all the extra cameras you think you'll need and the subscription service.  You will be acting as your own security company, which means that you should have constant access to email when you're away from home.  Make sure you have programmed your local police number into your phone.  You will pay a lot less for this system than you would for a professional service; however, you must also be willing to deal with the trade-offs of a do-it-yourself security system.  4- stars.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

Reviews.Title: Limited usefulness without paying $79.99 / year for complete functionality
Reviews.Author: Qin Dalong "Jon"
Reviews.Content: I must admit I feel rather ripped off after paying for this main outdoor unit and an indoor unit and then finding that even investing $500 in this system I still need to pay $79.99 in order to get full functionality.  Basically, when you are away from home it will send you a message when motion is detected, but even if you go to view the live videi on your mobile phone or other device, you cannot go back and look at stills or recorded video without upgrading to their "premium" service.  Obviously, whatever has triggered the alert by that point has usually moved on, so I am looking at a live video feed that doesn't help at all and in fact leaves me feeling *less* secure by wondering what tripped the alert.  When I first started receiving alerts there was a photo still in the email, but they seem to have downgraded the alerts to just a text message in an effort to compel people to upgrade to see what actually triggered the alert!  I will be researching further to find a better price / value / functionality solution as this falls short.

Reviews.Title: Excellent system with tons of options and potential!
Reviews.Author: TheTerrorBeyond
Reviews.Content: EDITED 12-18-10: The cameras work with POE switches, so you do not need to use the powerline adapters that come with them.  I have the cameras connected to a TRENDnet 8-Port 10/100Mbps PoE Switch (4x 10/100, 4x 10/100 PoE) and it works great.  I would highly recommend a PoE switch for installation.ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW:This is a very nice security system with some really great possibilities.  You can connect up to six cameras to the system and record the video to your computer hard drive for storage.  The cameras themselves use micro-SD cards for offline storage as well, so you have options.  You can view the live video from the cameras on your local computer with the Logitech Alert Commander software, via the internet on [...], or via the mobile client on your Android, Blackberry, or iPhone.The base system comes with one camera, power supply, network adapter, and Logitech Alert Commander software.  The review system came with an additional indoor camera (700i) in order to allow reviewers to set up a system with multiple input points.INSTALLATION:The installation is basically a no-brainer and the system didn't take any time to set up.  The cameras communicate via powerline ethernet which runs the data through your existing electrical outlets to your router.  This setup allows you to install the cameras anywhere there is an electrical outlet without worrying about running cables through your house.  The master system comes with the powerline-to-ethernet connector that you connect to your router, any additional cameras come with powerline adapters that communicate with the master.NOTE: YOU MUST CONNECT THE ADAPTERS DIRECTLY TO A WALL OUTLET.  THE ADAPTERS WILL NOT WORK IF PLUGGED INTO A SURGE SUPPRESSOR.  The instructions tell you this, but I decided to test it and they were not kidding; it does not work.I am awaiting information from Logitech about installing the powerline adapters in the attic in order to hide all wires.  I will update the review when I find out if the adapters can be installed in that manner.UPDATE: Logitech got back to me - the adapters CANNOT be installed in the attic.SETUP:The setup is pretty straight forward.  You connect the cameras to the powerline adapters and connect the ethernet cable from the master powerline adapter to your modem.  The Logitech Alert Commander software will find the cameras that you connect and you can then name them and they are ready to view.Adding cameras is as simple as plugging the camera cable into the powerline adapter, plugging that adapter into the wall, and then using the software to discover the new camera.  It is dead simple.CAMERA FIRMWARE:The camera firmware was out of date on the cameras I was sent.  Luckily, it is extremely easy to update the firmware.  Simply open the Logitech Alert Commander software, select "Settings," select "General," select "Updates," and then click "Update Cameras."  You can also update your software from the same location.SOFTWARE:The Logitech Alert Commander software is fairly intuitive, but setting up recording to your computer is not automatic.  You must define a path for the audio/video stream or it will not record at all.  The path can be set by going to "Settings," selecting "Storage," then "Computer."  The "Video location" box will have information entered into it, but it will not work.  You MUST define a path for the video by selecting "Browse" and setting up a file path.NIGHT VISION:The night vision seems to work very well.  I tested the 750e in the dark and it was able to pick up pretty good detail.  The image is not the best in the world, but it is a lot better than expected and the range is pretty good.VIEWING VIA PHONE OR WEB:This is a great feature and one that I will use often.  You simply set up an account when you install the Logitech Alert Commander software on your computer and then use that login information on the phone or the web to view live video from the cameras.  This works surprisingly well and I am quite impressed with it.  There is also a premium version where you can use Web and Mobile Commander to view recorded video and control your system remotely.  I have not looked into the cost of this, but it is a very good feature if you want to have complete remote control of the system.BOTTOM LINE:This is an excellent security system and it will work very well for pretty much anyone.  The price is a bit higher than many other systems if you want to install multiple cameras, but it is certainly very high quality.OVERALL RATING: 4.5/5 (reduced 1/2 star for price)HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: Two Cameras, both no good
Reviews.Author: Dan in Mass
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of the outdoor 700e cameras along with the Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master Security System with Night Vision on September 27th; video quality is just ok but has way too many false alarms. Three weeks later the cameras were lost by the network and I had to do a "find cameras" diagnostic routine, one was found and the other was not. I left the one camera that could not be found plugged in (this was a mistake) hoping it would be discovered at some point but never was. A few days later I smelt something burning outside like wires, I did not want to believe it was the camera but as it turned out there was nothing else that could have been the cause so I unplugged it and the smell went away after about ten minuets. Now the other camera has gone missing, I have attempted to reset it and called Logitech support with no luck. The bottom line is that I am very disappointed in this system; I was hoping for a security system that would at least function, I did not get it. I will compliment Logitech on one aspect of this experience; they are sending me a UPS tag and will be refunding my purchase price. Unfortunately, it looks like it is back to the drawing board for me.

Reviews.Title: A cheap Logitech 720p webcam works just as good
Reviews.Author: Leo T. "LeeBoy"
Reviews.Content: I hooked up an inexpensive 720p Logitech webcam to my PC and mounted the webcam under one of my eaves on my house and works just as good as anything else.  The only drawback is you can only run one webcam at a time per PC.  I am sure the software developers did this on purpose.

Reviews.Title: Home Security Made Easy
Reviews.Author: Dean Robinson
Reviews.Content: I am a lucky recipient of the Logitech Alert 750e Security System with an Indoor camera add-on through the Amazon Vine Program and am happy to report the following:Everything Logitech advertises about this system is true: it installs easily in minutes and works like a charm. I am very thorough when reading instructions so it took me longer than it will take most to install this system. You can easily install the system using only the quick-reference sheet included but I read the instruction book cover to cover. Even at that I had the entire system installed in less than an hour.Part of the time was updating to the latest version of the software (which updated automatically) and then once I fired up the system the cameras received a firmware update (again automatically). Both updates took approximately 10 minutes over cable internet.The indoor camera comes with a variety of mounting methods included: window suction cup, wall/ceiling screw mount, and a desktop/shelf stand (the method I chose).The power cable to camera and the ethernet cable from power supply to the router were plenty long enough however if you need longer cables they are available from Logitech.Once the system was running - everything in the software was very self-explanatory. I was able to adjust the area my camera recorded and was able to get the entire living room in the shot. The video quality is very good and has an option to record audio as well. You can view the live camera feed from the software on your PC, or from a web browser on any PC, or even from your smartphone (separately downloadable for iPhone and Android) and all work perfectly.All in all I am very pleased with the Logitech Alert 750e Security System and can highly recommend it for quality, ease of installation and setup, and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent addition to the 750e or 750i Master Security System
Reviews.Author: TheTerrorBeyond
Reviews.Content: I have the 750e Master System set up with two 700e cameras for external monitoring and one 700i camera for internal monitoring.  The 700e camera has night vision and works VERY well in darkness, so you can monitor both the front and back of your house in darkness.  I have been extremely impressed with the image and audio quality of these cameras, as well as the extremely easy installation.The AV signal is transmitted via a powerline adapter, so you don't have to run cables through the house, as everything goes right through your existing electrical outlets.The software allows you to connect up to six cameras to the system.  These cameras can be set up with motion activation so that you only record when action is taking place.  Another great feature is the fact that you can view the cameras from either a web browser or your cellular phone (Android, Blackberry, iPhone).  There is also a premium online service where you can control the system remotely and review recorded video instead of only live video.You will need a master system to use this camera, so please keep this in mind before purchasing!Either of the products listed below are needed to use this camera:Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master Security System with Night VisionLogitech Alert 750i Indoor Master HD-quality Security SystemAdditional internal cameras can also be added to either of the master systems:Logitech Alert 700i Indoor Add-on HD-quality Security CameraBottom line: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED5/5 stars

Reviews.Title: Don't buy from Amazon - Logitech won't honor warranty - Must be Direct or Best Buy
Reviews.Author: JV
Reviews.Content: Bought 12 Logitech cameras before, not much problem, bought 2 - 700n indoor and had problems with both, one was exchanged no problem, the second, was determined by Logitech support to have a bad power supply, but since I bought it from unauthorized dealer, would have to go back to Phil's Good's for replacement.  Phil's Goods said they shipped 3 weeks ago in sealed box, so no refund or exchange.  I'm stuck with a brand new Logitech 700n that does't work.  Thanks, Logitech!

Reviews.Title: Great product, horrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I just got the product up and running this morning. So far it works great except for one minor problem. The video feed in the Commander software doesn't work for me. The cameras are working and recording video just fine, but it's not viewable in the software. I was hoping to remote in to my computer when I'm away to view live video (instead of using the mobile software) but without the video feed working that's not an option.Horrible customer service. I called Logitech support and his response was "Call Microsoft or your video card company. It's not a problem with our software otherwise we would have heard it from other users." No troubleshooting whatsoever. That's as far as their customer support got. Of course if I google the issue, there are others who have that problem. I'm running a high-end Nvidia video card with the latest drivers so it's hard to make the argument it's the video card's fault. Especially when everything else on my computer works fine. And even if it was the video card, doesn't Logitech want to solve the issue so I don't return their product???!

Reviews.Title: AS GOOD AS IT GETS.
Reviews.Author: Vincent
Reviews.Content: Pro:-Easy set up.-Clear images.-Fast wireless data transfer.-Night vision and motion sensing.-Internal storage.-Easy to use software.  Feels like a shopping mall security guard lol.Con:-Night vision turns too early, on even when it is bright.-Night vision doesn't turn off after the sun comes out.-If only they allow night vision sensitivity setting.

Reviews.Title: so so
Reviews.Author: J. Daily
Reviews.Content: The pluses are that it is easy to setup.  The 750e also has GREAT night vision.  Picture is very clear both day and night.  Also has a wide field of view with fisheye lens.  Also the sound recording is nice.  Minuses are that you cannot remotely reset the system after a power outage.  If something happens while you are away, you have no capability to reset the system until you return.  Also, the motion alert feature gets old.  Everything seems to set it off.  You will get tons of emails/texts.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: D. Nakamura
Reviews.Content: I've owned Logitech Alert outdoor system for a month and I there are absolutely no complaints with this purchase.  Extremely easy to install both hardware and software.  Both the video and audio quality exceeded my expectations and I have not had any problems in the past month.  The hardware is of very high quality and has gone through some pretty bad storms outside without any problem.  Will transmit live video to my iPod Touch and IPad wherever I have a wifi signal.Highly recommended for anyone that needs a reliable and quality security system.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Judith A. Boulden "Rwisp"
Reviews.Content: I have had Wilife cameras for years. The new Logitech cameras are much improved in image quality and night vision.  I got a Logitech outdoor master camera that took two days to install.  Customer service focused on software problems and after totally removing the installed system and reinstalling it, I finally got it up and running and it has worked fine for about 4 months.  I got this new indoor master system.  The camera was defective from the start.  I sent it back and have not seen a refund on my account or received a replacement.  Will have to get on the phone to sort it out.  I am not sure I have the energy to try one more installation round.

Reviews.Title: So Easy
Reviews.Content: So cool. So easy.Installation took 10 minutes following the provided instructions. FOLLOW THE SIMPLE INSTRUCTIONSThe longest part was probably having the software update.Super easy to set up alerts for specific times, and the image/video is pretty clear. We're not talking 1080p, but good enough to identify faces. I forget the frame rate but movement is smooth and not blurred. Night vision is also of stellar quality. The wide angle is enough and not exaggerated.I wish the stand allowed for more precise camera orienting. Right now I'm using bits of paper to wedge the camera in the stand at an angle that works for my needs. A ball joint would have been perfect (for that I give it 4 stars).I've also installed the mobile app to be able to check in on the camera at any time.So the camera natively stores the footage on board it's external micro SD memory slot. It will only upload to your computer when you launch the software on your computer. I had hoped to upload the footage to cloud storage but that would require my computer to be constantly on with the Logitech software running. I guess right now if someone were to break into my apt, they could steal the camera and thus all of the footage. I would only have a few pictures if my alerts were timed accordingly. Just a caveat and something to consider.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JimRaynor "Vaio CW guy"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and system. The software that comes with it is lacking but will do what the average consumer requires. I have a server in may basement and wanted to be able to use it to control the cameras and store the video. There is no API for programmers to support the cameras and add features, which I think is the biggest downside. These could really have more of a following if they offered an API. I have had a few cases where the camera stopped working. Once it was from the cable going bad, another was due to an ice storm.  I warmed up the camera and it starting working again, I really think it was just the unplugging and replugging that did it. I did have a camera completely die on me and Logitech replaced it for me. It has worked well since.There are days the camera stays in night vision because it thinks it is night time. Might be the cloud cover or shadows that make to too dark.I have missed recording some important situations because I have setup motion zones that were not where the motion occurred. This was because I didn't want an alert for every car that drives by my house, but that meant the one car that does crash into the yard won't be caught either.So it is a balance of finding the settings that work best. Rain and snow cause me to wake up to hundreds of email alerts.Installing and running the cameras is easy, streaming on the Logitech site, on mobile, or at home is easy. Everything is easy, except for getting the settings exactly how you want them. The balance between security and too many alerts.I think that the command software forgets what files are videos and goes past the limits you set to the max amount of video that can be saved, but I can not confirm it. It happens sometimes and I don't know the cause. I have a 1 Terabyte drive so it doesn't matter too much for me,  but it seems strange.I put 8gb sd cards in each camera to be safe.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: cajunganny
Reviews.Content: Easy setup, I can access from anywhere using logmein.  I do wish the pictures would be clearer.  It's perfect sometimes and other times foggy.  Customer service is horrible though.  But the fact that I feel completely safe and always know if someone is on my property.  We actually caught some quite amusing incidents from repairmen, you never know what people do when you are not around.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera and Software
Reviews.Author: S. Gardner
Reviews.Content: Too bad I had already purchased it after I found out Logitech was selling off their Security Camera business (the reason for only 4 stars).  Wish I knew what was going on with the new owners or if additional cameras would be available at a decent price.  I used POE with my camera because I didn't want an ugly power brick hanging off the side of the house or the soffit.  Haven't ever used the online portion of the software.

Reviews.Title: broke after a few months
Reviews.Author: Reptilefan
Reviews.Content: I had one of these and it worked great. Bought another. It worked great for 2 months and is no longer working. The original works great still. But over $200 for the camera and it only works for a few months is quite depressing. After trying everything to reinstall it and trouble shooting, nothing helped.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced - Better Software Available for Free
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: If you're technically inclined, download the open source iSpy DVR software.  It has more features and it will work with just about any IP or Web camera.

Reviews.Title: Ordering/shipping process went great. Camera defective.
Reviews.Author: Chris Eppolito
Reviews.Content: Logitech is covering the camera which was inoperable when it arrived but when I tried to connect it to my existing system it would not work.  Otherwise the Amazon experience was fine.

Reviews.Title: EASY TO INSTALL
Reviews.Author: Phantom Server
Reviews.Content: The Logitech cameras are very easy to install.  However, Logitech should incorporate a better frame-rate, so that the video would be fluid and less chopy.

Reviews.Title: Sent the wrong thing
Reviews.Author: Herbert York "atwb"
Reviews.Content: Opened the box and there was a USED IKU unit in the boxNICE!!Now for the return and exchange - LOVE DOING THAT!

Reviews.Title: better than expected product
Reviews.Author: Alice J. Dagostino
Reviews.Content: I already had one and so this was an add-on and was automatically accepted on the software so it made a great addition and I will get two more in the Spring

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: C. Burns
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera shortly after I interrupted thieves breaking into my house.  Luckily, they (a man and a woman) ran when I yelled as they were coming through the sliding glass door they had just broken out.I received the first camera one day after ordering.  The camera failed immediately.  I called Logitech they agreed the camera was faulty so I returned it to Amazon and received a replacement within two days.  I installed it under an eve and it works great.  I receive alerts and have videos when there is movement in the zones I created.I would like to replace this camera with the outside version, but it is not available.  With the two cameras, I will be able to cover most of my property.  Just the sight of the camera's blinking red light when someone enters the alert zone is a very good deterrence.I would rate this 5 stars if the first camera had not failed.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: SherryG "SherryG"
Reviews.Content: Logitech Alert system is awful.  I have a four camera system.  One of the exterior cameras has been replaced three times and interior camera once.  The system is unstable, frequently needing to be unplugged and replugged to reset, and the equipment is garbage.  Save your money.  Buy a system that works.  This isn't it.

Reviews.Title: Okay.
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and use. Video quality is okay. Should be able to access a couple of gigabytes of recorded video without being required to pay the additional cost of a subscription.

Reviews.Title: Good value and features for the money you pay!
Reviews.Author: Ken M
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised, but be sure to read all the reviews so you don't buy something you didn't expect. The daytime color picture is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Good quality video and easy setup
Reviews.Author: Gerald Johnson
Reviews.Content: As advertised, follow instruction it's simple to setup and use. A relatively inexpensive indoor video monitor with excellent video quality. Also, I noticed the motion detection feature will work through a window.

Reviews.Title: Good camera.
Reviews.Author: Tango.r
Reviews.Content: Its not a cheap system. Comes out very expensive just for one compared to some el cheap systems that have 4 or 5 cameras. But the image quality is second to none. Is really High def. Works well for my house. have caught many a people acting suspiciously. Setup was a breeze and the Logitech online service is second to none. However you do have to pay for the Online service to view prerecorded video and the app is kindda sucky. All in all a good solid camera with good service.

Reviews.Title: Better choice for that type of cameras. Excelent features and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: Excelent image quality, I have ordered 9 total. So far so good. Will be 5/5 when they fix mac os x lag. IOS devices is almost fraction of second lag. Perfect. Upgrade to 30FPS will be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use and setup.
Reviews.Author: T. Dyrkacz
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. The quality of the video is sub par, but the ease of use and setup is a great selling point. I will be buying more for my basement.

Reviews.Title: Not true wireless. Not good quality.
Reviews.Author: Subodh
Reviews.Content: Not true wireless. Not good quality. Just looks good and comes in a good packaging.Even within the same home, unless the receiver and the camera are plugged into the same line, they can't see each other. Forget about putting the camera in one room and the commander in the other. I guess a truly wireless camera is supposed to connect directly to Wireless A/B/G/N, not through powerline (I understand powerline adapters can suffer from isolated lines even within the same home).The camera quality is probably okay for surveillance but can't really get good quality on streaming or on video. To be fair, none of the streaming security systems I've evaluated did much better either (even while viewing locally on a Gig-E network).The only good thing about the camera is its wide zoom, wish the video quality would have been better

Reviews.Title: Top of the line home system.
Reviews.Author: Simon Fraser
Reviews.Content: These cameras are pretty stable and the picture is good.  Setup was pretty easy and the alert commander software is reasonably easy to use.  Finally, the apps for iOS and Android work well so its a good complete solution - even though it's not the least expensive. The commander software now says it can support up to 16 cameras although I suspect that 16 cameras would put quite a load on your local network.

Reviews.Title: Four out of 5 cameras still working - not happy with Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Several years ago I bought many of the old Logitech security camera. I loved the fact that you could simply plug it in to a wall socket and not have to run cables. But, over time, all but one of my six camera died, and all of them died outside the warranty period. hen the new Logitech alert cameras came out I was reluctant to purchase them due to past experience. But the fact that they were higher-definition, power-line transmitting cameras eventually persuaded me to try a few cameras. I purchased one exterior 700e camera and a package with two interior 700n cameras. These cameras have infrared capability so you can see images quite clearly at night. The Commander software package is excellent. The ability to hear sound (these camera have a microphone built-in) is nice, too. I have had one camera fail under the warranty period. I'd guess the infrared emitter stayed on and cooked the internals - the camera was too hot to even touch. I called the Logitech service desk about a warranty return and had the usual "is it plugged in" routine from the non-native-English speaking person behind the phone. After they received my camera (Logitech paid for the UPS shipment) I was sent an exterior camera which I had to return. I was eventually sent the cheaper, non-infrared camera which I again returned. In my emails back and forth with Customer Service I'd once mistakenly referred to my bad camera as the 700i, the non-infrared camera. Even though they had the proper model number in their system the Customer Service rep had to tell me that it was MY mistake that they'd sent me the wrong camera. Really? Long story short, I hope you have good luck and have to avoid contacting Customer Service. I'd still recommend the cameras but Customer Service has let me down.

Reviews.Title: Does it's job but not as clear for HD as I'd like it to be.
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Pretty good system. One of the cheaper ones I've found with a good brand name I wasn't scared to buy. The camera says it's HD. The picture itself is pretty clear for the most part but the motion pictures are pretty blurry since the subject is moving so it doesn't provide clear details and objects in a distance are pretty blurry as well so like a car, for instance, you can get a pretty good idea of the make/model but good luck trying to make out a license plate. I do like the online and mobile access though. The system itself is pretty easy to set up and install. The only other small gripe I can't decide if it's good or bad but the system only records when it sense motion then it stops and for some reason all the motion videos don't always record to the hard drive. You will have some from today and some from a few days ago but the ones in the middle it won't let you play. So to get access to all the recordings you have to go to the camera itself, unscrew the back and take out the sd card, place it in an adapter then put it in your computer to access it.  If someone knows of a different setting I just need to make in the application please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Good camera - beware of "outdoor camera" connotations
Reviews.Author: David Perez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in April 2013. This week will be the second time that I had to go through customer service in order to get a replacement.The first time was about a month ago, when I had the power supply replaced. This week it will be the camera itself. I just prepared the package and will be shipping it tomorrow (Logitech send me an email with the prepaid shipping label - but I had to pack it using my materials).I don't know why the power supply failed the first time, but this time I'm sending the camera back because it FILLED WITH WATER!. I don't have the camera in a open space, it is actually below a ceiling, but I think that the cable was too high and the rain water running trough the cable was able to enter the camera. I think this is overall misleading from Logitech because they do promote this  camera as an "outdoor" camera, it should have a whole of lot more of resistance to the weather conditions.In order to make the best out of my purchase and not loosing my money, I will be treating the replacement they send me as an indoor camera (installed outside, but making sure that there is no way that rain or sun can touch it).I do have to say that Logitech Customer Service has been pretty decent about the problems and they have attended the issue on both occasions.

Reviews.Title: Worked well for about a year. Camera started failing just out of warranty, then completely died.
Reviews.Author: Steve Wetherill
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these cameras (the master system with the powerline receiver, and an add-on camera) in August 2012. They were both installed outside, and after paying Logitech the annual subscription for their Web Alert Commander service, I was able to setup email alerts and view the captured video segments online. The system worked fine and we were happy with the performance.However, around September 2013, one of the cameras went inexplicably offline. The cameras are remote from where I live, so on the first opportunity to visit the installation, I attempted to get the offline camera back online. Eventually, through some combination of powering down the camera and pressing the hidden reset button, I was able to get the camera to start responding again; however, within a month, the camera dropped offline again.On November 23 2013 I contacted Logitech support asking for either a remedy or a replacement (but knowing that this camera is out of its 1 year warranty). I will update this post with progress.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced product
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: These sellers are nuts!! I bought a new Logitech 750e system from Logitech in 2012 for $279.99 complete with 11/2 year warranty. WOW I thought Ebay was bad for overpricing but Amazon takes the cake.

Reviews.Author: S. Kirkpatrick "BDD"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 12 cameras 8 of which have failed and had to be replaced.  Troublesome to replace because Logitech does is not eager to replace cameras and sends back wrong items or short items.I will say cameras work great when working, but the reliability is frustrating.The software for the Macs is poor!

Reviews.Title: Problems with the time line
Reviews.Author: Lenin Rodriguez "LENIN"
Reviews.Content: I have problems with the timeline to download and visualize videos or pictures from the camera to my computer, i spent more than several months with the logitech support and i continue with the problem. I have several logitech products and all are really good, but those cameras are not working as suposse to do. The only way to see my videos is from the mini sd card from the camera

Reviews.Title: The point is mute....
Reviews.Author: Rod Reamer
Reviews.Content: have found nothing wrong with Logitech camera's (they could lower the price) now I see they no longer make them so the point is mute...

Reviews.Title: Easy set up.  Great picture!  Recommend!
Reviews.Author: lonman
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and add to your network.  Great picture both day & night vision!  Highly Recommend for anyone looking for a simple security that you can view on your phone & internet anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Justin muller
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Great clarity and good zooming ability. Only problem is that camera is very sensitive. Can be adjusted but still sensitive.

Reviews.Title: easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: This has been a useful surveillance tool for me. Some knuckleheads have been causing trouble in our neighborhood. I like being able to monitor activity outside of my house without being seen. There's a way to view the stream from the web. I've shared this link with my neighbors so that they can see the camera feed too. It was easy to set up and overall I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: good cameras, lots of great features
Reviews.Author: BIig
Reviews.Content: We have multiple cameras around our property and they work well. The picture quality is great during the day but not as clear with the night vision camera. We can view the cameras from both our android and apple phones which is great when we are on vacation.I like the real time email alerts and the ability to hear audio

Reviews.Title: Shady warranty from Logitech... STAY AWAY!
Reviews.Author: Sam Wagner
Reviews.Content: Waste of time and investment. I purchased the camera in Dec 2013 from Amazon via a third party reseller (brand new item).Camera was installed Jan 2013. Stopped working October 2013.Contacted Logitech to get assistance... I was essentially given the finger since I purchased it "second hand".Worse support ever, I've been a loyal Logitech customer for a long time, I'll never buy another product from these guys since they don't even stand by what the sell.Look elsewhere, you can find nicer stuff for that kind of money!

Reviews.Title: Thanks for a great online purchasing experience.
Reviews.Author: Michael Pannell
Reviews.Content: Great, on time, item arrived in perfect condition, works as expected. Thanks for a great online purchasing experience.If I need a similar item, will purchase from "Logitech" again.

Reviews.Title: Camera is very easy to install
Reviews.Author: DJH
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install was the big plus. It has a micro card in the camera instead of a DVD but unless you want to pay extra you can't access it from a different location. Meaning if I am away from home and want to see what triggered an alert that comes to your phone you can't watch the video without paying a monthly/yearly fee. You can see it on your computer once you return home. I love the alerts that come to your phone, I didn't realize we had so many stray cats running around!

Reviews.Title: The Logitech Alert 750 e Camera system review
Reviews.Author: simmsd
Reviews.Content: A neighbor of mine had asked me to help her set up this home security system to feel more secure in her home..Instead of spending thousands of dollars to have a professional system set up, she had done quite a bit of research for something that an individual could set up..The Logitech Alert 750 e seemed to be something that was much more affordable, and just as effective as a much more expensive, professionally set up one...After having set it up for her, I was so impressed with the camera resolution and ease of use, i decided to purchase one myself...I ordered the camera, plus an add-on, and have not regretted the decision...Easy to monitor at home, or a computer or a cell phone while away from home...

Reviews.Title: Frustrated but happy 2 of the 4 work...return is in progress for 2 or the 4 cameras orderd.
Reviews.Author: ruffnit
Reviews.Content: These cameras actually worked.  After I tried EVERYTHING for the cameras that came with the Master System (Logitech 961-000391) Alert 750N Indoor Security with add-on camera, I finally surrendered and called Logitech's Support phone number.  They went through the same steps I had already done.  I even bought a new computer thinking that may be the problem since mine was older XP version....wish I hadn't done that....costly to say the least!!!  So the support technician after determining the cameras with the Master System were defective asked me to plug in the 2 add-on cameras and see if they were also bad (I had 4 cameras total).  Low and behold the 2 separate cameras, mailed individually worked.  I was so happy after such a hassle with the original cameras.  Logitech has had me send back the 2 original cameras after proof of purchase, serial numbers from each defective camera, my name, address, etc...provided by email.  Still a bit of a hassle but at least they stand behind their product.  I was sent by email a shipping label to print out and I returned the bad cameras on 10-30-13 so I haven't received the replacements yet.  We'll see, but so far so good when dealing with Logitech.  By the way, the cameras that work are phenomenal.  Great picture live or replay, can set motion sensitivity, sound is good, night vision is visible and extremely clear, internal memory cards work perfect, very little delay in picture if any, easy mounting, also easy hook up if the cameras actually work, installation disc is a major plus, website is easy to use, I really can't say enough good things about the picture quality and ease of use on this product when it works properly and I can't wait to get the replacement cameras installed and have a COMPLETE home security system.  Hope Logitech doesn't take too long on sending the replacements.  I'll try and leave another review when they arrive.

Reviews.Title: Superior Quality Cameras
Reviews.Author: Gini
Reviews.Content: These cameras are SUPER. There was one part missing and they sent it right away. I will be buying more in the near future and will definitely be getting them from Digital Outlet. The refurbished ones are like new!

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: Bernadette Lee
Reviews.Content: The systems works Great for the price.  This is a wireless system, it gives great wide angle view, excellent night coverage inside and out.  We have two camera's one inside and one outside.  If you want a crystal clear zoom in and out panning camera, then you will have to spend 1k plus for an HD IP wired camera, and if you want portability and good quality picture which you can see anywhere from a Smart phone, this is the system.

Reviews.Title: Poor Video Quality
Reviews.Author: Ellen Smith-Faiella
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was unable to install this camera within the Amazon 30 day return policy or I would be returning this product.  The 720 HD quality video is misleading.  The digital zoom only blurs the picture and you cannot make out facial details from recorded video - this is why I wanted security cameras so I could ID people trespassing or breaking into cars!  I paid way too much for this item not to get the results they claim in advertising.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: jonny_r
Reviews.Content: I got this along with an extra camera so I could immediately have 2.  This system was extremely easy to set up and use.  The picture is good, the live feed is good and it's great to be able to check in on the house when I'm away.  I love how you can set up your own alert 'sections' for each camera.  That way, if you have a ceiling fan in the room, you can tell the camera not to alert if movement happens in that area.  The night vision is great as well.  I would recommend this to others looking for some quick and easy piece of mind.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: mnm6080
Reviews.Content: I have used these cameras for years. I just added more cameras to the blind spots around the house. Just the sight of the mounted cameras is a deter any one from doing what they might want to. I had problems before the camera and after I have none.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: slackiam
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install.  No need for a subscription to view the cameras from anywhere in the world. Video quality is very good. Easy to add on. I am now up to 3 cameras. I can easily view the cameras from my Mac, PC, iPad and iPhone. We travel alot so it's nice to be able to see front and back of our house and 1 on the inside. Great product.

Reviews.Title: EXcellent
Reviews.Author: Richard L Royer
Reviews.Content: I love these cameras.  Excellent in every way.  Only feature missing is the ability to zoom in if the camera is a distance from the actual you want o monitor.

Reviews.Title: Performs beautifully.
Reviews.Author: Mike Porer
Reviews.Content: This was the last camera in the system for us.  I have a full system running and love it!Great product, performs as advertised, simple setup.

Reviews.Title: Easy install & great HD quality video
Reviews.Author: Derek So
Reviews.Content: After using the Wilife system in the past, I knew an upgrade was in order. Looked at a number of options prior to purchasing the 750e. Price of this system is comparable to other competitors (Lorex & Uniden). Installation was self-explanatory & the camera was up & running in about 30 minutes. I'm most impressed with the picture quality but need to wait on the night vision feature. The Logitech alert app for iPhone works well & viewing is convenient. One change I'd like to see is faster download when viewing recorded videos from your desktop. Others have suggested that download took a bit long & I agree to some degree. Bottom line, if you're looking for a mid-priced system that performs at a high level, this is it!

Reviews.Title: We love our camera system.
Reviews.Author: CoffeeDrinker
Reviews.Content: We own two of these cameras and the are great!  The first monitors our front door and we use the second as a video baby monitor for our infant son's room.  The installation and set-up is super easy, just plug and play.  You do need to follow the instructions that tell you to NOT use power strips.  The cameras use the electrical wiring in your home to distribute the signals and power strips interfere with this.  The software is idiot proof.  Each camera can be configured independently for it's use.For our front door application, we found that the night vision doesn't work.  The front porch lights wash out the night vision.  But the front porch lights provide enough illumination for the camera to see at night.  We have this camera configured to email during certain times of the day when it sense motion; so we have lots of funny picture of the UPS man.  In this application we have the audio turned off so that it doesn't record noise from around the house.  The camera only records when it senses motion and the software allows you easily navigate the video logs.  We recently had a pet sitter come and I checked the logs to see when and how long she was there.  The latest version of the iOS app allows you to change the alert settings from you phone, as long as you already have alerts activated through the computer software interface.In our Son's room we use the night vision and the audio.  In my opinion it is a great baby video monitor as long as you have a traditional audio only monitor to provide continuous sound monitoring.  When I want to spy on baby I just open the app on my phone or tablet and within 30 seconds I have streaming video.  Plus when baby grows up we can use the camera somewhere else in the house.One of our cameras did recently stop working.  I contacted Logitec customer support and they were very helpful in troubleshooting the issue.  Ultimately the camera was replaced by Logitec.  Throughout the entire process the same CS rep followed through with the claim and a new camera was installed and working within a week.

Reviews.Title: It is good but pricey
Reviews.Author: Trinh
Reviews.Content: Setup is OK if you are a handy man.  The hard part is to install the camera to a wall or ceiling and run the cable from it to a power outlet.  You need to plan to ensure that you have a good location and power outlet before you buy it.One annoying thing is that if you set an alert to your email, then you may receive a lot of emails just because of bugs or flies fly by or grass or flowers' leaves movement.  Finally, it is pricey if considering buying more to put around your house.

Reviews.Title: very good system
Reviews.Author: stickersteve
Reviews.Content: I have had this up and running for about a month now. The quality of the day and night vision is excellent. It was easy to set up. I have a second camera now and once you get the first one done, any additional cameras set up almost instantly. it is well worth it to pay the yearly fee for the online monitoring. My only complaint and it is a minor one is that the motion is almost to sensitive. I am working on that though by adjusting the monitor sensitivity. It will trigger alerts even when the wind blows. I tried 3 other set ups from other companies. this one may cost a little more but it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: It great but
Reviews.Author: Kathereen cox
Reviews.Content: It a great camera the only thing that is a down is you have to play with the night vision so you can see better at night but other then that it's great

Reviews.Title: Fantastic item
Reviews.Author: Deann E. Miller
Reviews.Content: The camera works great!  It's an awesome product, I would recommend this item to anyone that wants a camera inside their house!

Reviews.Title: Great camera but no instruction manual or software
Reviews.Author: WWang
Reviews.Content: After opening the box, I noticed that there was no instruction manual or software CD.  After returning the product back to Amazon and receiving a replacement a week later, there is still no instruction manual or the software CD (as stated on the box) inside the box.  Called the Logitech support, and a customer rep told me to download the software from their website.  After downloading the software and following the steps on how to install the camera, everything worked great as advertised.  I don't know why the 2 products I bought from Amazon didn't have any instruction or software CD inside the box.  Is it  just a coincidence or a bad quality control?  I would have given it a 4-5 star instead of 3 if everything in the box was complete.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Camera Outstanding
Reviews.Author: SteveKW
Reviews.Content: I've had and researched many outdoor cameras and I just got the Logitech Master and Add on exterior camera.  After reading all the reviews, I was a little apprehensive.However, after tweaking my installation, I will be ordering another for my home.  The video quality is outstanding both day and night.  The software is easy to use and intuitive.The weak parts, as with many cameras, is their vulnerability to vandalism.  I took some extraordinary precautions with my most vulnerable camera in the front of the house.I'm planning on some pics to share how I was able to protect the wires and camera, at least to deter.  Very happy so far.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert Master System
Reviews.Author: shayshay
Reviews.Content: I really love this alert System and it was very easy to install.  I really recommend this product and look forward to adding more cameras to the system.

Reviews.Title: Logitech - Can't go wrong
Reviews.Author: loc tran
Reviews.Content: Works nicely in the living room.  I already own 3 of the 700E outdoors and this is my first indoor HD camera.  One of the 700E is currently giving me trouble since it cannot be found.  Will have to try to reset it but this one plugged in and was discovered right away.  So far I am pretty happy with my security camera setup and I like how this system is HD and can expand up to 6 cameras.  The software commander has a nice looking user interface compared to some other companies and apps I have seen.

Reviews.Title: It's OK to serve my project
Reviews.Author: Thanhson Le
Reviews.Content: It's serve my project but I don't like the suction cup where it stuck on my windows glass for about over 1 hour and then felt out. Luckily I predicted for this case to hand the power cable to a nail, otherwise, I might lost my money on this investment. I like the capture on motion that save storage a lot. So far, I'm OK to use it, not very excited but it's OK

Reviews.Title: Great camera's and very clear videos.
Reviews.Author: Santej2
Reviews.Content: Tried using indoor camera shooting though a window for outside and works great during the daylight hours but not good for night vision.  Set up instructions are easy unless you have a problem then you must call tech support.  Packaging includes a support number and got a live person (very knowledgeable) on the first ring unheard if in this day and age.  HIghly recommend the system.

Reviews.Title: Okay product some limitations
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: So, I purchased these Logitech indoor security system to watch the inside of my house since I have it up for sale.  I have one camera setup to watch the front door and the other in a hallway.The product works as intended, but I do not like the software that comes with the product on the Mac OS X.  At times when I start the software to monitor the cameras, the software cannot find them.  Usually, I will have to restart the software application and click on find again.  Going into the setting and finding the cameras does not work all the time.The Android application for the system is limited, very limited.  The only option is to log in and monitor each camera.  There is no way to change the Pan-Tilt-Zoom on these cameras through the Android app.  However, Logitech does offer a URL to log into the system and change settings for a monthly fee.  I feel I've paid a decent amount for this product, but to change settings on the product for a monthly fee is not good.  I did find alternatives, but only works through local network connection.Overall, the product is okay.  I wish the software aspect of this product was better and without the monthly fees.  I cannot speak on how the software works on Windows, but my experience with the software on Mac OS X...3-stars for me.

Reviews.Title: These don't work
Reviews.Author: Oliver Gold
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these from Amazon, both were broken. Power adapters wouldn't light up when plugged in. The 2nd one I received from Amazon had been opened and was even missing a few things, so I guess someone else had already sent it back to them, and they just decided to send it over to me anyway.Then I ordered one directly from Logitech, this one had to work right? Wrong. This one had a problem with the camera. A white light on the bottom wouldn't change color. According to their horrible tech support they needed to replace it. Of course they wouldn't do overnight shipping. But they would do 2 day shipping, just as soon as I sent back the old one.I've wasted too much of my time on this poorly made product. I'll just send my last one back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Did not realize it needed a stand alone router / internet system requiring hardwire.  Although, the hardwire can be power wire.
Reviews.Author: Kurt Lind
Reviews.Content: Quality of the camera and picture is great.  Internet access is easy.  This unit requires a router / internet connection in order for it to be accessed which can be made on the same electric power wire and does not need independent modem wire.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for home surveillance
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Logitech just updated their IPAD/IPHONE software and completely fixed the "loading" problem.  Now the system is perfect and these cameras are amazing.  I would recommend to everyone !

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Alyn
Reviews.Content: This product is great quality and exactly what I was looking for. The price was good as well considering I saved 50 bucks on it. I would recommend this to a friend for sure.
