Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Michael Curtis
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up. Lots of great features. Great daytime image resolution. Night time resolution is not real good. Objects in motion are very blurry. Recording at 15fps is likely the reason. Free online access is nice. Overall a good product for the price.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Abel Quinatoa
Reviews.Content: . The security camera works great and was installed without any problem. a good security system for my house.. no it don't

Reviews.Title: Nice cameras
Reviews.Author: S. bradbury
Reviews.Content: I've had the Logitech Alert system in place for over a year with just a single camera and decided to add two more.  These cameras are so easy to use, the build quality is excellent and they just work non-stop 24x7 without me having to touch them.

Reviews.Title: Excellent security system
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: This camera system is excellent, set it up in less than 40 min. works perfect and the picture is very clear. Night vision is great too. I can view my driveway from my phone live and it sends out text everytime there is motion. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: A solid 4
Reviews.Author: Tyler R. Hathaway
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to overview the area I park my car in my apt complex. I am on the second floor and have the camera mounted on the deck. I choose the Logitech one after looking around because i usually love Logitech products and I really only wanted ONE camera, with as much quality/features as possible.Setup- Super easy.  Plus and Play basically, all you need a is a screwdriver to open these panels that hide/protect the connector for the Ethernet cable and to screw it into what ever you want to mount it on.  The networking through the power lines works really well so far.  I have my router plugged into a Tripp Lite PS3612 Power Strip and then the camera is outside on just a standard outdoor rated wall outlet. It successfully connects every time that Ive tried it so far. I tried it in the bathroom on a GFI plug when it first arrived to test out the night vision cause i felt like that was the easiest room to make completely dark since it had no windows.Quality- The camera feels really well built and not flimsy.  Feels like you don't have to baby it, and could take some light beating if you accidentally drop it on the floor (not going to test that, I do baby it.) All the water proofing cover for the cables are a nice touch.  I don't think this is designed to be in direct rain, it states it is Weatherproof, not Waterproof.  There are screw spots on both sides (top and bottom) so I think that could hold water if you had it out in direct rain and possibly leak into the case. So In my situation i will need to be sure to have something over it (its under partial soffit ATM, feel like ill need/want more though.)UPDATE: I used this for about a week and ultimately returned it.  It was good, but not what i was looking for.  While i could definitely see the people in the parking lot, the image quality was not high enough to positively ID a person or license plate 50 ft away, and thats what I wanted out of it.I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a camera to just watch over items or see if someone is driving up the lane.

Reviews.Title: Quality, Setup As advertised
Reviews.Author: Theodore Andersen "Ted"
Reviews.Content: I chose the Logitech Alert night vision line based on reviews.  It is everthing they said with wide angle of view, ehat xcellent 720p resolution, good color in low or high light and good IR coverage in dark.  Web based motion alerts and on-line viewing were my objectives and easily met with the out-of-the-box POE set-up included with my 750e master kit.The only glitch was signing up for the very reasonable $80/yr web alert commander subscription.  Getting the 7 day trial took some effort but buying the annual subscription was frustrating.  It shows US in the region box but you have to click on it anyway to get to the purchase screen;  just clicking on "buy" with US showing takes you in an endless loop.Another reviewer mentioned that you can also use other POE and web-based services with these cameras but I didn't have time to fool with it and the Logitech package provides everything needed in a single source solution.

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: jeppy
Reviews.Content: u can see perfectly day or night, assembly is extremely easy, even tho the lense looks small it covers the whole area... def worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ernesto
Reviews.Content: Quality of Picture is Awesome. Ease of setup is Awesome. I wish it had PTZ but then again now I am just being picky plus PTZ cameras with same quality are much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Great system. Easy to setup and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Andrew Warner
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great value for the price. Only issues I had were due to my network setup and not the camera. And I ironed them out quickly. I used the POE option, so I can't say anything about how well the network through the electrical cord would work. In fact I got it totally for the POE option. That lets me put them in places were there aren't near by electrical outlets. The video quality is great. I've also the got the Android phone app running and it works well too. The recording works well and is easy to review on a computer. Recordings are all saved on an SD Card, so you don't have to have a computer constantly connected for recording. And the software is easy to install and use too. The video quality is excellent and the night vision is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Easy to set-up. Monitor when away from home. Use in rental house since I am not going to pay to install a security system. Confident when I am traveling out of state.

Reviews.Title: Great security system
Reviews.Author: JF
Reviews.Content: We have had a bunch of these installed for about a month now, and have yet to encounter any problems with them. The video quality is great (especially during the day). For the night vision, unless you have outdoor lights to provide some sort of illumination, the quality is just okay. You definitely wouldn't be able to make out specific facial features or anything. During the day, they are awesome, and catch movement in specific zones that you can specify in their software. The system hasn't failed us yet, and has remained up and running through our wireless router.You can change the frequency of the alerts you get, so if you don't want a million alerts sent you way on a particularly windy day (flowers/plants/leaves can set off the motion sensor), you can change the frequency to one e-mail every 15 minutes or so. This doesn't mean that the camera doesn't catch all the motion...quite the contrary. If you log onto your account, you can see every single motion alert that it caught, even if you had set up your e-mail to limit the amount of messages you receive. Highly customizable.

Reviews.Title: Mount broke after 2 months
Reviews.Author: DezBoy "Desert Boy"
Reviews.Content: the camera is okay but the mount broke in 2 months rendering the camera virtually useless.  You can't really use the camera without the mount.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: eam
Reviews.Content: It was much easier to setup and use than we thought it would be.  Motion detection is very sensitive and has a wide range.

Reviews.Title: Excellent image and easy setup
Reviews.Author: Gina K. West "Momma Gina"
Reviews.Content: I use it as a puppy cam. It has excellent audio as well as video. Would recommend this to my friends. Easy website access

Reviews.Title: Bad Experience
Reviews.Author: Filippo Romanelli
Reviews.Content: This is my first review.The camera didn't work ( wouldn't show on my network)It took tech support a week to get back to me(they don't have specialists you can speak to, the tech support has to e-mail the specialists and wait for an answer, shocked)I have a mac by the way, may work better on a PC.Good Luck

Reviews.Title: Great Outdoor System
Reviews.Author: David C. Wyles
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best system, easy to install virtually able to place a camera anywhere you want.So Far no problems with the camera or the software.

Reviews.Title: What I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Iceis "Ice"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to hook up and installed anywhere near an outlet.  I don't like the fact there is no pan and zoom but I knew that.  It does record very clear.  It only recorders when it detects motion, that it.  The software included to replay is good you can fast forward.  You can also view it from any internet.  I did not get the android app for $79.00 a year.  Watching over the internet is annoying you constantly have to keep watching icon when it pops up ever 5 or 10 minutes or it disconnects you.  This combined with my Panasonic that does pan and zoom and free android are perfect together.  Logitech one monitors the whole picture from the outside and the Panasonic the small details (from inside).  This is the combination that works at a reasonable price Approx. $600.  Don't waste your money on other package deals.

Reviews.Title: Logitech 750e security camera
Reviews.Author: WNYperson
Reviews.Content: The short version: The Logitech 700e/750e master security system is OK. I would recommend it to a friend due to the ease of set up. Everthing you need is in the box. Included software is adequate. The motion detection is too sensitive. Picture quality is merely OK. Ability to tune in to the camera on your phone/tablet sorta fun for a minute and makes physically adjusting the view of the camera from the top of a ladder easy.  Long version: The rating is mainly derived from the inability to truly adjust the motion sensitivity feature of the camera. *Edit/Update 12/9/13: The latest firmware update did improve the motion detection feature. The motion detection sensitivity slider found in the software settings actually has some purpose now.* While I'm using the camera with a power over ethernet injector, I did try the included electrical wiring data adapters and they worked well. The picture quality is OK I'm not blown away. I temper my thoughts concerning picture quality with the knowledge that I received an entire security camera solution in a box for about the same money as a semi-decent point and shoot digital camera. Installation of the software (software is windows PC only I believe) went fine and the software detected the camera straight off. After finalizing the hardware install and reconnecting the camera the software was unable to detect the camera but simply cycling power to the camera solved the issue. I you must do this, give the camera several minutes to boot. Ease of hardware install will vary of course. A drill motor/bits and screw drivers are all that were needed in my case. Keep in mind that using the included electrical wiring data/power adapters does not negate the need to run a cable to the exterior of your building if the camera will be used outside.Technically an external power outlet could be used with one of the included adapters but, I don't think that solution is viable for security concerns or the longevity of the adapter in most cases as the adapters do not appear to be weather proof. I hope this was helpful and thank you for reading.

Reviews.Title: Again five stars
Reviews.Author: M. May
Reviews.Content: I have had a master system with three security cameras at a remote mountain cabin for over two years. They have been great for viewing weather conditions and security.My biggest problem has been slow DSL upload speed or loss of DSl. The cameras have probably paid for themselves in gas and time savings for unnecessary trips to the cabin. I am now spending more time at the cabin so purchased a camera for home.With my home camera now connected by FIOS,and increased upload speed I now have decent retrieval speed from Logitech Alert,I have been extremely satisfied with the cameras and system

Reviews.Title: AAAA
Reviews.Author: Russell Friedman
Reviews.Content: Shipped very well  the unit works very goodUnit as described on the money works very goodthank yourfriedman

Reviews.Title: Does What It Says It Will Do.
Reviews.Author: Tom Moser
Reviews.Content: The camera not only provides a great image, it connects to the Logitech system as advertised. I already had the outdoor camera system set up and when I plugged in the indoor camera the system found it and provided the image.

Reviews.Title: Good software, bad hardware
Reviews.Author: MyTwoCents
Reviews.Content: I own five of these cameras and the first 6 months they all worked great. After that they'll intermittently stop sending email alerts and I'm constantlyhaving to go into the software and reset them (wipe out all the custom settings). Because I don't sit around monitoring each one of them, it may be a couple daysbefore I notice one or two of them has stopped sending email alerts. The live video has never had a problem but the email alerts are hit or miss. If itwasn't for the good quality of the software and options I would have given these cameras a zero rating so I'm going to give them a two.

Reviews.Title: overall it's quirky.
Reviews.Author: Thank you
Reviews.Content: Took several days to get sys to link.  Svc dpt not the best.  Was missing a 10.00 part from the start, and delayed my install a week.  Theymade me buy it on their websight for 17+ with shipping.  Lost a camera for a couple days after adding two more.  My neighbor bought the same system two weeks ago,  and far as I know it's still not running.  My opinion logitech should stick to key boards mice webcams and speakers, as they work great!

Reviews.Title: Repackaged sold as new?!?
Reviews.Author: A. Chan
Reviews.Content: Only had this product for 2 months and it already died. Working with Logitech to get it replaced under warranty. While filling out the online forms I realized the unit serial number did not match the packaging serial number. It is unclear if this was done by amazon or logitech. If this was a "new" unit under some mysterious circumstances a 2 month operational life does not bode well. If this was a refurbished unit, why was this sold as new?

Reviews.Title: I love the logitech system, has all the features and high quality
Reviews.Author: Steve Walker "Computer Guru"
Reviews.Content: i started with One camera and now I have 6I love the logitech system, has all the features and high quality

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert 700e Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Lindelow
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and integrate into my existing Alert system.  Great picture and very customizable.  I bought it used but I don't think it was ever taken out of the box.

Reviews.Title: In door camera
Reviews.Author: BOB L. TAKAHASHI
Reviews.Content: I had a little trouble hooking it up because all the camera's need to run off the same electrical line or out-put, but I got ti to work, the online support and alerts are AWESOME. Great quality Thanks

Reviews.Title: Out Door Camera
Reviews.Author: BOB L. TAKAHASHI
Reviews.Content: I had a little trouble hooking it up because all the camera's need to run off the same electrical line or out-put, but I got ti to work, the online support and alerts are AWESOME. Great quality Thanks

Reviews.Title: Feature-packed, high quality, expandable, easy to install
Reviews.Author: jettepilot "aplaneguy"
Reviews.Content: i have purchased 8 of these cameras over the last 18 months and have found the system to be very good.  Each camera includes a memory card, surge protector, has great infrared pictures, works in outdoor settings and can be easily located anywhere there is power.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Scott Smith
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!Great picture and the night vision is awesome!I can view from any computer and my Cell phone!You want security, get this product, you'll be happy!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: The image quality is excellent. The night vision is great and the wide angle is awesome.  You can adjust the weigth from your computer to fit your desire.  Easy to install an no wires (besides the power adaptor).  They also look good and easy to place anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Love it and it works great!
Reviews.Author: Metra reader
Reviews.Content: I live in an apartment and have a crazy neighbor that keeps keying my car. I bought this to deter her and to catch her if she does it again. I will say it works great and was easy to set up. I don't use the night vision since the camera is on the inside looking over the parking lot but it records very well and still catches the movement. I just had to up the movement senseitivity but it catches movement very well. The higher the sensitivity the more it records. I am very satisfied with this camera and it helps protect my property.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Harry D. Lender, Jr
Reviews.Content: So far the camera has been performing as advertized. Logitech has a great product here. Amazon was a pleasure to work with. Easy to understand their insturctions. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: my only regret = NOT GETTING THIS SYSTEM SOONER!
Reviews.Author: green_girl
Reviews.Content: VERY EASY SET UPI am not a technical whiz...nor do I have much patience when it comes to setting things up. But this was a snap!HINT: If you have Windows 8, download the driver directly from the Logitech Alert website b c the CDs in the boxes are outdated. After seeing the system was not working properly & calling Logitech right away, it was no problem uninstalling the outdated version & downloading the updated one. BTW, the Logitech guy was GREAT, PATIENT, & VERY KNOWLEDGEABLEIT DOES EVERYTHING I HOPED FOR AND MUCH MUCH MOREThe motion detected e-mails that come to my cell phone contain a snapshot of the area where motion was detected.I can check my cameras from my IPhoneI can check my cameras from any computer by logging onto the Logitech Alert webstieI can adjust the motion sensitivity, the area of motion detection, and remotely control (move a little) the outdoor camera (haven't tried with the indoor version yet)THEY MAKE ME FEEL SO MUCH SAFER EVEN WHEN I'M HOMEIf I hear a noise at night, I can glance at my laptop that I sometimes keep by my bed to look at the front or back yard, or even distant areas of the inside of my house. The night vision is GREAT.GREAT DETERRANTI heard a newcast that cited a study indicating you're 70% less likely to have intruders when they see there are security cameras on your property.DON'T USE PHONY CAMERAS WHICH I ALMOST DIDI was getting a few phony cameras when my son, who has never been in trouble in his life, laughed saying everybody knows a phony security camera when they see them, even nice, law abiding young adults. Who knew?Now I feel like phony cameras are advertising to the world, "I FEEL VULNEERABLE, AND BY THE WAY, THERE'S GOOD STUFF IN HERE SO I WENT TO THE TROUBLE OF INSTALLING CAMERAS AROUND MY HOUSE, BUT DON'T WORRY THEY'RE OBVIOUSLY FAKE SO COME ON IN."I CAN CHECK IN ON MY PUPPY!He's a brat and I worry about him, but I can check on him now while I'm at workI know there's a lot more I'd like to say, but I'm out of time! If you have any doubts about this system, I hope this review helps.I found the cameras and computer do need to be reasonably close to the Logitech router to work, but that was before I installed the newer version of the software. I may be able to spread the system out more now that I have the proper software running.I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS SYSTEM !!! Thank you Logitech !!!

Reviews.Title: Works well, but sometimes loses connection.
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I like the Logitech Alert system, but the cameras frequently lose connection with my computer. I am not sure if it is common with this system or just my specific situation. I only gave it 4 stars because of this. If it weren't for this, it would have been 5 stars in my mind.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: T.Rich
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to watch my newborn while she was being watched at our house. This worked perfect, infact it exceeded all my expectations. It really does provide a peace if mind. I can log in at any time and see how my little girl is doing. The wide angle covers my entire living room and our kitchen, which is exactly what we wanted. All of my friends at work were very impressed. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Near great surveillance  camera..  9-18-13 Well, changed my mind
Reviews.Author: marlow setervang
Reviews.Content: 9-18-13.  I changed my mind. Still no AUDIO.  I have e-mailed and phoned Logitech since 12-22-2012. 40 in my Logitech folder. And sent a new one again today regarding "NO AUDIO". On 7-11-13 Alfonso said a specialist will be asked to help, and he would get back to me.  WELL, I'M STILL WAITING.  Marlow SetervangOut door Alert Surveillance camera bought on amazonThis camera is great for day time, and very good for night vision.I have taken 2 CDs I recorded of a problem person entering our private lane to the CHP. A video says a 1000 words.Best camera I could find on the market.Great video, but the frames are to slow for fast carsI bought the camera December 16th. NO AUDIO yet today 8-5-13.  They are very poor to give help.  Contacted them at least 15 times by e-mail and phone which I didn't have any results.

Reviews.Title: Great Product.
Reviews.Author: YamahaBrez
Reviews.Content: We have three of these cameras setup around our property (2 outdoors, and 1 outdoor actually setup inside).  They work great.  It's been over a year.  We live outside of Boone, NC so the weather varies and they've held up well in the snow, rain, heat.  We use the free online service (alert.logitech.com) to checkup on the place when we're out of town.  It's a great affordable solution.  Recently, during all the snow, our river and creek overflowed while we were out of town.  Washed the gravel off the driveway, messed up the yard, etc.  We were able to see it happen on the recording when we returned.  Didn't really help but it was nice to be able to see.

Reviews.Title: Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael MV Pham
Reviews.Content: Got this for my folks late Jan so for a few weeks now.They never had one before. Was surprising easy to set up and the program is great. It gives that peace of mind when I'm at work because the software gives you an online account where you can watch live stream from anywhere. I have my dining room basically on watch at work in a tab.Quality is 8.9 out of 10 and when you turn the lights out in the room it'll have the night vision automatically.Our house was burglarized a month in a half prior and so this was an great beginners step for my parents (always hesitant/passive) to get started on.Installing it was easy. We just found a place in the dining and hid in behind the curtain.Highly recommend for beginners and people wanting easy set up. Our street has been hit 3 more times since and we are planning on getting the outdoor one.

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Writhe
Reviews.Content: The set up on the problem was relatively painless primarily due to the networking through the electrical wiring.  This of course presupposes that you have an available outlet.  The only complaint I had is that you have to distribute the cameras onto different outlets and if not, the system will likely not be able to locate both cameras.

Reviews.Title: i have 5 logitech alert camera
Reviews.Author: wmz
Reviews.Content: I use them in two business location. I love them. Easy to install , Easy to view over internet. downside is the price

Reviews.Title: I have 5 logitech camera
Reviews.Author: wmz
Reviews.Content: I use them in two business location. I love them. Easy to install , Easy to view over internet. downside is the price

Reviews.Title: 6 moths
Reviews.Author: R. Contreras
Reviews.Content: 6 months since i purchased th product and still work very well, few issues but enought for a non professional surveillance system

Reviews.Title: Great Camera's even better if you DON'T use their network hardware
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Lynnes
Reviews.Content: I just helped a client install a few of these and we had the ability to run CAT5e to all the camera locations.  Because of this we skipped using Logitechs network hardware and ran direct ethernet WITH PoE (Power over Ethernet) from a PoE network switch.  They've worked our great.  Plus the network switch is on a UPS so even if power goes out the cameras will still remain on for a little while.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Carol A. Dudley
Reviews.Content: Installation was relatively straightforward and the video and still photos are excellent.  Also love the app on our android phones.

Reviews.Title: Wow - Awesome
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I was recently displaced by Hurricane Sandy and I needed to boost security on my home.  I researched all the outdoor cameras and finally decided on the this one.  Well, I love them.  Hook up was easy, the website works all of the time, the picture at night and day is perfect.  I highly recommend this product.  I will report back on how the cameras perform after some more severe weather and temperatures. So far, I am very happy.  Solid product and sold as described.

Reviews.Title: Great system - easy setup - works great!
Reviews.Author: None
Reviews.Content: I bought the 750e system with one additional 700e camera. All were delivered on time and in great condition. I was able to quickly setup the system ( you have to open the power unit & camera to install the LAN cable). After installing the software on my computer - I installed the unit into my Linksys router. The software picked up the camera with no problem. I then powered up the second camera - the software picked it up too. This verified the system was working perfectly. I then installed each camera outside - by drilling into the mortar between bricks - and using the included hardware was able to set the camera up to the viewing that I wanted. I then ran the LAN cables to an outlet I put in my attic - it all came up and worked perfectly. I setup motion activation/email notifications - and they worked too.All I have to say is - this is a great system - it's worth the price. I have owned other logitech devices and had no problems with reliability - so I hope this is the same.

Reviews.Title: Great low cost home security system
Reviews.Author: macheesey
Reviews.Content: These work like a charm, the nightvision one is ultra clear.  There is an app for mobile phones and you can view the cameras from anywhere with Internet access.  Easy to set up and use.  You can record and store video for as long as you'd like.

Reviews.Title: Great Surveillance System!
Reviews.Author: Native Texan
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with this Logitech Surveillance Camera System. Very easy to setup and within an hour, the entire job was completed with no assistance needed. If you can read, you can do this yourself with ease as all the instructions are drawing-detailed requiring no techie knowledge and very simple wiring hookups. I especially like the iPhone app for remote monitoring and email alert notifications. Excellent video quality for the money and I would highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Solid product
Reviews.Author: FitBit Ultra Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed by the ease of setup (I followed the instructions of another reviewer) and also by the picture quality and the speed of service.  Images are clear and I usually get alerts with an image attached pushed to my phone in under 30 seconds from when the camera detects motion.  I like it enough I'm thinking about adding a few more cameras.

Reviews.Title: Performs as advertised, can warp if you cover it
Reviews.Author: bartlett
Reviews.Content: Video quality is good and the application used to configure motion sensor trigger is very useful and performs as expected.Download from camera to computer over the network can be slow depending on the size of the recorded video.A few complaints:- The suction device does not work on all surfaces (specifically does not work well on wood in my experience). I imagine it works well on glass. End result when it does not work is that the camera crashes onto the floor- not the best treatment for sensitive electronics.- If you throw a few things on/around the camera, it can get incredibly hot. In my case it actually warped and destroyed the camera. This sucker has to breathe- I have to assume from my experience that nothing should be on/around the unit.- Logitech provides a free trial of their web-based system so you can remotely monitor video when away from the house. This was so incredibly slow that it was unusable.

Reviews.Title: I Can See Whats Going On At Home Now
Reviews.Author: Catherine Jones
Reviews.Content: This system has made me feel so much more secure. Have two outside and two inside. I used to be constantly wondering about my home when I was away, but not anymore. I just go the app on my phone and check it out!! Love this!

Reviews.Title: unreliable
Reviews.Author: Jeanice Hockman
Reviews.Content: It goes unavailable with any electrical changes.  It almost needs its own circuit breaker. I don't reccommend.  Overpriced.  A friend has it at his cabin & is pleased.  We are disappointed.  Unreliable.

Reviews.Title: Working with Logitech versus Amazon
Reviews.Author: James L. Greene
Reviews.Content: Initially I purchased the 750E  and an extra 700E and the 700E would not work connected to the same outlet. Logitech support was no help but Amazon replaced the unit immediately and now it works.

Reviews.Title: Good camera system overall
Reviews.Author: St8kout
Reviews.Content: I already have the indoor camera master system to watch over my house while I'm away and bought this outdoor camera so at night I can just reach over and grab my iphone/ipad to see what's going on when there is a noise outside. There's been a few incidents of people lurking around our neighborhood late at night.You should know that these cameras have a built-in infrared LED that is visible at night. At first I did not like that idea but now I think this would be a good deterrent. Just make sure you mount it where the bad guys can't steal or vandalize it as it has a built-in recorder using a micro SD card. It will automatically download the recording when you turn your computer on.

Reviews.Title: Worth EVERY Penny!!
Reviews.Author: SannyCS
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd camera in the loigitech alert lineup.  Very clear and very user friendly.  Love the free access to view live footage on Iphone and on the internet!!

Reviews.Title: Use to view wife from Afghanistan
Reviews.Author: Quentin Ghee
Reviews.Content: Works pretty good when you have a fast connection, can be a bit laggy. Night vision works fine. Built in mic works. Video is good quality. Wife was able to set up with no problems and fast. I only have a problem with paying to save videos and stuff.Seem like that should be included already.

Reviews.Title: Logitech 750e
Reviews.Author: kenneth yogi krueger
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked up to our expectations, I would recommend it for home use or office/ shop which is where we us it. I can check on our property from my smart phone at any time.

Reviews.Title: Consistent Android update issues
Reviews.Author: WWRD
Reviews.Content: This is a capable system when working; however, I have an Android based phone with the recent Jelly Bean update and have not had play back capability since this update several months ago.  I and others have input the issue into the Logitech support system and they say they're working on it... for the past 4 months.A similar problem occurred with the prior Android update but it didn't take this long to issue a fix.  As Android phones are more numerous than Apple's IOS you would think the market would get the attention it needs.  My suggestion, search the Logitech support site for operating system issues before spending your money.  I have a 5 camera system and have sunk enough capital into this.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: dogperson
Reviews.Content: As I wrote in my review of the master system, I really like these cameras.  Very clear picture, daylight better than night, but come on, what do you expect?  Frankly, very gratified that I can see the exterior of my home at night as clearly as this camera allows.  And, though I haven't had a wide experience of other cameras, these certainly blow away the Vue, Foscam, and Dropcams that I have tried (no offense to those companies whose products I also admire!) as to picture quality.  I, too, had a problem with the SD card of this add-on, receiving an error message, which neither resetting from the app, or the camera resolved, but was resolved by removing the card and putting it back in.

Reviews.Title: easy to set up
Reviews.Author: B. Clements "bcinny"
Reviews.Content: works great easy set up basically plug it in and install the software....looking forward to buying another to monitor the backyard

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Joseph DiGrazia
Reviews.Content: Works well~ very pleased ~ great color & sound.  Pretty easy to operate for someone who is not computer friendly.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, great software interface
Reviews.Author: J. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I actually got one inside and one outside version of the Logitech alert cameras.  You simply install the software on your computer, plug the camera into the wall, plug the reciever near your router and perform a camera recognition on the software and you are up and running.  I didn't mount my cameras immediately.  The wide angle view and quality of the picture are very impressive.  Access to the live view with my ipad and iphone work very well.  The outdoor camera firmware was automatically updated when I connected it to the software.  Setting up the email alerts are also very simple.  No ports to open on your router or special settings.  Even with the computer off/software not running, you still have access to the live view on your phone and the transmission includes audio if you choose.  When you get home, boot up the computer and it downloads all the video from the memory card in the cameras.  You can set an area of the camera view for motion, or use the entire view.  I tried plugging the cameras into several outlets around the house and outside and have no issues connecting to them.  When I connected the software, I had to try several times before it recognized both cameras, but it wasn't an issue after it recognized them.  I am very happy with the set up and being able to see when the kids get home and activity on the camera recording is awesome.  I would suggest this system if you are wanting to record activity around your house and have live feed access when away from home.

Reviews.Title: Bright clear video
Reviews.Author: Harold Waters
Reviews.Content: I actually bought two of these cameras from Logitech and they have very clear video with none of the lines and static you get with wireless cameras.  The commander software does a good job of controlling the cameras and it is very nice to be able to control and view remotely.  There are improvements that could be made to the software but it does what most people will want to do.  The premium service seems to be mostly sending you text alerts with a snapshot attached.  The exact benefits of the premium service are never explained in a clear manner so you might want to call and talk to one of the Logitech support people before you purchase it.  The one glaring problem I see is the much touted Android app to view and control the cameras does not appear to exist.  I have tried for two days to locate it and cannot.  I think it does not actually exist.I have found that you will need some third party software like BlueIris if want a lot of usable functions.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Trolliolio
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera and I bought it as a refurb.  Was a little nervous to go the cheaper route but this thing works like a charm.  Plugged it in, took maybe about 5 minutes to find my system and away it went.  Love these things!  Plan on getting a few more!

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love them!
Reviews.Author: C. W. Locke
Reviews.Content: I had the older version of the Logitech cameras but these are better.  The built in mic is very sensitive and picksup the slightest noise.  The color and clarity is excellent.  I would recommend this product to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Great for visual, Local law enforcement love my camera system!
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I purchased the master system a few years ago with one camera. It helped tremendously watching my drive from potential thieves. But they just went around to the back of the house, so i bought a used 700e for the back of the house, due to four incidents of attempted break-ins. Since I've installed the one on the back the house there is no driving through the back alley way and there is no more attempted break-ins.The quality is amazing considering it is 720p and the night vision is alright. It's not going to give a great description with facial features but it will give a general idea who, what, when and where. Plus if they manage to break and steal my computers there is always the micro SD cards on the camera's them selves for a back up!The microphone sound quality is nice. I can basically hear what anyone is saying withing 25 feet of the cameras.I do not have the phone application through Logitech so I cannot comment on that.Yes the system is pricey and there is only 6 cameras supported but the video quality and sound quality make it worth while. Plus the direct to phone application.Bottom line is this is a very nice system even though its a little high in price. if you only need 6 cameras and want to do the direct to phone support it is worth it.if you need more than 6 cameras for your house might want to look into other systems.

Reviews.Title: Connectivity and remote viewing.
Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: For online connectivity the older cameras (analog) work much better than the new HD as far as connectivity goes.  I have asked Logitech repeatedly and they act like they care but never improve the connectivity.  Having experience with being robbed and owning security cameras I can assure you that for your own piece of mind you need good connectivity to Logitech especially since you are paying extra for the service.  I run both the HD & analog camera and I love the way the cameras intimidate the bad guys.  I live in a very nice area however during these bad economic times we frequently get miscreants coming into our areas with cell phones and plausible deniability in their pockets.  The whole point of connectivity gives the home owner the option of getting the police into your area when these miscreants arrive.  Because of poor connectivity I end up giving the police information after events have taken place not in real time.  The cameras do protect my home because it intimidates the miscreants however, it doesn't keep them from robbing my neighbors.

Reviews.Title: Home Security Solution
Reviews.Author: CaveManinManCave
Reviews.Content: For 20 years, I have been looking for a home security system that didn't cost a fortune, was reliable and effective, and was easy to install.This is it.  Look no farther.  NO MONTHLY MONITORING/ALERT FEES.All you need is a Windows PC and a network router.  If you have that, this system is plug and play. Beautiful video quality. No need to run expensive Ethernet cables to the remote external locations or beef up the wifi strength (I think it uses the house 120V AC wires to transmit and receive) And it is expandable. And programmable!There must be some short-coming somewhere but I haven't found it.  If I do, I will repost.

Reviews.Title: Good but a number of short comings
Reviews.Author: ioweejun
Reviews.Content: Have recently installed single camera system.  Want very much to give higher rating as so much is right about this system.  Installation was a snap.  Picture quality is great.  However two things that are major short comings at least for my intended use:1) Remote viewing requires firewall to be open to protocol and ports that are blocked by my company so I cannot view from work.  Suspect this will be true of most who work for corporate America where IT departments are robust.2) The alerts I get are too blurry for identification.  Not sure what camera parameters are involved but even in ideal conditions the motion detection provides a picture where the thing/person detected is just a blur.Both of these seem correctable, but after forum search looking at other's complaints going back quite a ways I would have to say that Logitech does not appear to be responsive.There are cheaper systems if all you want to do is get a general "comfort level" view of your property.

Reviews.Title: Logitech 700e outdoor
Reviews.Author: Karel K
Reviews.Content: Product arrived via UPS on time.Packaging was nice, all pieces there, nothing missing, except the user manual, which was not needed.When setting the Camera, be prepard to change some of the programming left from previous owner.The best is, of course, the price, about $100 cheaper then retail.Product itself is great for security applications, the best picture for the price. KK.

Reviews.Title: Logitech on the top
Reviews.Author: Khalidxb
Reviews.Content: Excellent product just plug and play.Top quality and easy to install and use. I would definitely recommend the full pack.

Reviews.Title: Mac girl goes rogue to Windows for Alert
Reviews.Author: Stacie "Hooi"
Reviews.Content: I was having problems with a crazy neighbor, and shopping around for an affordable security camera system resulted in the purchase of Logitech Alert.  I got one indoor camera and three of the outdoor models - one of which I actually have inside.  I really wish I had gone with all outdoor cameras.  I've found the indoor camera to essentially be useless without the infrared recording features that the outdoor models have.  Seems like every reason I've had to review captured footage has resulted in...  well, no footage.  Not enough light, so the camera is blind.  Not a problem with the outdoor models - great day and nighttime recording.  And the audio is a big plus.  You'd be surprised at what people who are doing things they shouldn't be doing talk about - more things they shouldn't be doing that are good to have a heads-up on.  I can pick-up audio on my roof-mounted outdoor cameras, even when the talkers aren't within the view of the cameras.The system isn't perfect.  I really wish Logitech would expand it to offer functionality to Mac users (I bought a Windows-based laptop just to run the Alert system) - which is the only reason I knock them a star.  I've had a few issues with the system failing to "find" the cameras...  Nothing various combinations of restarting the software, the computer and/or the cameras hasn't fixed.  And after about a year and a half, I've had to start replacing failed Micro SD cards - 2 so far.  I'm guessing the cards just reached their maximum write cycle, and it's not necessarily a reflection of quality or lack thereof.  I got four new cards (planning for the next expected fail) - even upgraded the original 2GB cards to 8GB - on Amazon for under $40 bucks.  WIth on-going costs of running this system essentially being $0 (live viewing of the cameras online through Logitech's servers and optionally emailed snapshots of motion-triggered recordings are FREE), that's a maintenance cost I can live with.  I didn't even bother with Logitech support to see if they'd replace the cards.  I do pay a minimal monthly fee ($5/mo) for a third-party cloud backup that runs every minute, so if a security "incident" results in the loss of my memory cards and the PC the footage lives on (the dedicated PC runs Alert 24/7), I should have record of how it happened with an off-site backup.I'm happy with the system overall, and the outdoor cameras are great.  I'd recommend skipping the indoor models and enduring the extra cost (and bulkiness) of the outdoor cameras for both your outdoor and indoor needs.

Reviews.Title: Logitech 700e working fine
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: This is the second 700e that I have added to my home surveillance system.  Installation was simple and the camera was discovered immediately and the picture quality is great.  The package arrived on time and was factory sealed.  The only problem was that there was a missing part, the adapter plug that the camera power supply needs to plug into an AC outlet.  I called Logitech support and they promised to ship me the adapter.  It never arrived.  I went to Radio Shack and found a compatible adapter on a six foot extension cord for $10.  I'm disappointed in Logitech support.

Reviews.Title: Logitech alert 750n and add on cameras
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Maurer
Reviews.Content: The logitech alert wireless camera system is exactly what it says it is.Simple and easy to install,there are only four steps involved that honestly any one can do.Once installed and activated you can monitor the cameras from any computer via the internet,there are apps for just about any smart phone, ipad,Ipod ,Blackberry etc. that allow you to monitor the cameras also.I have all of these devices so I can say firsthand that they do work.The images are clear and the low light and night vision are decent.

Reviews.Title: Love these Camera
Reviews.Author: vu nguyen
Reviews.Content: I've Been setting these camera up for all the business that I've handle. They have the best resolution of any camera that I've use. The setup is dead simple, but they're prone to losing signal. I've have to occasionally unplug them and plug them in whenever there's a power surge or thunder storm.

Reviews.Title: Hardware good, software meh
Reviews.Author: M. B. Keith
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item along with add-on camera, maybe another later. Understanding the use of household electrical wiring for flawless camera operation is pivotal. Getting them wired on the same circuit made hardware setup a snap.However, the software was difficult for a noob like me. It ran okay and found the cameras just fine, but the user interface and Logitech website takes some patience, trial and error to achieve intended results. No interaction. Maybe future updates will help with this.After several tries and two days of reading forums I finally got the Web Commander set how I want it. I didn't want to call support. The issue now is motion sensitivity. I don't want the camera to keep recording bees and wasps and send alerts. More trial and error.All-in-all the system works as advertised so far (4 days). I'll give it a couple of weeks before adding another camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Outdoors Too
Reviews.Author: Christopher Sherman
Reviews.Content: The cameras work exceptionally well indoors, but I wanted a camera that would complement my outdoor ones without being seen. So I placed these inside and faced them out. I covered up the infrared light built into the camera with electrical tape and place illuminators around the yard (CMVision IR30 Wide Angle IR Illuminator)sold on Amazon. This setup made sure my whole yard was covered.

Reviews.Title: IT"S OK
Reviews.Author: Bernie Toes
Reviews.Content: Have had some problems with these cameras, they are NOT HD and difficult to make out a face, not clear and out of focus. Difficult to set up, Quality control lacking right out of the box, had to replace one camera twice.One important note you should know is you cannot use night vision though glass , you have to turn off the night vision.The price point is high, but there isn't anything much better out there for the money right now, so it's better than nothing, you can make out the UPS driver uniform.It can be very frustrating setting these up for the first time and if you add later.  I have a 3 camera setup. 1 outdoor 2 indoor. The software needs another update because the cameras are slow.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: I bought this! "Lbun"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Logitech camera.  It took 10 minutes to plug in and add the camera to the command software.  It has a great picture.  We have security cameras at work that cost the company $600+ and my Logitech cameras are equal in picture. The night vision could be better.  You will see whatever the camera picks up however, I don't think I would ever be able to make out a license plate since lighting is very limited.  In addition, I don't think you could be certain of the make of the car.  All in all for the price, easy plug in installation and internet viewing from home or remote this system has filled my needs. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Shiss
Reviews.Content: Best price easy setup fast deliveryWorks very well and does what logitech says it will. I paid 204.00 delivered. Box was open and no cd or manuals. These where online for easy down load

Reviews.Title: Much improved over previous version
Reviews.Author: T. Lund
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the previous Logitech system (WiLife) and this one is significantly improved. All of the cameras do not have to be on the same circuit which makes installation a snap. Mount the camera, run the cable, plug it in and adjust. You may have to perform a firmware update which is all handled by the software after alerting you. The night vision works well and remote viewing on a smart phone or tablet is great. I would suggest that if you're going to order this, that you also order a much larger memory card. The card that comes with it is only 2GB and will not hold a weeks worth of video. If you don't download it on a regular basis and you don't have the larger memory card you will overwrite some stored video.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: J. Rose "JR From the Ball so Blue"
Reviews.Content: Nice easy set up. Good resolution. But turned out to be pretty useless for me.If I had a huge house that needed security for a doorway or something like that, this would be a great unit. Unfortunately I've got cats and a dog, so the thing was constantly going off.

Reviews.Title: Great simple security system
Reviews.Author: W. R. Wrightson MD "WR"
Reviews.Content: This is my third camera (added to the system) and it has, so far, been extremely valuable.  Easy set up, program is easy to use and works with iPhone and iPad or any Windows based computer.  Only real down side is no Mac support.  The video seen on the iPhone app runs several seconds to minutes behind 'live' but works for my purposes.Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Easy Security solution
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Followed the instructions and had no problems.  Works great except I installed behind gutter drain and I think the white gutter causes the night vision picture to wash out.  I still need to work on the sensitivity because I get too many alerts but thats not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: really good
Reviews.Author: Marcelo E. Silva "pezao"
Reviews.Content: it works perfectly, emails with pictures when it detects motion in the pre-determined area, the night vision is excellent. Really like this thing.

Reviews.Title: logitech 750e security system review
Reviews.Author: Harry Traver "htraver"
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! I wanted an easy to install high quality security camera that would log activity. Opening the box to check the contents, you can't help but notice a lot of thought went into the packaging. My hopes were  high at this point. Removing the various parts of the system, it was also obvious there was a lot of thought in the engineering design. Everything was well made, and even the screws used to keep access hatches on the camera and camera powere box were held in place after unscrewed so you couldn't lose them.I installed in under 2 hours. Software load was smooth, system start up uneventful and routine. Camera works well, has a very good quality image, and the motion detector works well and doesn't go off all the time. There were a lot of things that could go wrong in a system like this, and none did. I'm a happy customer. I know I'll be looking for another camera and wish the price wasn't so high, though. $330 or the system and $270 for a second camera? You need to work that down. I can watch live from anywhere on the net even with my home computer off with images sent over my home network directly from the camera. I'm receiving email notices of motion detector activity and learning how to set the motion alrm threshold to reduce alerts even furhther. Most alarms set off by insects visiting the infrared lights overnight. I'm thinking if I turned the camera lights off and installed seperate light 10 feet away, almost all motion alerts logged overnight would stop. Haven't signed up for the $80/year ability to reveiw the historical log yet, but don't think that's too bad a price for that aility given what a security frim would charge me for the same capability.If you want an easy to install one camera system that is fully functional and a snap to install, look no further! You'll pay more than you might with some competitive products, but the total lack of hassle in getting this up and running made that a great investment.

Reviews.Title: awesome outdoor system
Reviews.Author: nancy perry
Reviews.Content: i purchase the outdoor master system and 4 extra cameras to surround my property.i have a neighbor who is not happy with me having horses , so in order to keep them safe, i installed the cameras around the property.this system works awesome, i can check it on my phone or any computer when i am not home.i had no problems with installation. i just wish that the little "boxes" attached to each camera wire were smaller to be less obvious.other than that,i recommend these cameras to everyone.  we are also going to install a system for our business.

Reviews.Title: Junk! Do Not Waste Your Money
Reviews.Author: GLK
Reviews.Content: I found the system initially easy to set-up but a year never goes by without problems that knock the cameras offline. Despite lots of FAQ information on the web I've found the vast majority of it useless. Oh, it sounds good, like the diagnostic color codes for the leds, but NONE of the codes applied to my camera's specific problem! Over a dozen emails, several phone calls and weeks later I got my cameras to come back. That was January. Now it is August and guess what? My $80.00 web commander quit working. This is the second time the clock has been ticking on my useless, expensive subscription. This system is forever knocking cameras offline and getting them back online is frustrating beyond reason. Oh, there is a neat "find camera" button but just go ahead, try it and see "cameras not found" pop up every time! I am computer savvy. I have removed viruses from friend's computers, I have repaired broken computers, but I assure you correcting problems (and, trust me, you will have problems) with this system is NOT user friendly and fixing it will steal many. many DAYS from your life that you'll never get back. Do you think it is a good idea to hang the outside cameras out of reach? Think again! Because every time there's a problem (and you WILL have them) you'll be getting a ladder and removing the screws to access the tiny re-set hole in the back of each camera for which you'll need a paper clip to poke into the hole to re-set it knocking it askew on its flimsy mount in the process. Logitech calls this "paper clipping" your cameras. And you WILL be doing it periodically. And, it doesn't always work! And, yes, my power and band width are fine, so don't even go there. Even when the cameras are working the night vision simply doesn't capture any detail at all in moving objects. Kind of a bummer because if you needed to catch a perpetrator on video at night even if they're moving very slowly they'll still be just a bunch of indecipherable streaks. Faces? Forget it. If a moth flies by the camera at night it looks like a 24 inch long glow-worm. The daytime clarity is perfectly sufficient...when it works. Buy this system and be tortured. Otherwise be un-tortured and buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Mine eats resources... both PC and wallet
Reviews.Author: Eugene
Reviews.Content: I have 6 cameras and, since the last update, the PC-based software hogs my dual-core's resources to the point that I cannot use it.  I re-installed XP but the problem continues, even after leaving it on for a few days to ensure there are no outstanding transfers.  I removed 2 cameras to reduce the load but no luck so, as a result, I now rely on the online service - even when I am on my local network.Not that this is always a safe option - a few days ago I received an e-mail from Logitech yesterday saying that my subscription was cancelled - no reason given.  I e-mailed support who said it was an error and offered me a loyalty discount of 35% to make up for it - but to get it, it seems I have to go and ask for it.  What?!Now, don't take me wrong - this is a good piece of kit - not the best, but nice.  However, there is a massive catch in my view.  To view recordings remotely you are required to subscribe to their online service which is expensive - especially in the UK.  In fact, you can buy one or maybe two other-brand cameras for the price of a year's Logitech subsription.Now, think about what happens if you don't subscribe... you are on holiday and get a nice message to tell you that motion was detected in your back garden - maybe a stranger looking over the wall.  Want to know what happened next?  Feeling a bit worried?  Of course, pay here and see what happened...Frankly, after spending almost £1400 on the system, it is neither reasonable nor fair for them to try and charge almost £100 per year to view recordings remotely.  Once you've bought the kit, they have you... and, it feels to me, they have your PC and wallet as well.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: LBertelli
Reviews.Content: I don't think you could identify a face, but the system is more cost effective than running wires to cameras.

Reviews.Title: security camera
Reviews.Author: YellowRose
Reviews.Content: This camera is easily installed and records whats happening day or night.  Can be monitored any where you have internet access.  A great system for the money.

Reviews.Title: A+ works terrific and fraction of cost of much more expensive system
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: After extensive research I bought this device. I recommend spending the extra money for this device (night vision) as opposed to the 700i or 750i that does NOT have the night vision. I also bought my device refurbished/used on ebay, and it works flawlessly. Cameras run 24/7 with Windows 7 PC as the back end.

Reviews.Title: A little troublesome, but probably worth it
Reviews.Author: J. Tomlinson
Reviews.Content: when I installed this camera, all my other cameras stopped working.  Oops.  I had a lot of frustration, but in the end, all I had to do was reset all the older cameras by pressing a very tiny button through a very tiny hole on the back of the cameras.  Then, my system rediscovered all the cameras and I was back up and running.On the quality side:  I haven't had this camera long enough to know about durability, so I can't opine on that.  However, the video quality seems to be less than I get from the 700i cameras.  It may still be good enough.  I haven't done a side-by-side comparison, so add your own grain of salt to my comment.I will buy another camera just like this one and would buy from this vendor again.

Reviews.Title: Camera will not download clips from time to time.
Reviews.Author: P. Man "skyblue"
Reviews.Content: This camera works well when it does.  Problem is, the software makes the decision FOR THE USER on when and what video clips to download.  Sometimes it just doesn't download all videos recorded on the SD card.  I am not sure if the download stops when Windows Update starts and doesn't know to finish downloading the rest or what.  There is a bug in the software for sure, which makes this product very unreliable.  It just stops and doesn't finish downloading the rest.The software should be able to allow users to manually download on demand, instead of allowing the software to make that decision for the user.  Because we all know computers are STUPID.

Reviews.Title: easy peezy
Reviews.Author: Alexander Chemerys
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a very easy setup for home monitoring, these are it.  using the wall sockets is perfect for my situation.  i have 2 indoor and 1 outdoor.  i got these for indoor b/c the ones meant for indoor dont have IR.  weird huh?

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera system
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L
Reviews.Content: While the combinations of features, price, and form make the product appealing on paper, it's a terrible, over-priced product that is also plagued by quality issues. When I was using the system, it was constantly flapping, with video dropping at random times. In addition to dropping video, prolonged usage of the system would cause the internet to drop as well. As soon as the device was unplugged, internet service returned to normal with no interruptions. I used a combination of routers, computers, and operating systems, all to no avail.Needless to say, I've moved on to other options that are more reliable and of better quality.

Reviews.Title: Awesome and Easy
Reviews.Author: K. Brown "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: I began researching security cameras about 1 month ago, looking at both full-installation options and self-installation options.  Obviously, the deciding factor in self- versus full-installation largely depended on the complexity of hookup, most notably the need to run wires.  I priced out a couple options; ADT, my home security system vendor, quoted me $4K for 6 cameras!  Outlandish, but not unexpected for those who deal with ADT. I started looking at multi-camera systems with a standalone DVR, and determined that it had to be a wireless system to make installation feasible (all I wanted to deal with was running electrical if needed). One major requirement was the ability to view remotely via web and smart phone. Then I saw the logitech system in Best Buy and was impressed, so checked out the reviews on Amazon and was sold.  It is considerably cheaper on Amazon than at Best Buy (as is most things, it seems), so I ordered the main system with one camera and an additional camera.  The installation was incredibly easy - I ran the line into the garage and into a socket and I was done.  The computer setup was incredibly simple; not real tech experience required.  It feeds it to the webviewer automatically (which is viewable free in an app for my android smart phone). It also send emails with snapshots to my wife and I whenever it detects motion.  There is no separate DVR - everything is stored on your computer, so there is no other piece of electronics to clutter my shelves. I couldn't be more happy with the product at this point.  It is really great and does exactly what I wanted it to do.

Reviews.Title: So far... NOT so good!
Reviews.Author: Vinchenz
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am writing this review only because I spent a lot of time reading reviews on this product before I purchased this camera.  In addition I am writing this on Amazon because it had the most reviews to read even though I ended up buying the camera at Best Buy.So far I am still without a camera and I am about 2 weeks in after I purchased it. I bought the camera from best buy in the event I had issues it would be easy for me to return. Thank god i did. I bought my first camera and things were going smooth out of the box. Easy to hook up, easy to read the directions, etc.. Then during the final setup in the wizard, you need to search for the cameras, and bamn! For whatever reason, the server is not finding the camera. I tried a few times and then decided I would call customer service.Overall I was very impressed with the customer service. They answered the phone quickly and there was no long wait times when calling. They walked me through a few simple trouble shooting things and then asked me to download a diagnotic report from the software to send over to them.  Its a nice feature and then got back to me quickly within 24hrs with the results.The Level 2 tech told me I should return the camera since the camera was not setup with a MAC address and wont read. They told me to return the camera for a new one. So I did.So then I drove to anotehr best buy about 60 miles from where I got my first camera to not have the issues if it was a bad lot of number. I was excited to get home and try it again. I get home and plug in the camera to search and the same (light blue) light on the bottom of my camera.  Called customer service did some troubleshotting and again they asked to send a diagnotic report to them.  I did that and again they said there was an issue (different from the first issue) which the camera and internet weren't networking.Customer service has now asked me to send the camera directly back to them and they will replace it with a new camera. I was a little hesitant to do this since best buy only has a 30 day return policy on the camera and if something happens in the mail I am out the $400 bucks I had paid.Customer service assured me they would take responsability if camera gets lost or if I want my money back if I dont like the camera once I get it. They are providing me with a postage label to send the camera back.So far, I am not impressed with this camera since I haven't seen anything and have had to do a lot of running around. Going to best buy twice, and now to the post office to return this back to Logitech.  My advice would be not to mount the camera before you check to make sure you have it working. (thank god I took my own advice)Customer Service has been excellent so far. Very knowledgeable and just a pleasure to speak with.I guess the jury is still out. I did see someone with the camera which had it working and it looked nice which is why i am giving this one last try.  I asked them where they bought it from and he said directly from Logitech. That might be the best way to purchase this product because it seems best buy has a lot of bad lots with bad cameras.

Reviews.Title: Best CS ever!
Reviews.Author: Shih-Wei Chen
Reviews.Content: I received one of the greatest customer services ever from logitech! The story as following:Purchased 1x 750 and 1x 700 and the power supply from the 750 died after about 2 months. Phoned in to find replacement but was out of stock? One day a VP of marketing? or CS emailed me and asked how are the units working for me. Wow a VP emailed? I told him the power supply died and I have not been able to use the unit for months. The answer I got was "It is in the mail" and I got the power supply the very next day! The wonderful thing was I did not have the warranty since I purchased the unit on eBay!!I also found the iphone/ipad app worked great and enabled me see what's going on while I was out of town. Initial setting was quite easy for me when i was running windows. There is a way to run it on mac with VMwear (NAT network). The recording is storing in my NAS drive with raid 5.

Reviews.Title: Good during the day, but poor night vision
Reviews.Author: AZRLS
Reviews.Content: Excellent: All of the software, and the outdoor camera during the day. Great color display.Pretty good: The outdoor camera at night has good quality but short range.Poor: The fold out assembly directions assume you already know how to put everything together. There is one part shown in the display but never mentioned in the instructions.Awful: The outdoor camera at night with an added infrared floodlight. The range is excellent, but the camera can't adjust to the added brightness so all of the nearby images are blurred. Unless a burglar/vandal stands still for one second in front of the camera you will never be able to identify him (or her) at close range. All you will see is a moving blur.Request: Please, please Logitech, make the outdoor camera shutter speed adjustable.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Rodriguez "Cnyper"
Reviews.Content: This camera is super easy to set up and use! The motion detection is sensitive enough to turn on when there is a person in view, but not so sensitive you have recorded video of squirrels, which is good.  The picture is clear outside during the day, but a little less clear at night (even with lights on the area you're recording).  I also got the expansion camera and it works just as well and easily with both cameras-it didn't slow down my computer and the audio recording takes up minimal space on the hard drive.  Overall, a good product-the reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is b/c it is on the higher end price wise (Especially b/c you only get one camera with the system purchase).

Reviews.Title: Good system, bad picture
Reviews.Author: Harbinger
Reviews.Content: The overall system works well - it is simple to install and the iPhone app works great, a very cool feature. The fundamental problem with the Logitech 700e Outdoor Master Security System with Night Vision is the bad picture quality. I cannot see the license plate number of a car parked barely 15 feet away (day or night). So the camera may be good for closeup pictures, like watching a door just a few feet away, but do not buy this camera if you need to see license plates of cars or anything of that nature. Also, the sound quality is not great.To improve this system, Logitech will have to allow for greater customization of the images the camera captures - I'd sacrifice color quality for clarity (the colors are vibrant but the picture is blurry). Another item that should be improved is the camera's motion sensor - it is too sensitive.  But I recently found the "Advanced" section of the camera motion area and saw that you can lower the sensitivity, which I've done, so we'll see how it goes.  At 50 (the middle, factory setting), if a large bug flies by at night, you get a recorded video event. If there's rain, you get a recorded event as long as rain drops are falling in front of the camera (hours of video capture).  Another frustration is the playback (looking at recorded events through the Logitech software program).  The picture is so staccato that if you're looking at a car that drove by at some point in the night, you can barely see what kind of car it was - not because of the lighting but because it's a blur.  Maybe there's a way to get it to take a higher frequency of pictures to make it more like a movie, but I haven't found that option in the software yet.  I'll have to talk to Logitech or search online to find out if recorded video can be transferred to Apple iMovie or a program like that to improve it, but my sense is that the original video is too low in quality.Ultimately the camera is good if you just want to see the basics of what is going on in its field of view, but don't get it if you really want to see details (over 5 feet away).  Next time I will probably buy a better quality network IP camera and use Blue Iris software with a DVR.

Reviews.Title: AlertLogitech
Reviews.Author: unkelremus
Reviews.Content: Easy to install.Excellent video quality. Support very professional. It 100% better that wilife, which I have been using for a few years.

Reviews.Title: logitech alert 750e
Reviews.Author: Brian Craig
Reviews.Content: i installed the 750e alert security system a few days ago and i loved it. setup was simple. day time picture quality is excellent. the email alert is awesome. found 2 flaws however; night vision and possibly the reliability. night vision was kind of disappointing. picture quality wasn't very good. system is not as reliable as i had hoped. system has been installed for 2 days and i wake up to a camera that can't be found. i had to reboot my computer for an upgrade to be installed. not good at 4am when i need you most. i am hoping its a fluke. i will keep the system for a little while longer and hope for the best.

Reviews.Title: Worked really well and great features
Reviews.Author: M. Larenas
Reviews.Content: I installed this in my garage area of a town house development and it is excellent. Way more feature than standard security setups. You can see it on Android or Iphone at any time. It records to view back on the computer. Note that it doesn't work for Mac. You can borrow a PC to set it up and see it through the website but you wouldn't see playbacks without removing the SD card.Note that you don't need a computer to use it with the online feature since it hook right up to the router. I researched all over for this info and didn't find it. I have a laptop that is not on all day so this was important.

Reviews.Title: works great, love iphone app
Reviews.Author: bm
Reviews.Content: This works great for our 2nd home. with the iphone app I get a video email with every motion detected anywhere in America.

Reviews.Title: Good viewing
Reviews.Author: SJC
Reviews.Content: Works like they say it would. no complaints very easy to install. Only problem that I feel is that logeitech charges a fee for online viewing. The first year in my opinion should be free and then alittle lower for a yearly subscription from its current price.

Reviews.Title: Very flexible, easy to install, even works on my old circuits
Reviews.Author: John Queern "John in BLV"
Reviews.Content: I've been running this system for just over a week now, and have 2 cameras (1 outdoor, 1 indoor).  Everything was extremely easy to set up and install.  I initially set up each cam at my computer, plugged into the same power strip as the receiver.  This allowed the cams to efficiently update their firmware and become part of the system.  I then simply relocated each cam to its designated location, mounted them and plugged in their power supplies.  Works great! I was pleasantly surprised, since my house is over 100 years old and some of the circuits I'm using are *at least* 50 year old wiring.The indoor cam has no night vision, and the outdoor cam's night vision isn't very good.  I have outdoor security lighting, however, which allows the cam to record in full color and resolution all night--it never has to switch to IR. My lighting consists of one mercury "night light" (a street light), augmented by several ordinary fluorescent wall-mounted carriage lights.My indoor cam is mounted on a window adjacent to my front door.  Looking through plexiglass does degrade the image somewhat, but it's quite usable and lets us know when someone approaches the door, leaves a package, etc.The motion detection on each camera allows you to specify your own areas of interest and select the sensitivity (or object size) for generating an alert.  This was especially important for me, since one of the cams can see the street, causing cars passing by to repeatedly set off alerts until I specified a tighter zone for motion detection.My indoor cam does generate alarms and record snapshots-- but the local commander application doesn't receive these as it does for the outdoor cam.  Logitech customer support was very helpful, and is sending me a replacement memory chip to hopefully fix this problem.  Interestingly, the web service can see all of the alerts and snapshots-- only the local commander has a problem.  Unfortunately, there is no "refresh" or "re-synch" function in the commander.  The web service queries the memory chip on the camera directly, explaining why it can see snapshots which the local commander may have missed.Picture quality is much better than I expected.  Motion detection is easy to configure and works perfectly.  Snapshots back up slightly before the motion was detected, allowing you to see exactly what was going on.  I'm having the web service send snapshots to a dedicated email address when alerts occur.  Each email includes a hot link to the corresponding video, allowing you to quickly review what was recorded for each event.  It couldn't be any easier...My Android phone receives the emails and can "sometimes" see the cameras-- but the Android app still seems a bit unstable.  When it works, it's great.  My Ipad, on the other hand, seems to handle the Alert app seamlessly, making it a great way to view the cameras when you're away from the commander PC.  If you pay the $80/year fee, the web interface (which also includes Android & Ipad apps) gives you all of the functionality of the local commander, with anywhere-you-go accessibility.  The only issue is video resolution-- HD is available only at the local commander. I haven't run into any situations yet where the additional resolution would be needed in order to identify what's going on, but still, it's nice to have when you need it.I just ordered 2 more cameras, which should give me adequate coverage for the outside of the house.  I don't  plan to use any of these inside, but I've tested the cams indoors (just for fun) and was very impressed with their output.So far, I'm having a great time with the cameras.  It's like having an extra window to the outside-- including live sound (if you activate it).  Hearing what's going on outside while I'm at my desk is almost as helpful as having the video feeds.  I can hear the dogs barking, trucks arriving, doors opening, etc.Great system, great price!Postscript:I now have 4 cameras, all working great.The synchronization problem turned out to be a flash update issue which Logitech is currently trying to solve-- but there's a workaround.  Three of my cameras somehow got their time zones confused, causing the Commander program to reject their snapshots.  When I reviewed the snapshots on their web site, I noticed that these cameras showed motion alerts *in the future*... LOL  Once I mentioned it was a timezone problem to the help desk, they recognized the problem immediately and sent me the procedure needed to reset the cams and resynch them with the Commander.  This worked, and now Commander can see all of the alerts-- and the cams are reporting the correct timestamps online.Post-Postscript:It's been two years since I installed my first cameras.  I now have eight Logitech Alert cameras -- three indoor and five outdoor models.  Logitech's software only supports six per console-- and your house electrical wiring will probably max out at about the same number.  I started experimenting with Power-Over-Ethernet (POE) options (these cameras support that just fine), and now only one camera uses the house wiring.  The rest connect to my house LAN using direct wiring or wifi and POE injectors or switches (TP-Link AC TL-PoE150S POE Injector and TRENDnet 8-Port 10/100Mbps PoE Switch, both sold here)to provide both LAN and power to the cameras.  I have three cameras in a remote garage which use a gaming adapter to receive the wifi from the house and feed the POE switch.Logitech software still works with the POE connection, but limits you to six cameras per view.  Initially, I set up two workstations and divided the cameras between them.  But then I learned about Blue Iris software from the Logitech online forum.  Blue Iris can handle a much larger number of cams (99?) from a wide variety of vendors, including Logitech.  I *love* the Blue Iris interface, and have been running it now for almost a year.
