To view your cameras on your smart phone or over the web, you have to open up outside connectivity to a PC at your house, but if you do this it works great.  Blue Iris lets you zoom in and out and supports a variety of desktop configurations depending on the number of cameras you have.  Great combination.

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: Jesse111
Reviews.Content: Great product for the money. However, I've had 2 e units arrive defective. No problem with Amazon though. They replace and new ones are fine so far.Gave 4 stars simply because QC needs to bump it up. But for the money, the system is very effective.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master System
Reviews.Author: Civilguy001
Reviews.Content: Camera setup was easy and software setup was easy.Video quality and night vision is slightly less than expected, but acceptable.Sound is acceptable, conversations close to the camera can be heard and understood.The Logitech sofware provides basic camera functions with ease.Motion trips the camera to record activity onto an onboard MicroSD card when your PC is off.Camera location is key, night vision reflected off a nearby downspout causing a white ghost ring in the field of view. Repositioning the camera fixed that. Oh, BUGS, not the software kind, the insect kind - they trip the motion sensor as they flitter about, spiders are the worst, the web will move about in front of the lense, triggering the motion sensor for hours.The web access to the system works, you are able to access live video; but you cannot reposition the camera or playback segments without paying an annual fee.I had to call tech support when the system failed to function. The phone response was immediate and  I was connected to a tech who understood the system (no scripted questions or responses). The power box was the culprit, a connector actually, a new box was shipped to me in a few days. The tech support call was a positive experience.I would recommend this system to anyone and have recommended this system to friends.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Dana K. Bassett "Daneybooboo"
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up, don't have to run a wire from the camera to a computer or router, only to an electrical outlet.  Picture quality and sound are outstanding as is the night vision.  Easy to viewe on desktop, iphone, and ipad.

Reviews.Title: Logitech alert 750e
Reviews.Author: Ali Al Rasi
Reviews.Content: hello,i bought this system and its now under test it has been 20 days since i install it and its very good and there was a lot or rains and dust . until now its holden tight and steady.great system.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and start using
Reviews.Author: Raymond Odem
Reviews.Content: Over all the out door system is a easy one to use the camera has both color and black & white use. the night vision is limited to about 50/60 ft. the cost of the add on camera is a little pricey

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Purple'puter Lady "Purpleputerlady"
Reviews.Content: I don't have much more to offer than other reviewers.  I set it up yesterday and set-up was a piece of cake. Unplugged and  moved it to a couple of different locations and it worked just fine everywhere I placed it.  As one reviewer noted, the power plugs are quite large but I was able to use them without them taking up the entire outlet. Since the initial setup was so smooth, I've ordered more indoor cameras for the house.  Right now the outdoor camera is in my garage that is at the back of our 1/2 acre lot (router is in the basement of the house, about 155 feet away) and it's been working fine so far. The microphone is so sensitive that I can hear birds chirping outside of the garage.I agree with others that the $79.99 per year Alert Web Commander subscription is a bit pricey but I have not tried it yet.  I will probably get around to at least checking it out with the seven day free trial. For now, the email alerts and ability to view activity online will do. My elderly Blackberry will not support the free app, but it's about time for it to retire anyway. ;-)Overall, while I wish it were less expensive <grin> but I think it will provide me with peace of mind when I am away from home.Update 3-24-11 - One inside camera returned Tuesday and outdoor replacement ordered. No sooner done than the other indoor camera started misbehaving.  Drops off the network, has to be re-booted by physically unplugging it and replugging it. Using the "find cameras" does not work for it (just like the other one) and now, even though I can monitor real time and it gives audible alerts, it is not recording.  Bah! The second indoor cam will be on the way back soon and another (pricier) exterior camera ordered to replace it.  Still nothing bad to say about the outdoor camera...yet.  Tonight will be the first night that the temp. has been below freezing since I installed it.  We'll see....Update 4-5-11 - All outdoor cameras installed (inside although the garage is not heated)and working well. Logitech put out a software and firmware update a couple of days ago that seems to be a big improvement; the motion detection is much better and now you can set the camera's motion sensitivity to zero and the cams will not record - good for daytime when the only thing it will be recording is me.  All in all, I still think this was a good purchase.  When I'm not using the cameras for home security while I travel, I will use them to watch the birds, and other wildlife in my yard.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Kister "Jeremy Kister"
Reviews.Content: It's truly no effort to set up and get going; for me, it's perhaps a bit *too* simple.The cost of this simplicity is security.  Lots of data (the names of your cameras, their usernames/passwords, etc) are saved on Logitech's servers.  That's a bit scary because I don't know what they're doing with the data.. are they watching it too?  are a group of them flipping between hundreds of feeds without their manager's approval?When you use Logitech's website (or the iphone app) to remotely view the cameras, it continuously makes you click the "Continue" button to verify that you're still watching the video.  It's a real hassle because I have a monitor set up specifically to watch the feed and every 5 minutes i have to click the button to keep it going.With the simpler cameras, you connect directly to your home router and that's it.  Granted, it's a bit more technical to configure.  You can still do that, though, if you want to configure a RTSP client like VLC.  Choose Media -> Open Network Stream and enter rtsp://admin:@/HighResolutionVideo (or /LowResolutionVideo)I am very happy with the video and audio quality.Motion Detection/Recording is dreadful.  On any motion - any at all - you get a recording saved.  This makes finding what you're looking for a nightmare because you have to sift through 1,000 files per day.  They give you settings to configure, but those settings are only for "Alerts" -- not for making a recording.As a side note, you cannot place this camera right behind glass and expect night mode to work.  I don't think it's a problem with Logitech or this camera, but the camera ends up recording it's own reflection :)I had one Alert 700e fail (gave all green video half of the time).  I sent it in and Logitech promptly sent me a replacement unit.  When I hooked the replacement unit and logged into their website, I saw an unknown camera in my profile - when I clicked it, it was recording some unknown-to-me location.  I contacted the support team, and it ends up that someone was testing the camera and hadn't unlinked it from my profile.  So, if you sell your camera or whatever, you'll be able to see what they're doing until they register it or you unlink it.Why does the iphone app depend on logitech's servers?  it could connect straight to the PC that I'm running Alert Commander on.  If they gave us more access to the cam (and didnt require us to use their servers so much), i'd rate it a 5.

Reviews.Title: Excellent cameras, computer, web and smart phone interfaces AND customer service too!
Reviews.Author: John "JohnJackon"
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased and surprised to have received a very nice message from the product manager! He left his phone number, I called him but he was in a loud room so he changed his location and called me back. We discussed my observations and suggestions and he informed me that several of them were identified just after the first of this year and are already being addressed as I write this review. The product manager is very committed to the continual improvement of the customer service, firmware, hardware, software, smartphone and web interfaces. He and his team take customer feedback and service very seriously and implement improvements ASAP.I HIGHLY recommend adding the low cost optional premium services(Logitech Alert Mobile Commander and Logitech Alert Web Commander) which move the system from being 'just' great, to FANTASTIC, by adding many useful features! You can see the features of these premium services on their website. I just discovered you receive BOTH services for just $79.95 per year! From their page at: [...]Response from Logitech:By Logitech Alert Security Products Group, February 22, 2011Thank you for your feedback and we apologize for not clearly communicating the price for the Alert(tm) Mobile Commander and Alert(tm) Web Commander services. The subscription fee for these services is $79.99 USD per year. The fee includes the cost for both services.For security purposes, I also highly recommend logging onto the Logitech Alert Web Commander using https instead of http, wherever possible.Just go ahead and BUY THIS SYSTEM!

Reviews.Title: Ok, if you can get it to work......
Reviews.Author: Dogloverof5
Reviews.Content: The setup was not a big issue. I had several problems once it was up and going.1st: My laptop can not find the camera wirelessly. I have to keep it connected with an ethernet cable.Logitech still (after a month)can not figure out whats wrong. I gave up on them. I contacted them several times and they finally sent me a new network adapter but that did not work. then I called again and told them it still did not work and the night vision on the camera was not working. They sent me a new camera but I had to wait several weeks for the tech support manager to get this all taken care of. They will not get in a rush or make any special accomadations for customers who have already paid but are having problems.I was told to send back the defective camera and electrical cord. I did. they only sent me a new camera, no electrical cord. So I had to notify them AGAIN and wait even longer for that part.You would just think that a company would take better care of their customers considering how much money we spend on these items..By the way, I gave up on them fixing my camera download issues and wireless issues. I will get outside help to try and figure out what LOGITECH could not.

Reviews.Title: Great For The Money
Reviews.Author: edog
Reviews.Content: Exceptional video quality compared to the top of the line Q-See system I replaced.  The only real draw back is in the software.  Unlike other security systems, you cant control playback like a VCR.  So to find a particular event you cant simply scan backwards to the event.  You have to go one by one through the saved clips individually.  This is a huge pain in the butt!!!!  However the video quality, and overall camera quality is such that its still a great buy.  If only logitech would correct the software, so searching the recordings is more on par with other systems.

Reviews.Title: Logitech Alert 750e
Reviews.Author: Dennis Rauba
Reviews.Content: Almost instant gratification.  I purchased this camera to monitor the inside temperature of a second home.  This was done by including a very large digital thermometer in the camera's field of view.  Cost wise this offered more capability for less money in comparison to phone line dial back systems that did alarm reporting for temperature only.  The motion recording offered a secondary feature that enabled watching our dog's behavior when he was left alone.I was pleasantly surprised that the system was truly plug and play.  After determining the location to mount the camera, I was up and running in less than 15 minutes. There was no need to tweak my Netgear DSL Modem/Router.  No problems with the 110V AC outlets used, must have been same phase for camera and router module.  This system is end user friendly.  The only con to this product is if you want to do more remotely than just view with a standard web browser, an annual license fee is required to get the additional software to control the camera and playback recordings.  Picture quality is better than I expected, zoom/pan are digital.  The IR/night mode is very useful for viewing my digital thermometer  at night with no lights on in the house.  Range is approximately 30 feet.Logitech has engineered a great product that eliminates all the problems you read about other brand cameras.  Highly recommend this camera system.My wife perceived the purchase as another toy until the camera enabled viewing a temperature drop from the thermostat setting.  The furnace had failed.  I drove to the second home, called a repairman which prevented freezing temperatures from bursting any water pipes.  This system prevented thousands of dollars in water damage.

Reviews.Title: Works well for me; would like Mac version
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Boyer
Reviews.Content: I bought the master system and installed the external camera about 20' above my driveway.  Installation was incredibly easy, and the camera worked well right away.  It was simple for me to drill a hole through the house at an inconspicuous location and run the flat ethernet cable to the camera, so I didn't need to mount the power supply outdoors.  Since it seemed to work well, I added an indoor camera in another area of the house, and it has also worked flawlessly.The motion detection works well, and I'm receiving email alerts with snapshots when deliveries are made or whenever there's some activity on the driveway.  I live in a rural area so I'm looking forward to catching some pictures of the animals that roam over our lot.Since our internet ISP forces a double-NAT situation, we are unable to set up an externally-accessible web server at our house, so the technique Logitech uses here of pushing updates to their server (when motion is detected) is great for us.  The $79 yearly fee doesn't seem excessive considering that you don't have to constantly have a server running at your house as other systems require.I had some initial trouble with the iPhone app being unable to download recorded clips, but it seems to have "fixed itself" (maybe a problem on the server has been addressed?) and now works every time.The Logitech forum for this product is useful and seems to be monitored by Logitech personnel.  I get the impression that they're actively developing the software and that updates are frequent, which is a good sign.All in all I'm very happy with the system and plan on getting more cameras.  My only gripe is the lack of a Mac application, hence 4 starts instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Impressive product
Reviews.Author: David Wagstaff "Passionate 1"
Reviews.Content: I've had the security cameras for about two months now and just added a third camera today.  They are impressive.The picture quality is very good, but what I find unexpectedly good are all the little features it has.  By remote control from your pc you can adjust the camera up, down, right or left.  I would estimate you can move the viewing by maybe 10% in any direction.  You can zoom in or out, with very good quality.  The motion detector can be adjusted to be more or less sensitive.I have pictures sent to my Blackberry Torch cell phone and email.  This is a very cool feature, but I haven't quiet optimized the number of images sent / motion sensitivity yet.  That is I get a fair number of false motion detections, so with my current settings I get about 4 to 10 images a day.  Of those maybe one or two is an image with human movement.  I believe the other images are sent due to high winds / rain, small animals like cats or squirrels etc. There are a lot of adjustments to minimize the numers sent, motion zone, motion senstivity, seconds of movement etc.My partner has an IPhone and get live streaming images from each of the cameras to his phone. Its cool enough that we show a lot of people this feature.The night vision is another cool feature.  It really does an impressive job.  You can get a good image even at night with or without other lights on.Also impressive is the quality of the pictures at a distance.  We have two of our three cameras on our third floor of our house facing the ground / street. One camera with images of our shed likely 40 or 50 ft from the camera. The other of our driveway again likely 25 to 40 ft range.  The quality is good on both.  Actually the images are even clear into our neighbors yard over 100 ft away.Overall I've been very impressed and have told a bunch of people about it.  I don't have any significant negatives, other than when people are moving the image quality is choppy or blurred. That is the still image is nearly perfect, but it doesn't do very well when the object being videoed is in movement.  This is likely to keep the size of the stored images to a minimum.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera System but pricey
Reviews.Author: BRANDON
Reviews.Content: I love it. It took me longer to find a  place to install the camera, than to hook up the camera. Camera system is great, but the additional cameras are rather expensive. Will purchase two additional cameras if the price drops. Fast shipping. Great product. I can view the camera from my patrol vehicle, my cellular phone, and my home computer. I even recieve alerts when motion is detected. The camera is beneficial to me by changing the response time for my local police. In the event is someone attempts to burglarize my home, my response time is about 3 minutes. If I didn't have a camera, my alarm response time for the police to come to my residence is almost 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional value
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Willis
Reviews.Content: This is the most cost effective CCTV system for homes and small businesses that already have a computer.  It is very easy to set up, has good quality video, and great remote viewing options.  The software that is included turns your PC into a DVR and yet you can continue to use it as a PC!  A full, unbiased review including sample video is at mikes-review dot com.

Reviews.Title: Customer Support non existant!
Reviews.Author: Geebee
Reviews.Content: If Logitech Technical and Customer Support was reliable, this system might be worth it!  It's been over a month for a reply to 3 emails on their website within my account about a cam that went dead after 2 days usage. That's my reason for the 1 star rating. Plus the fact that at times the cams go off line and have to manually power down then re-power the cam.  Not good if your not there!  Look else where for a reliable cam system.

Reviews.Title: Logitech 750E camera system
Reviews.Author: Troy C.
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review to make buyers aware that this system isn't all that good. The cameras alone are very nice!!! The "Alert Commander" software which is used to configure and control the cameras is terrible. It's like Logitech hired the handyman to design the software instead of using a real professional. I don't even think they did the research on what a security software should do out of the box. The software doesn't have the ability to send a five second video clips of an alert. The $100 Linksys cameras have this ability and it works very well. You can't control the times you want to receive alerts. So if you set alerts on any of the cameras, you could get 300 emails a day. You can't assign static IP addresses to any of the cameras. Their IPhone Alert app is a joke. You'd be lucky to have it connect and stream video 30% of the time. That's with all components being updated with the latest firmware and software updates. And when the streaming does work, it's 18 to 30 seconds behind your live video. That's a long delay if there was anything really happening to your home, business or cars. It's like calling the police and saying an intruder broke into my house 30 seconds ago. And the dispatcher asking you "Are they still in the house" and all you can say is "give me 30 seconds and I'll let you know". Buy the time you make the call and the police get out to your house, the intruders will be gone. Or, you get an email saying an alert event found motion on camera 1 which is looking at you cars. You log into the website or use the IPhone app that is 18 to 30 seconds behind and the intruders are gone by the time you get the alert or see the video. This could be a great system if they did a total redesign of their software. Oh, I almost forgot the annual charge of $80 dollars for their software. I would not recommend the product in its current state.

Reviews.Title: worst cameras every
Reviews.Author: ggg
Reviews.Content: i bought this system (2 750e outdoor cameras) for quite a lot of money (not cheap at all) with the intention that i wanted to invest into something for my business that would provide excellent results. Little did I know what i was getting myself into, lots of headaches and much disappointment. I installed the cameras ontop of the roof of my business on both corners, so overlooking the whole shop but out of reach from any unwanted visitors. the area is extremely dangerous so i needed the cameras for security of inventory left out overnight. they worked fine for the first 2-3 months then came the pain. They dont record, you cant view online or in logitech commander, they are pretty much just plastic boxes that are wired up. I thought these were outdoor cameras, when it would get anywhere close to "hot" the cameras would stop working, lets not even talk about snow. I would spend hours with techs support and "all i needed to do is press the reset button" on the underside of the camera...to bad for me that they are completely out of reach. did i mention both cameras are covered so they are not directly exposed to the elements. And then the story begin..every 2-3 days the cameras stop working and after reseting them close to 100 times (which took an hour to grab ladders, wait for logitech to register them, adjust the view) in a 4 month period..i have given up so they are just there not working. and tech support doesn't know why they wont work. So best $1000 spend on plastic boxes ever!!!

Reviews.Title: Good product, awful running software.
Reviews.Author: Zhenshan Huang
Reviews.Content: Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master Security System with Night VisionThe camera and network adapter are solid and well built. Installation is easy and straight forward. Logitech states there are built-in surge protection in the camera power and network adapter, so I just plugged them into the electrical outlet directly. Overall picture quality is good especially during daylight time. Night version works, but not as advertised crystal clear. I used a motion detected night light with the camera to make the nighttime picture a little better. I can watch the live picture via a computer or a smartphone easily. Alerts can be only sent to your registration email. It can't be sent as text message as advertised. I guess it only works if I buy Logitech's rip off extra software. Now, I have to bash the awful software comes with the camera. There is no time control, no angle adjustment nothing else except a simple connecting tool. Logitech should come out with a better written running software for the 750e because I believe most of us don't want to paid the rip off $60 for a software supposedly free.

Reviews.Title: A Lemon from Logitech
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple, the product doesn't deliver what is promised. While the very basic functionality of having a local security camera system usually works (~85-90% of the time?), it is not without many reoccurring issues.-Cameras commonly lose time sync with the Commander PC, making video playback essentially useless (videos show up with completely incorrect timestamps). For instance, if my camera thinks it's the year 2010, I have to go searching back in my stored footage from 2010 to see the video that was JUST recorded. There is no timestamp on the actual video playback to give any clue when your footage is being stored in an incorrect location/date.-The online/remote viewing applications only work about 60-70% of the time. It's great that there is an iPad app, but more often than not, it tells me that I don't have any cameras set up. If I wait long enough for Logitech to pull themselves back together, I can log in without making any changes and it'll work as if there was never an outage at all.-The customer support is a joke. If you're on the fence about a security product, do yourself a favor and check the forums (at [...] ) and see just how many people are being given ridiculous workarounds and apologies for issues that they can't explain.In summary, the camera hardware is nice, but is backed by faulty/problematic firmware. The software that you're supposed to use to monitor/control it is pretty to look at, but unreliable and severely lacking. A common trend that you'll observe in the Logitech support forums is that people that are stuck with these cameras are moving on to a non-Logitech software application to run them (separate licensing fees required). I've been a longtime Logitech customer/fan, and I can say that has ended with this product.

Reviews.Title: Bad motion picture quality
Reviews.Author: E. Zolghadr "EZ"
Reviews.Content: I am returning my camera because the picture of moving objects is fuzzy beyond recognition even with lights on, indoor or outdoor at night or indoors during the day. This is a real deal breaker for me. The video has very long lag since the motion detector kicks in. Subject can be out of the scene by then. Overall it has very limited applications if it takes good pictures of stationary objects only under sun light and not a clear one from moving objects. The software is also buggy and hangs while downloading from the camera even with my computer on! I liked the idea of not running the wires and using power outlet but this is not the solution. Not to mention the blinking lights or paid internet access. I'll keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Definitely has its pros and cons
Reviews.Author: D. Hardaway "dhardawa"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera to use for a small business my parents own.  Unfortunately, the building is old and didn't have outside power outlets (this is totally my fault, I should have checked first).  Considering the wiring nightmare we could have, I eventually installed it at my home.ProsThe picture quality during the day time is amazing.  I was expecting the kind of video you often see on police shows where you can't tell what anything really is.  The picture quality from this camera is much better than anything I have seen on outdoor monitoring equiptment.  I also love the zoom option.  The night vision quality wasn't nearly as good, but was still okay.The system didn't require a lot of technical knowledge to setup.  I was pretty worried that I'd have a lot of issues with compatibility, hardware, etc., but it was pretty simple.  You definitely don't need to be technologically savvy to install this.Being able to stream the live video to a cell phone is a great feature.  It allows the owner to be able to monitor even when away from the home computer.  For a business owner or someone trying to monitor someting happening at their home, this is priceless technology.It is great that you can shut down the PC and still record video.  The camera will store approximately 2 weeks of footage on its internal memory.  This means you can go on vacation and, if necessary, view what happened while you were gone when you return home (or watch while you're gone if you leave your computer on).ConsMy house has two outdoor outlets.  The one in the back has the filter to my fish pond plugged into it.  The camera requires an outlet where it is the only thing plugged in.  I can't unplug the fish pond filter or my fish will die.  The outlet in the front of my house faces south and is in the direct sun.  There is nothing else plugged in there, so the dedicated outlet part is fine, but Logitech recommends not using an outlet in direct sun.  So, essentially, both my outlets were unusable.  I eventually had to run a long cord from the front to the back to plug in the fish pond and use the back outlet.  I had wanted to monitor the front of my house, but since that outlet was out and the camera has to be close to the plug, I was stuck using it in the back of the house.If you want to monitor your video feed from a remote computer, you have to pay $80 a year for Commander.  This is a big con for me and a lot of other people.  I'd like to be able to monitor from other places, but the only way to do it is through my phone which eats up data time for people not on an unlimited data plan.  But, I'm not about to start paying $80 a year for it.I have two cameras installed and can't find a way to view both feeds at the same time using the software.  I'm not sure if this is just because I can't figure it out or because the software doesn't allow it.I had issues finding a location for the Home Plug.  It has to plug directly into the wall near your computer.  I have a zillion things plugged into all the outlets near my computer.  It can't go into a surge protector either.  So, I was left, again, running additional cords from outlets farther away to plug other things into to free up an outlet.  I don't like that at all.So, while the camera has a lot of good features and places where it excels, there is also a lot of room for improvement.  My biggest issues were really with the power supplies and all the rules around where they could and could not be plugged in.  Most people don't have an infinite number of outlets (especially outside) that can meet all the criteria necessary to use this camera.

Reviews.Title: A Change Of Heart!
Reviews.Author: V. ADEYANJU
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: After my last review I have a change of heart. Surprising some of the flaws that I pointed out was actually patched with the latest update. I just wanted to point this out and not leave something negative to deter people from the product when the problem has been fixed I will be providing a full update later, but so far so good.I know a lot of you all really like this camera, and I don't want to seem in any way as a hater. But these are by far the worst cameras I have ever purchased. I just had to write a review because it is not fair to those who don't know any better go through the pain and misery that I went through with this camera. I have familiarity with security cameras I have both the Panasonic BB-HCM371A Outdoor Wireless Network Camera, and Sharx Security SCNC3605 Wireless Weatherproof Outdoor MPEG4 IP Network Camera with Infrared Night Vision and built in DVR. Both in my opinion are very good line of cameras. Only cons are that the Panasonic worthless in low or no lighting just terrible plain and simple. As for the Sharx its a beast only problem is setting up remote access is a nightmare very very difficulty especially if you already have multiple devices that have remote access as I do lots of conflict. Back to the Logitech at first glance you think wow brand name they make great keyboards mouse tv remotes ext. Can't go wrong. That's where I was mistaken setting up the camera was simple but i failed to run a motion detection test on it before I mounted the thing. Boy was it horrible, the memory card was in the device but this camera failed to pick up any motion until i stood  completely still in front of the thing for ten sec then it recorded wow not good! I tired changing the motion detection threshold sensitivity there wasn't even a setting for that!  Furthermore it took multiple tries to connect to the camera from the computer I'm like why is this thing loading for five minutes looking for the ip camera. Next I figured it was an update issue this thing would never even update the device, and on my third try the camera went totally unresponsive for three hours. After that experience I have a lot respect for the job Panasonic did on their line even though I have to keep my home lights on at night Sharx too very much respect. I just letting you all know I read some reviews maybe I was given a bad camera or something or this is a lot of people's first camera but I'm here set the record straight these are not the way security cameras should function!

Reviews.Title: Logitech Quality - with excellent night vision - easy to set up!
Reviews.Author: Scott Anderson "Sharpsburg"
Reviews.Content: I installed this camera two weeks ago before a business trip and the entire process took less than 40 minutes.  I installed the camera under an overhang on my window ledge and it did come in contact with all sorts of weather and never failed me once.I also installed the interior camera and was able to keep an eye on my family as I was a state away.  I even spoke to the them over the phone and was able to see the excitement on my daughters face when she smiled into the camera to show me her first lost tooth.  I also enjoyed the night vision on the the external camera and it picked up the slightest details over 100 yards away.The images on my laptop, iPad, and Droid phone have been crisp with incredible video quality.  Three simple steps of installing software, setting up the cameras and then plugging in the wireless Ethernet connector had me up and running.  Both camera installations were very straightforward and with easy to follow directions.I then downloaded the iPad and Droid app and hooked up both systems and had a blast keeping an eye on my property.  I hope they set up the app in HD format so it will apply to the iPad without having to 2x the image.The cameras can best set for a variety of settings and both come with memory cards and software needed to get everythign squared away.  I liked that as soon as something crossed the path of the camera it started to record, and then I could play that back over my phone or iPad.I am very, very impressed with the build quality, design and ease of installation.  I highly recommend this camera system to anyone that needs video coverage without the hassle of professional setup.

Reviews.Title: LOGITECH ALERT 750e OUTDOOR MASTER SECURITY SYSTEM - Pro system for consumers
Reviews.Author: Dean Redfern
Reviews.Content: I cannot get over how easy it is to set up the hardware and software for this security system.  Plug in the camera to your home network, install the software, and up pops the live video feed on your computer.  The more difficult task is figuring out where to permanently locate the camera for everyday use.The picture quality is beautiful HD, both night and day.  Using the Commander software, the camera picture can be panned, zoomed or moved around.  Live feeds are recorded for easy and intuitive timeline playback on a computer, and there is a motion-detector feature for snap shots of changes that are occurring in the camera's viewing area.This consumer security system might be better than some professional systems that are more costly and complex to install.  And the backup system might be better as well, as it stores the video feeds in a microSD card when your PC is offline, and then automatically loads the video back into the security software when your computer is back up.The LOGITECH ALERT 750e OUTDOOR MASTER SECURITY SYSTEM is smartly engineered; it is easy and intuitive to set up and use; it has excellent HD picture quality and software tools; and it is a terrific way to enhance security at home or work without the use of an outside professional.

Reviews.Title: A really nice system that's easy to install and fun to use.
Reviews.Author: Dennis Hawley
Reviews.Content: I'm not particularly tech-minded, so the first plus to cite is the ease of installation and connection.  Everything is quite intuitive, requiring no laying of cables or other time-consuming additional tasks.  It took less than 30 minutes to have it ready.  The graphical user interface is very nice, with ample features and is a breeze to use, allowing for customization.  It has an alert system that is triggered by motion detection, and once configured (via setting up an account), images can be viewed remotely from anywhere via the web.  The quality of the cameras themselves is surprisingly good, and the image quality is among the best I've seen (which displays up to 720p high-def), as well as providing pretty good night imaging capabilities.  An outdoor camera and indoor camera are included, and additional cameras can be installed easily and quickly  There are several camera mounting options for most any situation as well.I am still in the learning phase of this system, but so far, there are few negatives (but there are a couple).  The cables could have been a bit more substantial; they don't seem as 'heavy duty' as might be expected, especially the cable for the outdoor camera.  Another potential concern is that the alerts are filtered through Logitech's website.  Whether this suggests security and privacy problems is unknown, but it does give pause.All in all, this is a quality security system that is easy to install, provides excellent imaging quality, the convenience of alerts which allow viewing anywhere and is solidly constructed.  So far, I have been most impressed with the Logitech Alert 750e.  It may be a bit pricey, but it does what it says!

Reviews.Title: Not reliable - warranty not valid, bad support
Reviews.Author: J. Axup
Reviews.Content: These cameras were fairly easy to set up and initially worked well. I bought two for different parts of the house.However, after 1 month one of the cameras silently stopped working.I found out 2 months later when it became clear that no video had been recorded for months.These cameras are designed poorly and don't notify you if they stop working.After calling support, they wanted me to first send them the defective unit. Several weeks later I received a new unit back. (they should be sending a replacement unit first since this is a security system and downtime isn't acceptable.)The new replacement unit didn't work at all. So these cameras are not reliable or have quality issues in general.I asked for a refund for all of the cameras I had purchased since they all work on the same system.They refused. Logitech says that only the one nonfunctional camera can be refunded even though I now have half a security camera system.Logitech has apparently gone downhill as a company and no longer attempts to keep customers happy or has reasonable support processes. Unfortunately I am no longer buying Logitech products as a consequence.

Reviews.Title: As a camera it's OK.  I have some comments
Reviews.Author: justMongo "In God We Trust.  All Others We Mo...
Reviews.Content: You can run this camera without a master system by using a PoE port in your switch or router.The camera cannot be accessed via an HTTP(S) interface.  You must use Logitech's Commander SW.  Their software will load every version of the .NET framework known to man in all possible languages.  Plus, it will load InstallShield -- a real PITA SW item that's difficult to uninstall.  The Commander SW is a bloated pig.There are two RTSP streams available.  One is HighResolutionVideo and the other is named LowResolutionVideo.  You can port forward the RTSP stream in your router.  The local RTSP port is 554.  You will need either a DYNDNS alias or a fixed IP address for your internet.  Fix the local IP address using DHCP reservation.

Reviews.Title: Dead out of the Box
Reviews.Author: Laranzu
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera system due to a large amount of car break ins recently. Ran all the cabling, plugged everything in...and the camera wouldn't boot or hard reset. Apparently this happens fairly often.

Reviews.Title: Good product...when it works.  Terrible service!
Reviews.Author: John Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I have a four camera system.  When it is working, it is great. I'm able to view online and on my smartphone, and set up was as simple as plugging them in.On the downside, I have had 3 cameras replaced under warranty (out of 4 total) in less than a year.  Logitech's customer service is awful.  They don't follow through, they don't remember what they promised, and they have replaced product with other broken product.  The Web Commander software is buggy and unreliable, and the support offers very little support for the software other than to say to wait for the next version release.I would not buy another Logitech product based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: Logitech needs to really fix this product
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: This is the third system I have attempted to install in a home. It is really hit or miss, and the system still has some bad design issues. For one, if you decide to purchase this product, you will face challenges on getting to work out of the box. The system commander will not find the camera(s) if you connect the power supply to a power strip or surge protector, or even an extension cord. There is still a possibility that the system software will not find the camera if you follow these guidelines.The camera has a flaw in that if its firmware gets corrupted, there is no way to fix it through an alternate means to the network interface such as usb. I have been through hours of troubleshooting with Logitech tech support, only to find that the camera firmware became badly corrupted after the system commander informed me that there was a firmware update available for the camera. At that point, the only solution is to return the product to the seller, or try and work with Logitech to exchange the camera. Logitech will not send out a replacement until they receive the damaged camera, so you can expect a few weeks to go by before you can even hope of getting your system on line again. I have just opted to return the system for a refund.

Reviews.Title: received broken equipment and have had no assistance getting it repairs or replaced.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: received broken equipment and have had no assistance getting it repairs or replaced. very unhappy with purchase corrected. M S

Reviews.Title: Cam never worked
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: Cam never worked so not a lot to review about this product except for the fact that you may have to deal with returning a non working unit.

Reviews.Title: Sold refurbished product as new.  Watch out!!!
Reviews.Author: Mike Song
Reviews.Content: The seller sold refurbished as new. When I opened the box, the packed seemed to be reused. While I was setting up the camera, the system indicates the camera is pre-owned and asked me to overwrite the ownership, which confirmed that they give me a pre-owned system buy marketed as new.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Oakes
Reviews.Content: ease of instillation and quality product. I have already recommended to friend. night vision works great as well as day time. watch out for double pane glass with suction cup mount.

Reviews.Title: Not Reliable and Very Expensive
Reviews.Author: J. Reihsen "OleJim"
Reviews.Content: After 26 months with this system, my experience is as follows:Pros:Good picture qualityEasy set upCompatible with IOS and AndroidCons:Incompatible with Windows PhoneSlow smartphone startup.  Improved somewhat from with a software update, but still too slow to use to check for who is at the door, even if the app is already running on the phone.Unreliable: This is the killer.  A few months ago, the camera bridge unit had to be replaced after a power outage.  Logitech replaced it, after about 2 hours of effort with tech support.  The same thing happened again, and now it is out of warranty, so no replacement.  No other electronics in the home were damaged, so it is NOT any kind of power surge.In summary, this is far too expensive for this kind of reliability issue.DO NOT BUY IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: great customer support
Reviews.Author: scottdsw
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 of the cameras for 4 months now.  The installation was very easy with the included software.  Cannot understand the negative reviews of customer service.  When the 2 cameras arrived, the master camera had a bad power supply adapter, I phoned customer service, spoke with someone from tech support immediately, and after a 5 minute diagnostic sequence to be sure all was connected well, he mailed a new one to me immediately, and it was received in 2 days, with no issues, and has worked perfectly since.  They sent very polite emails as well, to confirm that I was satisfied with everything.For casual use, to keep an eye around the house, the cameras work perfectly.  I like the way an SD card can be placed, so that the cameras do not need to be attached to the computer always, and will still download video and upload it to the computer at a later time.The major negative I can see, is the size of the cameras.  They are not stealthly at all, and are quite noticeable.  If someone were to break into our home, the cameras are easily visible, and easy to steal along with any other items, along with the SD card recording them which is in the camera itself.  The camera can be quasi hidden in a bookcase, but the cord attaching them to the electrical outlet is a giveaway.  But, it is still a great camera recording system, easy to install, excellent software, great image quality, and viewable from the internet.  To have a 2-4 camera system is good, but if more cameras are needed, I think I would go the route of smaller hidden cameras, and a DVR system.

Reviews.Title: Used Equipment
Reviews.Author: Mack
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to get the above unit.  The first unit didn't work, so they sent me a twice one.  Which was used and didn't work also.  Both units were returned for a refund.  One unhappy customer

Reviews.Title: I have this system....I would NOT do it again.
Reviews.Author: Penn State "Online Addict"
Reviews.Content: I bought this system 2 years ago.  I have 6 camera monitoring the perimeter of my 7,000 sq/ft house.  I initially got it because it was 720p, remote viewing that's FREE, and networking over home electrical wires.  I spent $1K to have an electrician install the system.  You're going to need one to come run an outlet to wherever you're going to mount the camera.  I had them mounted under overhangs (Which is also the recommended installation location because, although it's an outdoor camera, they don't want direct sunlight hitting the camera.) of the roof. The electricians went up to the attic and wired additional outlets close enough to plug in the camera.  The convenience of using home electrical for your networking sounds good in theory but not so great in real life.  Unless your house is perfectly wired or very small or both, this is a poor solution because if you can't get good signal strength from the camera to the receiver your live videos will be VERY choppy at best and NO video at worst.  Appliances and a host of other things that can and will cause interference that will further degrade your signal strength.  Google "electrical noise".Even though I have it mounted as recommended, I've already had 1 camera stop working that needed to be replaced.  I've had to climb up to the attic a few times to reset the cameras because it won't connect.  Sometimes it's because it needed a hard reboot to connect, and others, it's because of a power outage and one or a few of the cameras were trying to connect to one of the other cameras because it thinks that one is the receiver. <--atleast that's what I read.I've also had to climb up a 2 story ladder a few times to replace the microSD cards because they've gone bad.  I guess all the writing and overwriting chews through the generic 2 GB cards they provided.  If you still decide to get this system even after reading my review, do yourself a favor and get the largest reliable microSD card and install it so it doesn't go bad as quick because it's not cycling/rewriting through the memory cards as much.  It might save your life, as a fall from 2 stories up carrying a drill and replacing a memory card the size of a fingernail isn't fun, especially if you're not a fan of heights.On the plus side, the RECORDED video quality (color and clarity) is relatively good compared to other cameras.  The ability to view online without knowing anything about computer networking is a plus also.  I just would never get a powerline system line this again as it's too unreliable.  I bought the Foscam Wireless PTZ ones for the inside of my house and like those much better.  The quality of the video isn't 720P, but it's alot more reliable...and the ability to pan is nice.  If another of the Logitech Alerts goes down and needs to be replaced, I'm going to replace all of them with a new wireless system.  If I get a weak signal wirelessly, all I have to do is install a repeater.

Reviews.Title: Here's the story...
Reviews.Author: Trolliolio
Reviews.Content: First off,  I wanted a camera to keep inside my apartment because I am one of those rather have it and not need it than need it and not have it people.  I also have no fantastic networking or computer skills. That being said:took out camera and followed the instructions to a T.  Camera did not work and received "powerline network adapter problem" and was not able to continue.  I called the IT services and they were able to get the camera running and online so long as the ethernet "blue wire" was plugged from the adapter to my computer not the router and that the problem I needed to resolve lied within my router.  So who the hell wants a camera that only works if it is tethered to your computer?  Considering what I was told I reset my router by pushing the tiny little button in the back with a paperclip. (doing this caused a whole lot more issues like losing the password so only my wife and I can use wireless etc.)  This worked and the camera is online and doing it's job well.Long story short:  Great picture and night vision so long as you have the patience to keep at it and get it up and running.  My only issues w/ this set up was the jumping through hoops to get it set and that the video store is only on my laptop when the laptop is in the apartment or it is in the actual camera.  Now if I was a thief, the first thing I would do would be take the damn camera and laptop as well as everything else that wasn't nailed down.  If i was away, and had enough cell phone service, i would recieve an email, be able to watch my things being stolen, and possibly be able to call the police but if they got away, that'd be all she wrote.  There may be a way to resolve this but I havn't figured it out yet.Solid camera, watches my apartment faithfully, good picture and great nightvision for my size apartment.  Wish it was plug in and play like advertised, need to figure out the video storage issue.  I plan on adding more camera's onto the system so obviously i like it enough to drop more money into it.  Hope that helps

Reviews.Title: LOGITECH ALERT SYSTEM - SAVE YOUR MONEY BUY SOMETHING ELSE
Reviews.Author: J. Michael Rivera "Riv"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an unrelaible system that has to be continuously reset and you enjoy spending time on the phone with customer service this system is for you!!!!!!!When working the daytime picture quality is good.  Night vision camera quality is very poor, you will not be able to identify anyone at night with this system.When needed the system always seems to have a problem and does not always record.  Moving a camera is also a big problem, you will need to reconfigure network and it alwys seems to have ip address problems.The system does not always record and they tell you to go unplug the camera and see if that works. Once you reset and it is working they feel they have fixed the problemIn some case the software indicates their is recorded data but when you go to play the video it says not recording at this time.I definately would not use this system in a commercial application, and I am very frustrated using this system for my home.  If you are going to have more than one camera I would look into a more reliable system that uses cat5 home run to a DVR and then into your PC.  Samsung and LG have some nice package systems.I am most certain most of the positive reviews of the Logitech Alert System on this site are form users that have only had the system for 30 days or less.  I liked the system and thought it was nice the first 30 days, but after all the time reseting, calling customer service ect I would definetyly look into something else.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Casey Holmes
Reviews.Content: I should have bought something else.These cameras are very choppy.As in, the video is not "smooth".I am getting about one image per 3-4 seconds. This is terrible.I have a $2000 brand new PC and all my equipment is well above the ratings on the boxes of the system.what we paid for this choppy terrible system that drops cameras half way through the night I could have easily put together something with much higher quality video and doesn't drop pictures and chop video footage all day and all night.We're sick of having to unplug and replug wires and connectors and wall boxes every day to make the cameras work. We feel they should work and stay working, but they don't. they always fall offline and need to be replugged etc.What if we take a vacation? The cameras will go offline and be down the entire time! BOGUS!I just joined the logitech forum but so far I've already tried all the answers in there that I could search up. I just started a new thread for myself on this issue.Will update if things get better, but i don't see how they will.I would highly recommend you go purchase a professional hard wired system and don't waste your money on this junk. Sure the picture may be clear and HD, but what does that help if you aren't actually recording video smoothly more like taking one picture every 4 seconds.I regretted this purchase the first time I plugged the cameras in but I thought I would try to work with them and give them a chance and I still think they are junk. I have about $700 invested into this system and should have totally bought something else. Feel free to ask me any questions you may have with my system and I will do the best to answer them.Please, don't buy this.Look at what all the other people had to go through to get it working right.this is a shoddy system that needs much improvement and lags worse than a yahoo chatroom full of booters or a warcraft server on dial up.So sorry I bought this system.also, the one time I needed it to record somebody stealing something from our mail box, it chopped and missed the thief even touching my mail box!The police think I'm a lunatic now because I can't show them proof the guy was in our mailbox!!!Seriously, you won't be happy with this system!I went out and bought a $34 color CCD camera from Harbor Freight and plugged it into a Ebay USB video recorder for an additional $15 and I'm getting much better reliability now!Again, very sorry I bought this system. =(I bought it to have a monitor outside our house and record for reasons like this and it's not helping us at all, cost way too much money for this quality too.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: LBertelli
Reviews.Content: I don't think you could identify a face, but the system is more cost effective than running wires to cameras.

Reviews.Title: Tried Several; this was the best
Reviews.Author: J. Ray
Reviews.Content: I've tried 3-4 different cameras and after getting this one, I installed 4 around my house and plan to get two more.  Its night vision might seem weak until I walk outside and see how dark it really is, then I think wow, this thing sees pretty good at night. In addition, one of the battery doors got damaged (my fault) and they have replacement parts, but instead replaced my whole camera in a timely manner with out any hassel. It is a quality built camera with everything you need to use it.

Reviews.Title: Wow, wow, WOW!
Reviews.Author: Harry "HAS"
Reviews.Content: Just yesterday I installed Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master Security System with Night Vision for a friend of mine at his place of business. He called a "professional" in who charged him thousands of dollars for a system that was less than good. He asked me what I could do. After hours of research I decided to give the above system a try. First, I want to say that Logitech's techs are truly competent. They not only answered all my pre-sales questions, but afterward always answered the phone within 5 minutes when I had a technical question.The cameras are up and the command software installed and I am ASTOUNDED at the image quality and color faithfulness of the cameras. The software is so easy to install and is very user-friendly. The hardware couldn't be easier to set up. You simply mount the camera on the bracket that is supplied and plug in the phone cord that attaches to the 110 volt power source. The "HomePlug" networking uses our existing electrical wiring and outlets to transmit video around your home or in my case small business. I can't imagine any system being easier.The video quality is outstanding! The outdoor daylight image looks like a handheld video camera. Indoors is equally as impressive. It works on existing light, but even in pitch black darkness the infrared shows very acceptable quality.  I was just viewing a warehouse bay that is black and yet the infrared camera is showing the entire image field in great detail (B&W;).One of the great features of this software is that the cameras can be viewed LIVE from any computer or internet phone. The camera automatically records video when it detects motion. If you ask the system to "alert" you, it will send your smart phone a snapped image of what caused the camera to start recording. If your "command center" loaded on your computer is not up because your computer shut down, the camera still records the movement to your microSD card even when you computer is shut off. When viewing your history or archived video, you can even zoom the image in or out remotely from your computer or smart phone. It may not be the least expensive do-it-yourself system, but it is hard to imagine any system being better or EASIER.Honestly, for the first time in my life I wish I could give 10 stars....

Reviews.Title: Poor
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Since I installed the cameras (2) one has not worked and tech support spends a lot of time with me on the phone but still not working.

Reviews.Title: It's a junk - not any more
Reviews.Author: Wei Tan "Trooper"
Reviews.Content: I spent so much time trying to make it work but it has been not for me. Countless hours with tech support, rebooting, resetting, unplug/replug...., the Commander software simply could not find the camera. Very frustrated. So do yourself a favor do not buy this flaw saturated product.Ok things are different now. After I posted the above negative comment a QA manager named Tom from Logitech contacted me and helped with a few more testings. At the end we kinda concluded that it was a defective camera, perhaps the camera was overly sensitive to temperature change. That explained why it was ok every reboot and then went dark after an hour or so. He transferred the case to a Logitech corporate staff Eric who sent me a replacement set immediately. I replaced the camera and the two internet over power line adaptors, did not even re-install the software, the camera was found by the Commander software very quickly - faster than before. It's been up ever since! I receive reliable alerts, am able to view live video online, only issue now is that I cannot view live video with my Verizon LTE 4G phone because the app runs out of memory as soon as you run it.Overall I'm a happy customer now. I guess I'd give a 5-star if Logitech has a way to detect if it's a defective unit when I contacted tech support, rather than try this outlet or that outlet or reboot the whole system - that's tedious and time consuming.

Reviews.Title: Read before buying!
Reviews.Author: Tim Bishop
Reviews.Content: I had the old wilife system and it was clunky and unreliable.  Ultimately I abandonned it.  After a couple years I had a need for a single camera system so I decided to give the latest logitech security camera system another try.  I haven't yet been able to test it out because when the software loads it defaults to writing its files in the all users account but then, because that is not an administrator account it won't load, displays an error message and closes.I'm sort of baffled that a company like logitech would build such an obvious flaw into its software.  I've (painfully) written to tech support (you have to create a user account and practically give them a dna sample to ask a question) and will update this review when/if I hear from them.Until there is a fix, however, I would not buy this product if you have more than one user account on your system.Updated 1/5/13 - Logitech Support has responded with further questions.  Will update the review as solutions are attempted.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre picture and poor for internet viewing,
Reviews.Author: Richard Fisher "Louisiana Audiophile"
Reviews.Content: After the two glowing reviews I was expecting a very good Hi Def picture with good internet viewing capability. No and No! The picture provided by this system is mediocre at best. The resolution via the internet is just plain poor and in my opinion it could not be used for identifying anyone. You have a basic internet video connection that comes standard with the master system which provides a very poor picture. Of course you can subscribe to the Logitech service for a fee and have a slightly better poor picture and camera/audio controls. I did the 7 day trial subscription and it is not without bugs (like "cannot find camera", et).So what's the upside....it is easy to set-up and uses your home electrical system for the wiring (yes, all cameras have to be plugged into an outlet). I'm looking for a system that actually has a high quality picture and this is not it.Not recommended for internet viewing, actually not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: PowerLine adaptors are not strong! Update Jan 14, 2012
Reviews.Author: Dennis Shumaker
Reviews.Content: I installed a 700e on front door when I bought the master 750e system.750e is the name of the system NOT the camera. The camera is 700e.The powerline adapter is in front of house as well in the room next to the front door.Two complaints:1) camera lens is NOT fast - even daylight and good contrast and lighting I get occasional blurry pictures.This is a SLOW lens!2) night vision is not affective most of the time because I get a white flash on people for 2 seconds.the flash covers nearly all the screen and then it refocuses. But by that time we are almost already in the house.So I added a Infrared illuminator (850nm, dont buy 940nm) This helps a great deal.3) so, really Logictech should have put in double the amount of IR leds !!!  There is not enough in their camera!!OTHER, much bigger problem is the addon, the 700e addon I was hoping to monitor my garage.I routed 12 gauge (thicker wire) from fuse panel in garage to the back of the garage.So the distance to the fuse panel is much closer from garage door camera than front door camera.I get a acceptable picture in live view. I get picture snapshots sent to my email of decent quality.But video does not get uploaded to my computer.Running diagnostics show powerline value of 29 on garage door cameras. Evidently this should be 100 minimum.The front door camera gets 160.Evidently the Powerline adapter is NOT strong enough to drive all the ground wire in my home.Two story, 2600 sq feet. So It has a foot print of a 1 story building at about 1300sq feet.The powerline adapter is quite far to the fuse panel in the garage. Three times as far than thegarage door camera is to the panel.I think HomePlug spec should re-architect itself to include multiple powerline adapters.Clearly ONE adapter is not strong enough to drive the entire home's ground wire !!!Very disappointed with this ground wire HomePlug technology !Setup was very easy.====================================================================================================================Update Jan 14, 2012 - I changed the rating from 1 to 3 stars.ONEthe adaptor needs to be put in an outlet that is as close to the fuse panel as possible !!all the rooms in my house have separate loops and each go to a circuit breaker in the fuse panel.So the camera that uses one of the loops sends its signal to the fuse panel via the power wireit then traverses the bus bar to the fuse breaker of the the loop where my router is locatedMy powerline performance skyrocketed to nearly 190 for all cameras! Previously the camera with the worst performance  was the one with the largest distance from the adaptor and from the fuse panel in the garage. It was as low as 80 - very marginal !TWOnight time vision improved greatly by adding a separate wide angel 840nm infrared illuminatorthe IR lamps in the camera are not strong enoughwhen any bald headed guy, armadillos, or people with white clothes walk in front the auto sense in the camera cant adjust and it gets a 2-3 second white flas. This does happen with the IR illuminator next to the camera.THREEIt certainly does have a bad lens and a bad focus system!The resolution is greatly lost when zooming in!!  Extremely grainy- hard to focus lock. Especially if the wind is moving the feeder somewhat.I know this because I put the camera on a tri pod and used it to watch birds in the backyard.Even in best lighting conditions the video of the birds was HORRIBLE !I would gladly pay a 50% premium for high resolution and especially a better/faster lens!  f/2 or f/2.8 would be greatI suspect this is f/8 or f/10 ?  Its very bad. I cant find info on it. Maybe they are hiding it?This is sad, since I work from sometimes and it would be kool to watch birds eat from the feeders.Picture is much better if you dont zoom - quality drops off fast and large when you zoom in more - full zoom and pic is very horribleFOURDont plug in cameras and especially powerline adaptor into a surge protector - very badWhen the powerer goes out in my home from time to time, the cameras dont all come upEspecially if you use a powered ethernet switch for the powerline adaptorIts best to have direct connections to the routerand better yet have your router, cameras, and powerline adaptor on a battery backup !!!I went on vacation to the coast and when I came back I found that the camera was off and not connected to the software!

Reviews.Title: Avoid these cameras like the plague
Reviews.Author: frankkatz
Reviews.Content: After buying 5 cameras, paying an electrician hundreds of dollars to mount and install each of them, and then spending hours with tech support, I now find that these cameras wont work with the way my house is wired for power. I didnt see anything on their web site or any of the advertisements saying that these would only work for certain houses, why not? Why did it take their tech support so long to figure it out? This company is totally incompetent and irresponsible with their marketing of these products and now I am out a lot of money and have holes all over my house that have to be repaired! Buyer beware, I am going to file a complaint with the ftc about this

Reviews.Title: re: cabling
Reviews.Author: S. desarno
Reviews.Content: both camera and power adapter only accommodate logitech flat ribbon cable. so if you thought you were going to run your camera out from your house with that spare 100' cat 5 you have, it's not going to work.  you have to buy proprietary logitech cable, which is available on logitech's online store.

Reviews.Title: product did not meet expectations, or claimed capabilities
Reviews.Author: Douglas B Kent
Reviews.Content: product box arrived battered and beaten, instructions were missing, cd-rom software was missing, the camera would not stay connected to the network, kept dropping connection.

Reviews.Title: stop working!
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Govea
Reviews.Content: It worked great for the first week but soon after those 7 days it just stop working , nothing else to say

Reviews.Title: Quit working after a few months.
Reviews.Author: Rambo Mom
Reviews.Content: This was just what I was needing for added security in my home.  We installed them and they worked great - for a couple of months.  Then one of the cameras quit working.  I'm not happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Without the service, it's not as good.
Reviews.Author: Greg Sefton
Reviews.Content: Camera works as advertised, but without the 80 bucks a year service, you can't do anything with it.  Turn alerts on/off, set areas, input motion settings, etc.  nothing...  They should be more clear on that.

Reviews.Title: Jewel Thief Caught!
Reviews.Author: John McNeil
Reviews.Content: "This is incredible!, where did you get this, how much is it"? chuckled the police officer as he viewed the video captured of the thief going through my wife's jewelry box. "Case closed"! He said as he prepared the arrest warrant for the young thief. Four and half months in jail (a nice place to spend the summer) I hope will put an end to a lifetime of crime.I bought the system with three cameras, as a lark mostly. A friend had asked me if I knew anything about video security systems. I did some research and came up with this system.Just as a test, I placed two cameras facing the yard and one in the house before I left for a short trip to Florida. When I returned, I viewed the images captured on the SD chips. I expected to capture images in the yard, but had no expectation of capturing any video in the house. But there he was! Reviewing the yard cameras, I got full vision of the thief's comings and goings and his MO.I have since set up the system to view online and send email alerts to motion, which would have been nice had I done this before my trip. I have also installed another system at my summer house. I can view both locations from my account on the alert.logitech.com website. The beauty of this system is that you can set it up with advanced capabilities, with or without a computer and over the internet with alert, pan, zoom, sound, or you can simply let the cameras run independently recording motion on the removable SD chip.A real nice feature is the way the system captures motion. The camera records video a few seconds before and after it detects the motion. So you get a full picture of the subject entering and leaving the field of view.I would caution though, remember what goes on the internet stays on the internet. I would avoid pointing the cameras inside your home where it will catch you doing most anything. Who knows though, maybe the NSA will hand out awards on an annual basis!

Reviews.Title: 100% Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Tanya R. S. Muna
Reviews.Content: The Cameras are exactly what I expected.  The new app update allows me to take picture and zoom from mobile devices. Cant wait to see what else is in store.

Reviews.Title: Poor Resolution, no zoom in playback
Reviews.Author: TheSicilian "The Sicilian"
Reviews.Content: I'll give it a 2 because its easy to set up, and has decent resolution if your perps are standing right in front of the camera at close range 1-6 ft. Other than that, the resolution is a joke. I set up a camera to look out to my driveway that's right in front of my kitchen window (open no screen) and it cannot even focus a clear picture of my license plate?! If you get vandalized, car stolen, you cannot go back to the footage and zoom in on faces, plates #'s etc. The picture is blurry and fuzzy once you start getting more than a few feet away, what good is a security system like that? Maybe you can hire a camera crew to follow the perps around at a close range? but then again these are not wireless or Bluetooth, so even that ridiculous option is out. I had to write in because I see all the raves about the resolution, and its poor at any real life distance for a security camera to be. What a joke for such an expensive system with rave reviews on the one thing that actually rates low in the real world performance. PLUS, the system comes with one lousy camera, and its more $ than so many others, plus the extra cameras are almost as much as other systems, more than some. the CS is great, the guys who helped me were available right away, and very helpful and courteous, but its a dam shame the system sucks and is useless for what its supposed to be designed for.Now I have to go shopping again for a system. Oh, and B4 anyone "guess's" that its my monitor, Its NOT. Its a 1920 X 1080 (bluray player) Native Res HP touch Smart 610.

Reviews.Title: the vendor did not sell the package complete, although advertized as "like new"
Reviews.Author: ldsheridan
Reviews.Content: It took several calls for technical assistance to get the camera functioning. Between discovering a missing SIM card and replacing and then working with all the technical stuff, this camera was just "okay".  Does not serve the purpose of watching for the next foal but glad it is not for home surveillance.

Reviews.Title: Ordered 3 times, first 2 were DOA. No LED status = DEAD.
Reviews.Author: M. Jaffe "..."
Reviews.Content: I bought this system along with 2 add-on interior cameras (Logitech 700n Indoor Add-on). I set up the interior cameras with the part of this package that connects to your WiFi router. That was painless and very easy. I started off pleased. Then I tried to install the external camera. It could not be detected by the Alert Commander software used to manage the system. I tried resetting to factory defaults, called Logitech tech support (who were as helpful as they could be) and in the end we determined the camera was a dud. The most important part to stress about this is if the LED status light does not come on -- located on the small silver grill where the microphone is -- it is dead. Do not attempt any further troubleshooting, it's useless. It was the first thing I checked when I got my replacement and to my shock it was also a dud. If I hadn't already set up the two indoor cameras at this point I probably would have started looking for a new camera system. I ordered a 3rd system, and thankfully it worked, was very easy to set up.The software is a bit clunky, but the availability of it on multiple platforms, including mobile, somewhat makes up for it. The recording quality is clear, probably one of the best for the price, but the framerate is frankly poor. Considerable motion blur.Logitech has a unique and consumer-friendly intended technology, but it comes at a premium with the price tag. No extra wires are great, plug in and go is fantastic. But, the overall experience from the standpoint of expecting something to work out of the box was miserable and took weeks of runaround to get it up, especially with that first camera. Not since the early '90s when buying a WiFi card have I had an experience buying DOA hardware like this.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: thomas mincey
Reviews.Content: excellant camera to have this is our second one and would like to purchase more in the furtue if we find at the right price

Reviews.Title: Good functionality, mediocre reliability
Reviews.Author: Captain-Jec
Reviews.Content: My house was broken in and robbed in Oct'12 so I decided to buy surveillance cameras for monitoring while away. Initially I bought from Costco a set of Uniden cameras but immediately realized that its software was mulfunctioning and resolutoin was too poor to be of any real use, therefore returned them. After consulted with friends, I bought a set of Logitech cameras - one 750e outdoor master, one 750n outdoor add-on, and 2 indoor 700n add-ons. Despite the 2x price tag, I was happy with my choice because of its outstanding designed-in features:a) Its unique architecture to use the same electrical power cord to transmit video signals, and display/store the video clips on a regular PC, as long as it connects to the Internet. This eliminates a seperate box that requires massive cables wired to each camera around the house, making wiring and installation so easy.b) Its crystal clear and color-rish video quality and commendable night vision feature.c) Each camera contains a standard microSD card that stores recorded video before transmits it to the PC. This allows user to expand the local storage as memory cards get cheaper and not to worry about Internet being down.d) Miniature size with a good looking design.e) Cloud based monitoring service provided by Logitech (about $70/year extra) to access video clips from anywhere around the world through Internet, right from an iPhone or Android smartphone. (Although in my view the speed to load videos are a bit slow.)Despite of these great features, I only give it a 3 star because I am disappointed by its poor reliability, even just comparing it to a mediocre electronic device. Here is what happened:A few weeks after initial installation, my outdoor 750e camera started to switch itself to night vision mode randomly during day time. I called customer service, who instructed me to do all sort of things to help them diagnose what was the problem. Remember an outdoor camera is to be installed at a place out of reach from ground. I had to schedule time with their technician, then climbed to the top of my roof multple times to push reset button, unplug memory card, reconnect cable, once at a time, in order to exhust all possibilities to prove that the unit is indeed mulfunctioning beyond repair, before a permision for a replacement unit.Not long after, one of the indoor units simply stopped recording videos. Again I had to go through the same routine to help diagnose the problems before Logitech could issue a replacement.I have now re-installed both failed units with Logitech replacements and pray I won't see more failures anytime soon, but I have a feeling I would.I am an engineer by training working in high tech industry and I understand an on-site fix is much more economical than a replacement. Also I admit that Logitech tech support people are professional and trying their best to help. However a failure rate of 50% within first month only indicates either a poor quality-by-design or poor production quality, not to mention the wasted hours of a consumer who paid premium price only to provide free serve to Logitech for their product problems.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: RICHARD KREAM
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality product. Super customer service. Easy to install and use. Best security device to monitor your home ,office and second home or boat

Reviews.Title: Logitech 750E
Reviews.Author: James L. Greene
Reviews.Content: This system worked fine right out of the box as expected. Again Logitech support was no help. I knew how to debug for the bad device more then them. The return policy was a 6 week process of email after email so I gave up and went to Amazon where they had UPS pickup the bad 700E and returned a new one. Amazon was awesome to work with.
